1.text: Blessed is the man / Who does not walk / In the counsel of the wicked, / Nor stand on the path of sinners, / Nor sit in the seat of mockers;

2.text: Rather his delight is in the law of Jehovah, / And in His law he meditates by day and by night.

3.text: And he will be like a tree / Transplanted beside streams of water, / Which yields its fruit in its season, / And whose foliage does not wither; / And everything he does prospers.

4.text: The wicked are not so, / But are like chaff, / Which the wind drives away.

5.text: Therefore the wicked will not stand in the judgment; / Nor the sinners, in the assembly of the righteous.

6.text: For Jehovah knows the way of the righteous, / But the way of the wicked will perish.

1.text: Why are the nations in an uproar, / And why do the peoples contemplate a vain thing?

2.text: The kings of the earth take their stand, / And the rulers sit in counsel together, / Against Jehovah and against His Anointed:

3.text: Let us break apart Their bonds / And cast Their ropes away from us.

4.text: He who sits in the heavens laughs; / The Lord has them in derision.

5.text: Then He will speak to them in His anger, / And in His burning wrath He will terrify them:

6.text: But I have installed My King / Upon Zion, My holy mountain.

7.text: I will recount the decree of Jehovah; / He said to Me: You are My Son; / Today I have begotten You.

8.text: Ask of Me, / And I will give the nations as Your inheritance / And the limits of the earth as Your possession.

9.text: You will break them with an iron rod; / You will shatter them like a potter's vessel.

10.text: Now therefore, O kings, be prudent; / Take the admonition, O judges of the earth.

11.text: Serve Jehovah with fear, / And rejoice with trembling.

12.text: Kiss the Son / Lest He be angry and you perish from the way; / For His anger may suddenly be kindled. / Blessed are all those who take refuge in Him.

1.text: Jehovah, how many are my adversaries! / Many are those who rise up against me!

2.text: Many are those who say of my soul, / There is no salvation for him in God! Selah

3.text: But You, O Jehovah, are a shield around me, / My glory and the One who lifts up my head.

4.text: With my voice I call out to Jehovah, / And He answers me from His holy mountain. Selah

5.text: I lay down and slept; / I awoke, for Jehovah sustains me.

6.text: I will not fear the myriads of the people / Who have set themselves against me all around.

7.text: Arise, O Jehovah; / Save me, O my God! / Oh that You would strike all my enemies on the cheek; / And break the teeth of the wicked.

8.text: Salvation is of Jehovah: / Your blessing be upon Your people. Selah

1.text: When I call out, answer me, / O God of my righteousness; / Make room for me when I am in straits; / Be gracious to me and hear my prayer.

2.text: O sons of men, how long will my glory be made a reproach? / How long will you love vanity, will you seek a lie? Selah

3.text: But know that Jehovah sets apart the faithful man for Himself. / Jehovah hears when I call out to Him.

4.text: Be angry, yet do not sin; / Consider in your heart upon your bed, / And be silent. Selah

5.text: Offer sacrifices of righteousness, / And trust in Jehovah.

6.text: Many are those who say, Who will show us any good? / Lift up upon us the light of Your countenance, O Jehovah.

7.text: You have put joy in my heart, / More than when the grain and new wine of others abound.

8.text: In peace I will both lie down and sleep, / For You alone, O Jehovah, cause me to dwell in safety.

1.text: To my words give ear, O Jehovah; / Consider my moaning.

2.text: Give heed to the sound of my cry, / My King and my God; / For to You do I pray.

3.text: O Jehovah, in the morning / You will hear my voice; / In the morning I will set forth my words in order to You, / And I will watch.

4.text: For You are not a God who delights in wickedness; / Evil will not sojourn with You.

5.text: Those who boast will not stand / Before Your eyes; / You hate all workers of iniquity.

6.text: You will destroy those who speak lies. / Jehovah abhors a man of bloodshed and deceit.

7.text: But as for me, in the abundance of Your lovingkindness / I will come into Your house; / I will bow down toward Your holy temple / In fear of You.

8.text: O Jehovah, lead me in Your righteousness / On account of those who lie in wait for me; / Make Your way straight before me.

9.text: For there is no truth in their mouth; / Their inward part is corruption itself; / Their throat is an open grave; / They flatter with their tongue.

10.text: Hold them guilty, O God; / Let them fall by their own counsels; / Because of the multitude of their transgressions thrust them out, / For they have rebelled against You.

11.text: But let all who take refuge in You rejoice; / Let them shout for joy forever; / And may You spread a cover over them; / And those who love Your name / Will exult in You.

12.text: For You will bless the righteous man, O Jehovah; / You will surround him with favor as with a shield.

1.text: O Jehovah, do not rebuke me in Your anger, / Nor chasten me in Your burning wrath.

2.text: Be gracious to me, O Jehovah, for I am languishing; / Heal me, O Jehovah, for my bones are shaken,

3.text: And my soul is greatly shaken. / But as for You, O Jehovah, how long?

4.text: Return, O Jehovah; deliver my soul; / Save me for Your lovingkindness' sake.

5.text: For in death there is no remembrance of You; / In Sheol who can give thanks to You?

6.text: I am weary with my groaning; / Every night I cause my bed to swim; / With my tears I dissolve my couch.

7.text: My eye is wasted because of grief; / It has aged because of all those who vex me.

8.text: Depart from me, all you workers of iniquity, / For Jehovah has heard the sound of my weeping.

9.text: Jehovah has heard my supplication; / Jehovah receives my prayer.

10.text: All my enemies will be ashamed and greatly dismayed; / They will turn back; they will be put to shame suddenly.

1.text: O Jehovah my God, in You do I take refuge. / Save me from all who pursue me, and deliver me;

2.text: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, / Tearing it apart without anyone to deliver it.

3.text: O Jehovah my God, if I have done this, / If there is unrighteousness in my hands,

4.text: If I have recompensed with evil him who was at peace with me / (Rather, I have delivered him who vexed me without cause);

5.text: Let the enemy pursue my soul and overtake me, / And let him trample my life to the ground / And lay my glory down in the dust. Selah

6.text: Arise, O Jehovah, in Your anger; / Lift Yourself up against the overflowing wrath of those who vex me, / And awake for me: You have commanded judgment.

7.text: And let the assembly of the peoples surround You, / And over it return on high.

8.text: Jehovah will execute judgment on the peoples; / Judge me, O Jehovah, according to my righteousness / And according to my integrity that is with me.

9.text: Oh, let the evil of the wicked come to an end, / But establish the righteous man. / For the righteous God / Tries the hearts and the inward parts.

10.text: My shield is with God, / Who saves the upright in heart.

11.text: God is a righteous Judge / And a God who has indignation every day.

12.text: If one does not turn, He will whet His sword. / He bends His bow and makes it ready.

13.text: And He prepares instruments of death against him; / He has made His arrows fiery shafts.

14.text: Behold, the evil man travails with iniquity; / He conceives mischief and brings forth falsehood.

15.text: He digs a pit and hollows it out, / Then he falls into the hole that he has made.

16.text: His mischief returns upon his own head, / And upon the crown of his own head his violence comes down.

17.text: I will give thanks to Jehovah according to His righteousness, / And I will sing psalms to the name of Jehovah the Most High.

1.text: O Jehovah our Lord, / How excellent is Your name / In all the earth, / You who have set Your glory over the heavens!

2.text: Out of the mouths of babes and sucklings / You have established strength / Because of Your adversaries, / To stop the enemy and the avenger.

3.text: When I see Your heavens, the works of Your fingers, / The moon and the stars, which You have ordained,

4.text: What is mortal man, that You remember him, / And the son of man, that You visit him?

5.text: You have made Him a little lower than angels / And have crowned Him with glory and honor.

6.text: For You have caused Him to rule over the works of Your hands; / You have put all things under His feet:

7.text: All sheep and oxen, / As well as the beasts of the field,

8.text: The birds of heaven and the fish of the sea, / Whatever passes through the paths of the seas.

9.text: O Jehovah our Lord, / How excellent is Your name / In all the earth!

1.text: I will give thanks to You, O Jehovah, with all my heart; / I will tell out all Your wonders.

2.text: I will rejoice and exult in You; / I will sing psalms to Your name, O Most High.

3.text: When my enemies turn back, / They stumble and perish at Your presence.

4.text: For You have upheld my right and my cause; / You sit on the throne, judging righteously.

5.text: You have rebuked the nations; You have destroyed the wicked; / You have blotted out their name forever and ever.

6.text: The enemies are finished; they are in perpetual ruins; / And You have uprooted their cities; the very memory of them has perished.

7.text: But Jehovah sits enthroned forever; / He has established His throne for judgment.

8.text: And it is He who judges the world with righteousness; / He executes judgment on the peoples with equity.

9.text: And Jehovah is a high retreat for the oppressed, / A high retreat in times of distress.

10.text: And those who know Your name put their trust in You, / For You have not forsaken those who seek You, O Jehovah.

11.text: Sing psalms to Jehovah, the Inhabitant of Zion; / Declare His deeds among the peoples,

12.text: For He who avenges bloodshed remembers those who were slain; / He does not forget the cry of the afflicted.

13.text: Be gracious to me, O Jehovah; look on my affliction from those who hate me, / You who raise me from the gates of death,

14.text: That I may tell out all Your praises / And, in the gates of the daughter of Zion, exult in Your salvation.

15.text: The nations have sunk in the pit that they have made; / In the net that they hid, their own foot is caught.

16.text: Jehovah has made Himself known; He has executed justice; / The wicked have been snared in the work of their hands. Higgaion. Selah

17.text: The wicked will be turned back to Sheol, / All the nations who forget God.

18.text: For not always will the needy be forgotten, / Nor will the hope of the afflicted perish forever.

19.text: Arise, O Jehovah! Let not mortal man prevail; / Let the nations be judged in Your sight.

20.text: Put them in fear, O Jehovah; / Let the nations know that they are mortal men. Selah

1.text: Why, O Jehovah, do You stand far off? / Why do You hide Yourself in times of distress?

2.text: Arrogantly the wicked hotly pursue the poor -- / May they be caught in the plots that they devise!

3.text: For the wicked man boasts of the desire of his soul, / And the rapacious man curses, even despises, Jehovah.

4.text: The wicked man, according to the haughtiness of his countenance, / Says, He will not require it; / All his thoughts are this: There is no God!

5.text: His ways succeed at all times; / Your judgments are on high, out of his sight; / As for all his adversaries, he snorts at them.

6.text: He has said in his heart, I will not be shaken; / I will be in no trouble forever.

7.text: His mouth is full of curses and of deceit and oppression; / Under his tongue are mischief and iniquity.

8.text: He sits in the ambushes of the open villages; / In hidden places he murders the innocent; / His eyes secretly watch for the unfortunate.

9.text: He lurks in secret like a lion in its covert; / He lurks ready to seize the poor; / He seizes the poor, drawing them up in his net.

10.text: He stoops, he crouches, / And the unfortunate fall by his mighty claws.

11.text: He has said in his heart, God has forgotten; / He has hidden His face; He will never see this.

12.text: Arise, O Jehovah; O God, lift up Your hand. / Do not forget the poor.

13.text: Why does the wicked man despise God / And say in his heart, You will not require it?

14.text: You do see! For You observe mischief and vexation, / To requite it with Your own hand. / To You the unfortunate one commits his cause; / You have been the help of the orphan.

15.text: Break the arm of the wicked man and the evildoer; / Seek out his wickedness until You find no more.

16.text: Jehovah is King forever and ever; / The nations have perished from His land.

17.text: You have heard the desire of the lowly, O Jehovah; / You will establish their heart; You will cause Your ears to listen,

18.text: In order to execute justice for the orphan and the oppressed one, / That the mortal man of the earth may terrorize no longer.

1.text: In Jehovah have I taken refuge. How can you say to my soul, / Flee to the mountains like a bird?

2.text: For behold, the wicked bend the bow; / They ready their arrow on the string / To shoot in the dark at the upright in heart.

3.text: When the foundations are destroyed, / What will the righteous man do?

4.text: Jehovah is in His holy temple; / Jehovah -- His throne is in heaven. / His eyes behold; / His eyelids try the sons of men.

5.text: Jehovah tries the righteous man; / But the wicked man and him who loves violence, His soul hates.

6.text: He will rain down snares upon the wicked; / Fire and brimstone and a scorching wind will be the portion of their cup.

7.text: For Jehovah is righteous; He loves righteous deeds. / The upright man will behold His face.

1.text: Save, O Jehovah; for the faithful man is no more, / For the trustworthy have vanished from among the sons of men.

2.text: Each man speaks falsehood with his neighbor; / With flattering lips and a double heart they speak.

3.text: May Jehovah cut off all the flattering lips, / The tongue speaking great things,

4.text: Those who said, With our tongue we will prevail; / Our lips are our own: Who is our lord?

5.text: Because of the devastation of the poor, because of the sighing of the needy, / I will now arise, says Jehovah; / I will set him in the safety that he longs for.

6.text: The words of Jehovah are pure words, / Silver refined in a furnace on the earth, / Purified seven times.

7.text: You, O Jehovah, will keep them; / You will guard them from this generation forever.

8.text: The wicked go about all around, / While vileness is exalted among the sons of men.

1.text: How long, O Jehovah? Will You forget me continually? / How long will You hide Your face from me?

2.text: How long will I take counsel in my soul / And sorrow in my heart day after day? / How long will my enemy be exalted over me?

3.text: Consider and answer me, O Jehovah my God; / Enlighten my eyes lest I sleep the sleep of death,

4.text: Lest my enemy say, I have prevailed against him, / And my adversaries exult when I am shaken.

5.text: But I trust in Your lovingkindness; / My heart will exult in Your salvation;

6.text: I will sing to Jehovah, / For He has dealt bountifully with me.

1.text: The fool has said in his heart, / There is no God. / They are corrupt; they commit abominable deeds; / There is none who does good.

2.text: Jehovah looked down from heaven / Upon the sons of men / To see if there was anyone who had insight, / Who seeks after God.

3.text: They have all turned aside; / They are together perverse. / There is none who does good; / There is not even one.

4.text: Have they no knowledge, all the workers of iniquity, / Who eat up my people as they would eat up bread / And do not call upon Jehovah?

5.text: There they were in great fear, / For God is among the generation of the righteous.

6.text: You put the counsel of the afflicted to shame, / But Jehovah is their refuge.

7.text: Oh that the salvation of Israel might come forth from Zion! / When Jehovah turns the captivity of His people, / Jacob will exult, Israel will rejoice.

1.text: O Jehovah, who may sojourn in Your tent? / Who may dwell on Your holy mountain?

2.text: He who walks in integrity / And does righteousness / And speaks truth from his heart.

3.text: He does not slander with his tongue; / He does not do evil to his friend, / Nor does he take up a reproach against his neighbor.

4.text: In his eyes a reprobate is despised, / But he honors those who fear Jehovah. / Should he swear to his harm, / He does not change.

5.text: He does not lend his money on interest, / Nor accept a bribe against the innocent. / He who does these things will not be shaken forever.

1.text: Preserve me, O God, for I take refuge in You.

2.text: I say to Jehovah, You are my Lord; / No good have I beyond You;

3.text: As for the saints who are on the earth, they are the excellent; / All my delight is in them.

4.text: The sorrows of them who bartered for some other god will be multiplied; / Their drink offerings of blood I will not offer, / Nor will I take up their names upon my lips.

5.text: Jehovah is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup; / You maintain my lot.

6.text: The measuring lines have fallen on pleasant places for me; / Indeed the inheritance is beautiful to me.

7.text: I will bless Jehovah, who counsels me; / Indeed in the nights my inward parts instruct me.

8.text: I have set Jehovah before me continually; / Because He is at my right hand, I shall not be shaken.

9.text: Therefore my heart rejoices and my glory exults; / Even my flesh dwells securely.

10.text: For You will not abandon my soul to Sheol, / Nor let Your Holy One see the pit.

11.text: You will make known to me the path of life; / In Your presence is fullness of joy; / At Your right hand there are pleasures forever.

1.text: Hear, O Jehovah, what is righteous; / Give heed to my cry; / Give ear to my prayer, / Which is not made with lips of deceit.

2.text: May a judgment for me come forth from Your presence; / May Your eyes regard equity.

3.text: You have examined my heart; You have visited me by night; / You have tried me: You have found nothing. / I have resolved that my mouth will not transgress.

4.text: Regarding the works of man, by the word of Your lips, / I have kept myself from the paths of the violent man.

5.text: My steps have held fast to Your tracks; / My footsteps have not slipped.

6.text: I call on You, for You will answer me, O God; / Incline Your ear to me; hear my speaking.

7.text: Wondrously display Your lovingkindness, / You who save by Your right hand / Those who take refuge in You from them who rise up against them.

8.text: Guard me like the pupil of Your eye; / In the shadow of Your wings hide me

9.text: From the presence of the wicked who oppress me, / From my deadly enemies, who close in upon me.

10.text: They have shut up their fat hearts; / With their mouths they speak arrogantly.

11.text: Now they have surrounded us in our steps; / They have fixed their eyes on casting us down to the ground.

12.text: He is like a lion that is eager to tear, / And like a young lion lurking in hidden places.

13.text: Arise, O Jehovah, confront him; bring him down. / With Your sword rescue my soul from the wicked man,

14.text: From mortal men with Your hand, O Jehovah, / From mortal men of the world, whose portion is in this life, / And whose belly You fill with Your treasure; / They are satisfied with children, / And they leave their abundance for their little ones.

15.text: As for me, in righteousness I will behold Your face; / When I awake, I will be satisfied with Your likeness.

1.text: I love You, O Jehovah, my strength.

2.text: Jehovah is my crag and my fortress and my Deliverer; / My God, my rock, in whom I take refuge; / My shield and the horn of my salvation, my high retreat.

3.text: I called upon Jehovah, who is worthy of praise, / And from my enemies I was saved.

4.text: The cords of death encompassed me; / And the torrents of destruction assailed me.

5.text: The cords of Sheol surrounded me; / The snares of death confronted me.

6.text: In my distress I called upon Jehovah / And cried out to my God. / He heard my voice from His temple, / And my cry before Him came to His ears.

7.text: Then the earth shook and quaked, / And the foundations of the mountains trembled and shook about, / For He was furious.

8.text: Smoke went up from His nostrils, / And fire from His mouth devoured; / Coals blazed forth from Him.

9.text: He bowed the heavens down and descended, / And deep darkness was under His feet.

10.text: He rode upon a cherub and did fly; / He darted upon the wings of the wind.

11.text: He made darkness His hiding place, His pavilion around Him: / Dark waterclouds, thick clouds of the skies.

12.text: Out of the brightness before Him there broke through His clouds / Hail and fiery coals.

13.text: Then Jehovah thundered in heaven, / And the Most High uttered His voice.

14.text: And He sent forth His arrows and scattered my enemies; / And He shot forth lightning bolts and discomfited them.

15.text: The channels of the sea were seen, / And the foundations of the habitable land were laid bare / At Your rebuke, O Jehovah, / At the blast of the breath of Your nostrils.

16.text: He reached forth from on high; He took me; / He drew me out of great waters.

17.text: He delivered me from my strong enemy / And from those who hate me, for they were too mighty for me.

18.text: They confronted me in the day of my calamity, / But Jehovah became my support.

19.text: He brought me forth to a place broad and free; / He rescued me, for He took delight in me.

20.text: Jehovah has recompensed me according to my righteousness; / According to the cleanness of my hands He has repaid me.

21.text: For I have kept the ways of Jehovah / And have not acted wickedly by turning away from my God.

22.text: For all His judgments were before me, / And I did not turn His statutes away from me.

23.text: I was perfect toward Him, / And I kept myself from my iniquity.

24.text: Therefore Jehovah recompensed me according to my righteousness, / According to the cleanness of my hands in His sight.

25.text: With the faithful You show Yourself faithful, / With a perfect man You show Yourself perfect,

26.text: With the pure You show Yourself pure, / And with the perverse You show Yourself contrary.

27.text: For it is You who save the afflicted people, / But the haughty eyes You bring down;

28.text: For it is You who light my lamp; / Jehovah my God lights up my darkness;

29.text: For by You I can run up against a troop; / Indeed by my God I can leap over a wall.

30.text: As for God, His way is perfect; / The word of Jehovah is tried. / He is a shield to all who take refuge in Him.

31.text: For who is God other than Jehovah, / And who is a rock but our God?

32.text: The God who girds me with strength / And makes my way perfect,

33.text: Who makes my feet like hinds' feet / And sets me on my high places,

34.text: Who teaches my hands to wage war / So that my arms may bend a bronze bow.

35.text: And You have given me the shield of Your salvation, / And Your right hand supports me; / And Your condescending gentleness has made me great.

36.text: You have broadened the places of my steps under me, / And my feet have not slipped.

37.text: I pursued my enemies and overtook them, / And I did not turn back until they were consumed.

38.text: I shattered them, so that they were not able to rise up; / They fell under my feet.

39.text: And You girded me with strength for war; / You brought down under me those who rose up against me.

40.text: You also made my enemies turn their back to me, / And I annihilated those who hated me.

41.text: They cried out, but there was no one to save them; / They cried out to Jehovah, but He did not answer them.

42.text: Then I beat them like dust before the wind; / Like the mud of the streets I pounded them.

43.text: You rescued me from the strivings of the people; / You have made me the head of the nations; / A people whom I had not known serves me.

44.text: At the mere hearing of a report, they obey me; / Foreigners come cringing to me;

45.text: Foreigners are discouraged / And come quaking out of their fortresses.

46.text: Jehovah lives; and blessed be my rock, / And exalted be the God of my salvation,

47.text: The God who executes vengeance for me / And subdues peoples under me,

48.text: Who rescues me from my enemies. / Indeed You exalted me above those who rise up against me; / From the violent man You delivered me.

49.text: Therefore I give thanks to You among the nations, O Jehovah; / And I will sing psalms to Your name.

50.text: It is He who magnifies salvation to His king / And executes lovingkindness to His anointed, / To David and to his seed forever.

1.text: The heavens declare the glory of God, / And the expanse proclaims the work of His hands.

2.text: Day to day pours forth speech, / And night to night tells out knowledge.

3.text: There is no speech and there are no words; / Their voice is not heard.

4.text: In all the earth their line has gone forth, / And their words to the end of the world. / In the heavens He has made a tent for the sun,

5.text: And he, like a bridegroom, goes forth from his canopy; / He rejoices like a mighty man running the course.

6.text: His going forth is from the end of the heavens, / And his circuit is unto their ends; / And there is nothing hidden from his heat.

7.text: The law of Jehovah is perfect, / Restoring the soul; / The testimony of Jehovah is faithful, / Making the simple wise;

8.text: The precepts of Jehovah are right, / Making the heart joyous; / The commandment of Jehovah is clear, / Enlightening the eyes;

9.text: The fear of Jehovah is pure, / Enduring forever; / The judgments of Jehovah are truth / And altogether righteous.

10.text: More to be desired are they than gold, / Even much refined gold; / Sweeter also than honey / And the drippings of the honeycomb.

11.text: Moreover by them Your servant is warned; / In keeping them there is much reward.

12.text: Who can discern his errors? / Clear me of my secret faults.

13.text: Also keep back Your servant from presumptuous sins; / Do not let them have dominion over me; / Then I will be blameless and cleared / Of great transgression.

14.text: May the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart / Be acceptable before You, / O Jehovah, my rock and my Redeemer.

1.text: May Jehovah answer you in the day of trouble; / May the name of the God of Jacob set you on high.

2.text: May He send you help from the sanctuary / And support you from Zion.

3.text: May He remember all your meal offerings / And accept your burnt offering. Selah

4.text: May He give you according to your heart's desire / And fulfill all your intention.

5.text: May we shout victoriously in Your salvation / And raise the banner in the name of our God. / May Jehovah fulfill all your petitions.

6.text: Now I know / That Jehovah saves His anointed; / He will answer him from His holy heaven / With mighty acts of salvation from His right hand.

7.text: Some boast in chariots, and some in horses; / But we boast in the name of Jehovah our God.

8.text: They are humbled and fallen, / But we have risen and stand upright.

9.text: Save, O Jehovah! / May the king answer us when we call.

1.text: O Jehovah, in Your strength the king rejoices, / And in Your salvation how greatly does he exult.

2.text: You have given him his heart's desire / And have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah

3.text: For You meet him with blessings of goodness; / You have set a crown of refined gold on his head.

4.text: He asked life of You; You granted it to him: / Length of days forever and ever.

5.text: His glory is great in Your salvation; / You have laid majesty and splendor upon him;

6.text: For You have made him to be blessings forever; / You have made him glad with rejoicing in Your presence.

7.text: For the king trusts in Jehovah; / And because of the lovingkindness of the Most High, he is not shaken.

8.text: Your hand finds all Your enemies; / Your right hand finds those who hate You.

9.text: You make them like a furnace of fire / When Your presence appears. / Jehovah swallows them in His anger, / And fire devours them.

10.text: You destroy their fruit from the earth, / And their seed from among the sons of men.

11.text: Although they intend evil against You, / And they think up a scheme, they will not prevail.

12.text: For You make them turn their back; / You aim with Your bowstrings at their faces.

13.text: Be exalted, O Jehovah, in Your strength; / We will sing and psalm Your might.

1.text: My God, my God, why have You forsaken me? / Why are You so far from saving me, / From the words of my groaning?

2.text: O my God, I call out in the day, but You do not answer; / And in the night, but there is no rest for me.

3.text: But You are holy, You who sit enthroned / Upon the praises of Israel.

4.text: In You our fathers trusted; / They trusted and You rescued them.

5.text: To You they cried out and were delivered; / In You they trusted and were not put to shame.

6.text: But I am a worm and not a man, / A reproach of men and one despised by the people.

7.text: All who see me deride me; / They sneer at me; they shake their heads, saying,

8.text: He committed himself to Jehovah; let Him rescue him; / Let Him deliver him since He takes pleasure in him.

9.text: But You are the One who drew me forth from the womb, / Who made me trust while at my mother's breasts.

10.text: I was cast upon You from birth; / From my mother's womb You have been my God.

11.text: Do not be far from me, / For trouble is near, / For there is none to help me.

12.text: Many bulls surround me; / The mighty bulls of Bashan encompass me.

13.text: They open their mouth at me, / Like a ravening and roaring lion.

14.text: I am poured out like water, / And all my bones are out of joint. / My heart is like wax; / It is melted within me.

15.text: My strength is dried up like a shard, / And my tongue is stuck to my jaws; / You have put me in the dust of death.

16.text: For dogs surround me; / A company of evildoers encloses me; / They pierce my hands and feet.

17.text: I count all my bones; / They look, they stare at me.

18.text: They divide my garments to themselves, / And for my clothing they cast lots.

19.text: But You, O Jehovah, be not far off; / O my help, hasten to aid me.

20.text: Deliver my soul from the sword, / My precious life from the power of the dog;

21.text: Save me from the mouth of the lion; / Indeed while I am in the horns of wild oxen, answer me.

22.text: I will declare Your name to my brothers; / In the midst of the assembly I will praise You.

23.text: You who fear Jehovah, praise Him! / All you seed of Jacob, glorify Him! / And stand in awe of Him, all you seed of Israel!

24.text: For He has not despised nor detested / The affliction of him who is afflicted; / And He has not hidden His face from him; / But when he cried out to Him, He heard.

25.text: From You comes my praise in the great assembly; / My vows will I pay before those who fear Him.

26.text: The lowly will eat and be satisfied; / Those who seek after Jehovah will praise Him -- / May your hearts live forever!

27.text: All the ends of the earth / Will remember and return to Jehovah, / And all families of the nations / Will worship before You;

28.text: For the kingdom is Jehovah's, / And He rules among the nations.

29.text: All the flourishing of the earth / Will eat and worship. / All who go down into the dust will bow down before Him, / Even he who does not keep his soul alive.

30.text: A seed will serve Him; / That which concerns the Lord will be told to a coming generation.

31.text: They will come and declare His righteousness / To a people yet to be born, that He has done this.

1.text: Jehovah is my Shepherd; I will lack nothing.

2.text: He makes me lie down in green pastures; / He leads me beside waters of rest.

3.text: He restores my soul; / He guides me on the paths of righteousness / For His name's sake.

4.text: Even though I walk / Through the valley of the shadow of death, / I do not fear evil, / For You are with me; / Your rod and Your staff, / They comfort me.

5.text: You spread a table before me / In the presence of my adversaries; / You anoint my head with oil; / My cup runs over.

6.text: Surely goodness and lovingkindness will follow me / All the days of my life, / And I will dwell in the house of Jehovah / For the length of my days.

1.text: The earth is Jehovah's, and its fullness, / The habitable land and those who dwell in it.

2.text: For it is He who founded it upon the seas / And established it upon the streams.

3.text: Who may ascend the mountain of Jehovah, / And who may stand in His holy place?

4.text: He who has clean hands and a pure heart, / Who has not lifted up his soul to falsehood / Or sworn deceitfully.

5.text: He will receive blessing from Jehovah, / And righteousness from the God of his salvation.

6.text: This is the generation of those who seek Him, / Those who seek Your face, even Jacob. Selah

7.text: Lift up your heads, O gates; / And be lifted up, O long enduring doors; / And the King of glory will come in.

8.text: Who is the King of glory? / Jehovah strong and mighty! / Jehovah mighty in battle!

9.text: Lift up your heads, O gates; / And lift up, O long enduring doors; / And the King of glory will come in.

10.text: Who is this King of glory? / Jehovah of hosts -- / He is the King of glory! Selah

1.text: To You, O Jehovah, / I lift up my soul.

2.text: O my God, I trust in You; / Do not let me be ashamed; / Do not let my enemies exult over me.

3.text: Indeed may all who wait on You not be ashamed; / May those who deal treacherously without cause be ashamed.

4.text: Make Your ways known to me, O Jehovah; / Teach me Your paths.

5.text: Guide me in Your truth, and teach me; / For You are the God of my salvation; / I wait on You all the day long.

6.text: Remember Your compassions, O Jehovah, / And Your acts of kindness, for they are from of old.

7.text: The sins of my youth and my transgressions, do not remember; / According to Your lovingkindness, remember me, / For the sake of Your goodness, O Jehovah.

8.text: Jehovah is good and upright; / Therefore He instructs sinners concerning the way.

9.text: He guides the lowly in justice / And teaches the lowly His way.

10.text: All the paths of Jehovah are lovingkindness and truth / To those who observe His covenant and His testimonies.

11.text: For the sake of Your name, O Jehovah, / Pardon my iniquity, for it is great.

12.text: Who then is the man who fears Jehovah? / Him will He instruct concerning the way that he should choose.

13.text: His soul will dwell in prosperity, / And his seed will possess the land.

14.text: The intimate counsel of Jehovah is to those who fear Him, / And His covenant will He make known to them.

15.text: My eyes are continually turned to Jehovah, / For He will bring my feet out of the net.

16.text: Turn toward me, and be gracious to me, / For I am alone and afflicted.

17.text: Relieve the troubles of my heart, / And bring me out of my distresses.

18.text: Look on my affliction and my suffering, / And forgive all my sins.

19.text: Look on my enemies, for they are many; / Indeed they hate me with a violent hatred.

20.text: Keep my soul, and deliver me; / Do not let me be put to shame, / For I take refuge in You.

21.text: May integrity and uprightness preserve me, / For I wait on You.

22.text: Redeem Israel, O God, / Out of all his troubles.

1.text: Judge me, O Jehovah; / For I have walked in my integrity, / And in Jehovah I have trusted; / I will not waver.

2.text: Examine me, O Jehovah, and try me; / Test my inward parts and my heart.

3.text: For Your lovingkindness is before my eyes, / And I have walked in Your truth.

4.text: I do not sit with men of falsehood, / Nor will I associate with hypocrites.

5.text: I hate the assembly of evildoers, / Nor will I sit with the wicked.

6.text: I wash my hands in innocence / And go around Your altar, O Jehovah,

7.text: Making myself heard with the voice of thanksgiving / And telling out all Your wonderful deeds.

8.text: O Jehovah, I love the habitation of Your house, / And the place where Your glory abides.

9.text: Do not gather my soul with sinners, / Nor my life with men of bloodshed,

10.text: In whose hand is a wicked scheme, / And whose right hand is full of bribes.

11.text: But as for me, I walk in my integrity; / Redeem me and be gracious to me.

12.text: My foot stands on level ground; / In the assemblies I will bless Jehovah.

1.text: Jehovah is my light and my salvation; / Whom shall I fear? / Jehovah is the strength of my life; / Whom shall I dread?

2.text: When evildoers come near me / To devour my flesh, / It is they, my adversaries and my enemies, / Who stumble and fall.

3.text: If an army camps against me, / My heart does not fear; / If a battle arises against me, / In spite of this I am confident.

4.text: One thing I have asked from Jehovah; / That do I seek: / To dwell in the house of Jehovah / All the days of my life, / To behold the beauty of Jehovah, / And to inquire in His temple.

5.text: For He will conceal me in His shelter / In the day of trouble; / He will hide me in the hiding place of His tent; / He will raise me up upon a rock.

6.text: And now my head is lifted up / Above my enemies who surround me. / And I will offer in His tent / Sacrifices of shouts of joy: / I will sing and psalm to Jehovah.

7.text: Hear, O Jehovah, when I call with my voice, / And be gracious to me and answer me.

8.text: When You say, Seek My face, / To You my heart says, Your face, O Jehovah, will I seek.

9.text: Do not hide Your face from me; / Do not turn Your servant away in Your anger; / You have been my help. / Do not abandon me or forsake me, / O God of my salvation.

10.text: If my father and my mother forsake me, / Jehovah will take me up.

11.text: Teach me, O Jehovah, Your way, / And lead me on a level path / Because of those who lie in wait for me.

12.text: Do not give me over / To the will of my adversaries; / For false witnesses have risen up against me, / And those who breathe out threats.

13.text: I have believed / That I would see the goodness of Jehovah / In the land of the living.

14.text: Wait for Jehovah; / Be strong, and let your heart be encouraged. / Yes, wait for Jehovah.

1.text: To You, O Jehovah, do I call out; / My rock, do not be deaf to me, / Lest, if You are silent to me, / I become like those who go down into the pit.

2.text: Hear the voice of my supplications / When I cry out to You, / When I lift up my hands / Unto Your innermost sanctuary.

3.text: Do not drag me away with the wicked / And with the workers of iniquity, / Who speak peace to their neighbors / While evil is in their heart.

4.text: Repay them according to what they have done / And according to the evil of their deeds; / According to the work of their hands repay them; / Return to them their due.

5.text: For they do not regard the acts of Jehovah / Or the work of His hands; / He will tear them down / And not rebuild them.

6.text: Blessed be Jehovah, / For He has heard the voice of my supplications.

7.text: Jehovah is my strength and my shield; / My heart trusts in Him, and I am helped; / Therefore my heart exults; / And with my song do I give thanks to Him.

8.text: Jehovah is their strength; / And He is a stronghold of salvation to His anointed.

9.text: Save Your people, / And bless Your inheritance; / And shepherd them and carry them forever.

1.text: Ascribe to Jehovah, O sons of the Mighty, / Ascribe to Jehovah glory and strength;

2.text: Ascribe to Jehovah the glory of His name; / Worship Jehovah in holy splendor.

3.text: The voice of Jehovah is over the waters; / The God of glory thunders, / Jehovah over the great waters.

4.text: The voice of Jehovah is powerful; / The voice of Jehovah is full of majesty.

5.text: The voice of Jehovah breaks the cedars; / Indeed Jehovah breaks the cedars of Lebanon in pieces;

6.text: And He makes Lebanon skip like a calf, / And Sirion like a young wild ox.

7.text: The voice of Jehovah cleaves out flames of fire.

8.text: The voice of Jehovah shakes the wilderness; / Jehovah shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.

9.text: The voice of Jehovah causes the hinds to calve / And strips the forests bare; / And in His temple all say, Glory!

10.text: Jehovah sat enthroned at the Flood, / And Jehovah sits as King forever.

11.text: May Jehovah give strength to His people. / May Jehovah bless His people with peace.

1.text: I extol You, O Jehovah, for You have drawn me up / And have not let my enemies rejoice over me.

2.text: O Jehovah my God, / I cried out to You, / And You healed me.

3.text: O Jehovah, You have brought up my soul from Sheol; / You have preserved me alive that I would not go down into the pit.

4.text: Sing psalms to Jehovah, you who are His faithful ones; / And praise His holy memorial.

5.text: For His anger lasts but a moment, / His favor, a lifetime; / Weeping may linger in the evening, / But a ringing shout goes up in the morning.

6.text: As for me, I said in my prosperity, / I will never be shaken.

7.text: O Jehovah, by Your favor You had made my mountain stand strong. / You hid Your face; I was troubled.

8.text: To You, O Jehovah, I called out; / And to Jehovah I made my supplication.

9.text: What profit is there in my blood if I go down into the pit? / Will the dust praise You? Will it declare Your faithfulness?

10.text: Hear, O Jehovah, and be gracious to me. / O Jehovah, be my help.

11.text: You have turned for me my mourning into dancing; / You have loosened my sackcloth / And girded me with rejoicing,

12.text: That my glory might sing psalms to You and not be silent. / O Jehovah my God, I will praise You forever.

1.text: In You, O Jehovah, do I take refuge; / Never let me be put to shame. / Rescue me in Your righteousness.

2.text: Incline Your ear to me; / Deliver me speedily. / Be to me a rock of protection, / A fortress, to save me.

3.text: For You are my crag and my fortress; / Therefore for Your name's sake / Lead me and guide me.

4.text: Bring me out of the net / That they have secretly laid for me, / For You are my protection.

5.text: Into Your hand I commit my spirit; / Redeem me, O Jehovah, God of truth.

6.text: I hate those who regard vanities of falsehood, / But I trust in Jehovah.

7.text: I will exult and rejoice in Your lovingkindness, / Since You have seen my affliction; / You know the distress of my soul.

8.text: And You have not delivered me into the hand of the enemy; / You have made my feet stand in a place broad and free.

9.text: Be gracious to me, O Jehovah, for I am in distress. / My eye is wasted away with grief, / Indeed my soul and body.

10.text: For my life has been consumed in sorrow, / And my years, in sighing. / My strength fails because of my iniquity, / And my bones have wasted away.

11.text: Because of all my adversaries, / I have become a reproach, / And especially so to my neighbors, / And something dreaded to my acquaintances; / Those who see me on the street flee from me.

12.text: I am forgotten, like a dead man out of mind; / I am like a destroyed vessel.

13.text: For I hear the slander of many; / Terror is on every side. / When they take counsel together against me, / They scheme to take my life.

14.text: But I trust in You, O Jehovah; / I say, You are my God.

15.text: My times are in Your hand; / Deliver me from the hand of my enemies and from those who pursue me.

16.text: Cause Your face to shine upon Your servant; / Save me in Your lovingkindness.

17.text: O Jehovah, do not let me be put to shame when I call out to You; / Let the wicked be put to shame; let them be silent in Sheol.

18.text: Let the lips of falsehood be made dumb, / Which speak arrogantly against the righteous / With pride and contempt.

19.text: How great is Your goodness, / Which You have stored up for those who fear You, / Which You have accomplished in the sight of the sons of men / For those who take refuge in You!

20.text: You hide them in the hiding place of Your presence / Apart from the conspiracies of men; / You lay them away secretly in a shelter / Apart from the contention of tongues.

21.text: Blessed be Jehovah, / For He displayed His lovingkindness wondrously / To me in a fortified city.

22.text: I, on my part, had said in my alarm, / I am cut off before Your eyes; / But instead You heard / The voice of my supplications / When I cried out to You.

23.text: Love Jehovah, all you who are His faithful ones; / Jehovah guards the trustworthy, / And recompenses abundantly / Him who acts haughtily.

24.text: Be strong, and let your heart be encouraged, / All you who hope in Jehovah.

1.text: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven; / Whose sin is covered.

2.text: Blessed is the man to whom / Jehovah does not impute iniquity / And in whose spirit there is no deceit.

3.text: When I kept silent, my bones wasted away / Through my groaning all day long.

4.text: For day and night Your hand / Was heavy upon me; / My life sap was dried up / As in the drought of summer. Selah

5.text: I acknowledged my sin to You, / And I did not cover my iniquity. / I said, I will confess my transgressions to Jehovah. / Then You forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah

6.text: Because of this let everyone who is faithful / Pray to You at a time when You may be found; / Surely when great waters overflow, / They will not reach him.

7.text: You are my hiding place; / You preserve me from trouble; / You surround me with the ringing shouts of deliverance. Selah

8.text: I will instruct you and teach you concerning the way you should go; / I will counsel you; My eye is upon you.

9.text: Do not be like a horse or like a mule, without understanding; / Whose trappings consist of bit and bridle to restrain them, / Else they do not come near you.

10.text: Many are the sorrows that the wicked have; / But he who trusts in Jehovah is encompassed by lovingkindness.

11.text: Rejoice in Jehovah and exult, O righteous ones; / And give a ringing shout, all you who are upright in heart.

1.text: Rejoice in Jehovah, O righteous ones. / Praise is becoming to the upright.

2.text: Give thanks to Jehovah with the lyre; / With the harp of ten strings sing psalms to Him.

3.text: Sing Him a new song; / Play skillfully with a joyous shout.

4.text: For the word of Jehovah is right, / And all His work is done in faithfulness.

5.text: He loves righteousness and justice; / The earth is full of the lovingkindness of Jehovah.

6.text: By the word of Jehovah the heavens were made, / And all their host, by the breath of His mouth.

7.text: He gathers the water of the sea like a heap; / He puts the deep waters into storage places.

8.text: Let all the earth fear Jehovah; / Let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of Him.

9.text: For He spoke, and it was; / He commanded, and it stood.

10.text: Jehovah brings the counsel of the nations to nothing; / He frustrates the intentions of the peoples.

11.text: The counsel of Jehovah stands forever; / The intentions of His heart stand from generation to generation.

12.text: Blessed is the nation whose God is Jehovah, / The people whom He has chosen as His own possession.

13.text: Jehovah looks from heaven; / He sees all the sons of men.

14.text: From the site of His habitation He gazes / At all the inhabitants of the earth,

15.text: He who fashions the hearts of them all, / He who discerns all their works.

16.text: No king is saved by a great army; / A mighty man is not delivered by great strength.

17.text: A horse is a vain thing for salvation, / And it cannot deliver by its great power.

18.text: Behold, the eye of Jehovah is upon those who fear Him, / Upon those who hope in His lovingkindness,

19.text: To deliver their soul from death / And to preserve them alive in famine.

20.text: Our soul waits on Jehovah; / He is our help and our shield;

21.text: For in Him our heart rejoices, / Because in His holy name we trust.

22.text: May Your lovingkindness, O Jehovah, be upon us, / Even as we have hoped in You.

1.text: I will bless Jehovah at all times; / His praise will continually be in my mouth.

2.text: My soul makes its boast in Jehovah; / The lowly hear and they rejoice.

3.text: Magnify Jehovah with me, / And let us exalt His name together.

4.text: I sought Jehovah, and He answered me; / And He delivered me from all that terrified me.

5.text: They looked to Him and were radiant; / And their faces will never be abashed.

6.text: This poor man called out, and Jehovah heard; / And He saved him out of all his troubles.

7.text: The angel of Jehovah encamps / Around those who fear Him, and He delivers them.

8.text: Taste and see that Jehovah is good; / Blessed is the man who takes refuge in Him.

9.text: Fear Jehovah, you who are His saints; / For there is no lack with those who fear Him.

10.text: The young lions hunger and starve, / But those who seek Jehovah will not lack any good thing.

11.text: Come, children; hear me. / I will teach you the fear of Jehovah.

12.text: Who is the man who desires life, / Who loves having days in order to see good?

13.text: Guard your tongue from evil, / And your lips from speaking deceit.

14.text: Turn away from evil and do good; / Seek peace and pursue it.

15.text: The eyes of Jehovah are set toward the righteous, / And His ears, toward their cry.

16.text: The face of Jehovah is against those who do evil, / To cut off the memory of them from the earth.

17.text: The righteous cry out, and Jehovah hears; / And He saves them out of all their troubles.

18.text: Jehovah is near to those who are broken in heart, / And He saves those who are contrite in spirit.

19.text: Many are the troubles of the righteous man, / But Jehovah delivers him from all of them.

20.text: He keeps all his bones; / Not one of them is broken.

21.text: Evil will slay the wicked, / And those who hate the righteous man will be condemned.

22.text: Jehovah redeems the soul of His servants, / And none who take refuge in Him will be condemned.

1.text: Strive, O Jehovah, with those who strive with me; / Battle against those who battle against me.

2.text: Take hold of buckler and shield, / And rise up as my help.

3.text: Draw out also the spear, and close up the way / Against those who pursue me; / Say to my soul, / I am your salvation.

4.text: Let those who seek my life / Be put to shame and humiliated; / Let those who devise evil for me / Be turned back and confounded.

5.text: Let them be like chaff before the wind, / With the angel of Jehovah driving them on.

6.text: Let their way be darkness and slipperiness itself, / With the angel of Jehovah pursuing them.

7.text: For without cause they hid their net for me; / Without cause they dug a pit for me.

8.text: Let destruction come upon him unawares, / And let his net, which he hid, catch him; / Let him fall into it, into destruction.

9.text: Then my soul will exult in Jehovah; / It will rejoice in His salvation.

10.text: All my bones will say, / Jehovah, who is like You, / Who delivers the poor from him who is too strong for him, / And the poor and needy from him who robs him?

11.text: Malicious witnesses rise up; / They ask me about things I know nothing of.

12.text: They repay me evil for good; / I am bereaved in soul.

13.text: But I, when they were sick, / Had sackcloth as my clothing; / I afflicted my soul with fasting, / And my prayer returned to my own bosom.

14.text: I conducted myself as if it had been my friend or my brother; / Like one mourning for his mother, I bowed down gloomily.

15.text: But at my stumbling they rejoice and gather together; / The attackers whom I did not know / Gather together against me; / They tear at me and do not cease.

16.text: As profane mocking parasites, / They gnash their teeth at me.

17.text: O Lord, how long will You look on? / Rescue my soul from their destruction, / My precious life from the lions.

18.text: I will give You thanks in the great congregation; / Among a mighty people I will praise You.

19.text: Do not let those who are wrongly my enemies rejoice over me; / Do not let those who hate me without cause narrow their eyes at me.

20.text: For they do not speak peace, / But devise words of deceit / Against the quiet people of the land.

21.text: And they open their mouth wide against me; / They say, Aha! Aha! Our eyes have seen it.

22.text: You have seen, O Jehovah; do not be silent. / O Lord, do not be far from me.

23.text: Awake, and stir Yourself for my cause, / For my claim, O my God and my Lord.

24.text: Vindicate me according to Your righteousness, O Jehovah my God; / And do not let them rejoice over me.

25.text: Do not let them say in their heart, / Aha! That is what we wanted. / Do not let them say, We have swallowed him up.

26.text: May those who rejoice at my trouble / Be ashamed and confounded together; / May those who magnify themselves against me / Be clothed with shame and humiliation.

27.text: May those who delight in the vindication of my righteousness / Give a ringing shout and rejoice, / And may they say continually, / Jehovah be magnified, / Who delights in the well-being of His servant.

28.text: And my tongue will declare Your righteousness / And Your praise all day long.

1.text: Transgression speaks to the wicked / Within his heart; / There is no dread of God / Before his eyes.

2.text: For he flatters himself in his own eyes, / That his iniquity cannot be found out and hated.

3.text: The words of his mouth are wickedness and deceit; / He has ceased being wise and doing good.

4.text: He plans wickedness on his bed; / He sets himself on a way that is not good; / He does not reject evil.

5.text: O Jehovah, Your lovingkindness is in the heavens; / Your faithfulness reaches unto the skies.

6.text: Your righteousness is like the mountains of God; / Your judgments are like the great deep; / You preserve man and beast, O Jehovah.

7.text: How precious is Your lovingkindness, O God! / Thus the sons of men take refuge in the shadow of Your wings.

8.text: They are saturated with the fatness of Your house, / And You cause them to drink of the river of Your pleasures.

9.text: For with You is the fountain of life; / In Your light we see light.

10.text: Continue Your lovingkindness to those who know You, / And Your righteousness to those who are upright in heart.

11.text: Do not let the foot of the arrogant come upon me, / Nor let the hand of the wicked drive me away.

12.text: There the workers of iniquity are fallen; / They are cast down and unable to rise.

1.text: Do not be incensed because of evildoers; / Do not be envious of wrongdoers.

2.text: For they soon wither like grass / And fade away like green herbage.

3.text: Trust in Jehovah, and do good; / Dwell in the land, and feed on His faithfulness.

4.text: Delight yourself in Jehovah, / And He will give you the requests of your heart.

5.text: Commit your way to Jehovah, / And trust in Him; and He will act.

6.text: And He will cause your righteousness to go forth like light, / And your justness like noonday.

7.text: Be still before Jehovah, and wait for Him; / Do not be incensed because of him who enjoys prosperity on his way, / Because of the man who performs his evil schemes.

8.text: Cease from anger and forsake wrath; / Do not be incensed; it leads only to evil.

9.text: For the evildoers will be cut off; / But those who wait on Jehovah, / They will inherit the land.

10.text: And in a little while longer there will be no wicked man; / Indeed, you will look diligently for his place, and he will not be there.

11.text: But the lowly will inherit the land / And delight themselves in the abundance of peace.

12.text: The wicked man makes evil schemes against the righteous man / And gnashes his teeth at him.

13.text: The Lord will laugh at him, / For He sees that his day will come.

14.text: The wicked have drawn out the sword / And bent their bow, / To cast the poor and the needy down, / To slaughter those who are upright in their way.

15.text: Their sword will enter their own heart, / And their bows will be broken.

16.text: Better is the little that the righteous man has / Than the abundance of many wicked.

17.text: For the arms of the wicked will be broken, / But Jehovah upholds the righteous.

18.text: Jehovah knows the days of the perfect, / And their inheritance will be forever.

19.text: They will not be put to shame in a time of evil, / And in the days of famine they will be satisfied.

20.text: But the wicked will perish, / And the enemies of Jehovah will be like the glory of the pastures: / They are consumed; in smoke they are consumed.

21.text: The wicked one borrows but does not repay, / But the righteous one is gracious and gives.

22.text: For those blessed by Him will inherit the land, / But those cursed by Him will be cut off.

23.text: A man's steps are established by Jehovah, / And He delights in his way.

24.text: If he falls, he is not utterly cast down; / For Jehovah upholds him by the hand.

25.text: I was once a young man; now I am old. / Yet I have not seen the righteous man forsaken, / Nor his seed seeking bread.

26.text: He is always gracious and lends, / And his seed becomes a blessing.

27.text: Turn away from evil and do good, / And abide forever.

28.text: For Jehovah loves justice / And does not abandon His faithful ones; / They are kept forever; / But the seed of the wicked is cut off.

29.text: The righteous will inherit the land, / And they will abide in it forever.

30.text: The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom, / And his tongue speaks justice.

31.text: The law of his God is in his heart; / His steps do not slip.

32.text: The wicked man watches for the righteous man / And seeks to slay him.

33.text: Jehovah does not leave him in his hand, / Nor let him be condemned when he is judged.

34.text: Wait for Jehovah, / And keep His way; / And He will exalt you to inherit the land; / When the wicked are cut off, you will see it.

35.text: I have seen the wicked man terrorizing, / And spreading himself like a luxuriant native tree.

36.text: Then someone passes by, and behold, he is not there; / I search for him, and he is not found.

37.text: Observe the perfect man, and watch the upright man; / For there is a future for the man of peace.

38.text: But the transgressors will be altogether destroyed; / The future of the wicked will be cut off.

39.text: And the salvation of the righteous is from Jehovah; / He is their stronghold in a time of distress.

40.text: And Jehovah helps them and rescues them; / He rescues them from the wicked, / And saves them, for they take refuge in Him.

1.text: O Jehovah, do not rebuke me in Your indignation, / Nor chasten me in Your burning wrath.

2.text: For Your arrows have sunk deep in me, / And Your hand has come down heavy upon me.

3.text: There is no soundness in my flesh due to Your indignation; / There is no wholeness in my bones due to my sin.

4.text: For my iniquities have passed over my head; / Like a heavy burden, they are too heavy for me.

5.text: My wounds are odious and festering / Due to my foolishness.

6.text: I am bent down and bowed utterly; / I go about all day long mourning.

7.text: For my loins are filled with burning, / And there is no soundness in my flesh.

8.text: I am benumbed and crushed utterly; / I cry out due to the groaning of my heart.

9.text: O Lord, all my desire is before You, / And my groaning is not hidden from You.

10.text: My heart throbs; my strength fails me; / And as for the light of my eyes, neither is it with me.

11.text: Those who love me and those who are my friends stand aloof from my plague, / And my relatives stand far away.

12.text: And those who seek my soul lay traps for me, / And those who pursue my misfortune speak of destruction, / And they contemplate deceit all day long.

13.text: But I, like a deaf man, cannot hear; / And I am like a dumb man, who cannot open his mouth.

14.text: Indeed I am like a man who does not hear / And in whose mouth there are no reproofs.

15.text: For in You, O Jehovah, do I hope; / You will respond, O Lord my God.

16.text: For I said, May they never rejoice over me! / When my foot slips, they magnify themselves over me.

17.text: For I am ready to stumble, / And my pain is before me continually.

18.text: For I declare my iniquity; / I am anxious because of my sin.

19.text: But my enemies are vigorous; they are strong; / And those who wrongly hate me are many.

20.text: Those also who repay evil for good / Are my adversaries because I pursue what is good.

21.text: Do not abandon me, O Jehovah; / O my God, do not be far away from me.

22.text: Hasten to help me, / O Lord, my salvation.

1.text: I said, I will keep my ways, / So that I do not sin with my tongue; / I will keep a muzzle on my mouth / When the wicked are before me.

2.text: I was dumb and silent; / I held my peace, even from good; / And my pain was stirred up.

3.text: My heart was hot within me; / While I mused, the fire burned; / I spoke with my tongue:

4.text: O Jehovah, cause me to know my end, / And the measure of my days, what it is. / May I know how transient I am.

5.text: Behold, You have made my days as mere handbreadths, / And my lifetime is as nothing before You; / Surely every man at his best is altogether vanity. Selah

6.text: Surely man goes about as a semblance; / Surely they bustle about in vain: / He heaps up riches yet knows not / Who will gather them.

7.text: And now what am I waiting for, O Lord? / My hope -- it is in You.

8.text: Deliver me from all my transgressions; / Do not make me the fool's reproach.

9.text: I was dumb; I did not open my mouth; / For You have done this.

10.text: Remove Your plague from me; / By the hostility of Your hand I am consumed.

11.text: With rebukes You chasten a man because of iniquity, / And cause what is desirous to him to disappear like a moth. / Surely every man is vanity. Selah

12.text: Hear my prayer, O Jehovah; / And give ear to my cry; / Do not hold Your peace at my tears. / For I am a stranger with You, / A sojourner, as all my fathers were.

13.text: Look away from me, that I may be cheerful, / Before I go away and am no more.

1.text: I waited patiently on Jehovah, / And He inclined to me / And heard my cry.

2.text: Then He brought me up out of a pit of destruction, / Out of the miry clay; / And He set my feet upon a rock, / Establishing my steps.

3.text: Then He put a new song in my mouth, / A praise to our God. / Many see it and fear, / And they trust in Jehovah.

4.text: Blessed is the man / Who makes Jehovah his trust / And does not turn to the proud / Or to those who turn aside after deception.

5.text: Many, O Jehovah my God, are the wonderful deeds which You have done / And Your thoughts toward us; / They cannot be set in order unto You. / Were I to declare and speak of them, / They would be too numerous to recount.

6.text: You do not delight in sacrifice and offering; / You have prepared ears for Me; / You do not require burnt offering and sin offering.

7.text: Then I said, / Behold, I have come; / In the scroll of the book / It is written concerning Me.

8.text: I delight in doing Your will, O My God; / Indeed Your law is within My inward parts.

9.text: I bear tidings of righteousness / In the great congregation. / Behold, I will not withhold My lips; / O Jehovah, You know.

10.text: I have not hidden Your righteousness / Within My heart; / I have declared Your faithfulness and Your salvation; / I have not concealed Your lovingkindness and Your truth from the great congregation.

11.text: You, O Jehovah, do not withhold / Your compassions from me; / May Your lovingkindness and Your truth / Preserve me continually.

12.text: For evils encompass me until they cannot be counted; / My iniquities have so overtaken me / That I cannot see; / They are more numerous than the hairs of my head; / Thus my heart fails me.

13.text: Be pleased, O Jehovah, to deliver me; / O Jehovah, hasten to help me.

14.text: May those who seek my life to destroy it / Be put to shame and confounded together; / May those who take delight in my misfortune / Be turned back and humiliated.

15.text: May those who say to me, Aha! Aha! / Be desolate because of their shame.

16.text: May all those who seek You / Be glad and rejoice in You; / May those who love Your salvation say continually, / May Jehovah be magnified!

17.text: But I am poor and needy; / May the Lord think about me. / You are my help and my Deliverer; / O my God, do not delay.

1.text: Blessed is he who considers the poor; / In the day of evil Jehovah will deliver him.

2.text: May Jehovah keep him and preserve him alive; / May he be blessed in the land; / And do not give him over to the will of his enemies.

3.text: Jehovah will sustain him on his sickbed; / You make all his bed in his illness.

4.text: I said, O Jehovah, be gracious to me; / Heal my soul, for I have sinned against You.

5.text: My enemies speak evil against me: / When will he die and his name perish?

6.text: And if he comes to see me, he speaks falsehood. / His heart gathers iniquity to itself; / When he goes out, he speaks it.

7.text: All who hate me whisper together against me; / Against me they devise my misfortune.

8.text: Some evil illness, they say, has been poured out on him; / And when he lies down, he will not rise again.

9.text: Even my familiar friend, in whom I trusted, / Who ate my bread, has lifted his heel against me.

10.text: But You, O Jehovah, be gracious to me and raise me up / That I may recompense them.

11.text: By this I know that You delight in me, / That my enemy has not shouted in triumph over me.

12.text: And as for me, You uphold me in my integrity, / And You set me in Your presence forever.

13.text: Blessed be Jehovah the God of Israel, / From eternity to eternity. / Amen and Amen.

1.text: As the hart pants / After the streams of water, / So my soul pants / For You, O God.

2.text: My soul thirsts for God, / For the living God. / When will I come and appear / Before God?

3.text: My tears have been my food / Day and night, / While they say to me all day long, / Where is your God?

4.text: These things I remember, / And I pour out my soul within me: / That I passed through with the throng; / I led them to the house of God / With the voice of a joyous shout and praise, / The festal multitude.

5.text: Why are you cast down, O my soul? / And why are you disquieted within me? / Hope in God, for I will yet praise Him / For the salvation of His countenance.

6.text: O my God, my soul is cast down within me; / Therefore I remember You / From the land of the Jordan and the Hermons, / From Mount Mizar.

7.text: Deep calls unto deep / At the sound of Your water spouts; / All Your waves and Your billows / Pass over me.

8.text: By day Jehovah commands / His lovingkindness, / And by night His song is with me, / A prayer to the God of my life.

9.text: I say to God my rock, / Why have You forgotten me? / Why do I go mourning / Because of the oppression of the enemy?

10.text: As with a shattering in my bones, / My adversaries reproach me, / While they say to me all day long, / Where is your God?

11.text: Why are you cast down, O my soul? / And why are you disquieted within me? / Hope in God, for I will yet praise Him, / The salvation of my countenance and my God.

1.text: Render judgment for me, O God; / And plead my cause / Before an unfaithful nation; / From the deceitful and unjust man / Deliver me.

2.text: For You are the God of my protection. / Why have You rejected me? / Why do I go about mourning / Because of the oppression of the enemy?

3.text: Send forth Your light and Your truth; / They will lead me; / They will bring me to Your holy mountain / And to Your tabernacles.

4.text: And I will go to the altar of God, / To God my exceeding joy; / And I will praise You with the harp, / O God, my God.

5.text: Why are you cast down, O my soul? / And why are you disquieted within me? / Hope in God, for I will yet praise Him, / The salvation of my countenance and my God.

1.text: O God, we have heard with our ears; / Our fathers have recounted it to us, / The work You did in their days, / In the days of old.

2.text: You, by Your hand, / Have dispossessed nations, but You have planted our fathers; / You afflicted peoples, but You spread our fathers forth.

3.text: For they did not possess the land by their sword, / Nor did their arm save them; / Rather it was Your right hand and Your arm, / And the light of Your countenance; / For You delighted in them.

4.text: You are my King, O God; / Command salvation for Jacob.

5.text: Through You we thrust back our adversaries; / Through Your name we trample those who rise up against us.

6.text: For I will not trust in my bow, / Nor will my sword save me.

7.text: But You save us from our adversaries, / And You put to shame those who hate us.

8.text: In God we boast all day long, / And we praise Your name forever. Selah

9.text: Nevertheless You have rejected us and humiliated us, / And You have not gone forth with our armies.

10.text: You have caused us to turn back from the adversary, / And those who hate us take spoil for themselves.

11.text: You have given us over like sheep to be eaten / And have scattered us among the nations.

12.text: You have sold Your people for nothing / And have not gone high on their price.

13.text: You have made us a reproach to our neighbors, / A mocking and a derision to those around us.

14.text: You have made us a proverb among the nations, / Something to shake the head at among the peoples.

15.text: All day long my humiliation is before me, / And the shame of my face covers me,

16.text: Because of the voice of him who reproaches and reviles, / Because of the presence of the enemy and of him who avenges himself.

17.text: All this has come upon us; but we have not forgotten You, / Nor have we been false to Your covenant.

18.text: Our heart has not turned back, / Nor have our steps deviated from Your way;

19.text: But You have crushed us in the place of jackals / And have covered us with the shadow of death.

20.text: If we have forgotten the name of our God / Or spread out our hands to a strange god,

21.text: Will God not search this out? / For He knows the hidden things of the heart.

22.text: But for Your sake we are slain all day long; / We are considered as sheep for slaughter.

23.text: Awake! Why are You sleeping, O Lord? / Arise! Do not reject us forever.

24.text: Why do You hide Your face / And forget our affliction and our oppression?

25.text: For our soul bows down to the dust; / Our body clings to the earth.

26.text: Rise up; be our help, / And redeem us for Your lovingkindness' sake.

1.text: My heart overflows with a good matter; / I speak what I have composed concerning the King. / My tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

2.text: You are fairer than the sons of men; / Grace is poured upon Your lips; / Therefore God has blessed You forever.

3.text: Gird Your sword upon Your thigh, O mighty One, / In Your majesty and Your splendor.

4.text: And in Your splendor ride on victoriously / Because of truth and meekness and righteousness; / And let Your right hand teach You awesome deeds.

5.text: Your arrows are sharp: / The peoples fall under You; / The arrows are in the heart of the King's enemies.

6.text: Your throne, O God, is forever and ever; / The scepter of uprightness is the scepter of Your kingdom.

7.text: You have loved righteousness and hated wickedness; / Therefore God, Your God, has anointed You / With the oil of gladness above Your companions.

8.text: All Your garments smell of myrrh and aloes, of cassia; / From palaces of ivory, harpstrings have made You glad.

9.text: The daughters of kings are among Your most prized; / The queen stands at Your right hand in the gold of Ophir.

10.text: Hear, O daughter, and see; and incline your ear; / And forget your people and your father's house;

11.text: Thus the King will desire your beauty. / Because He is your Lord, / Worship Him.

12.text: And the daughter of Tyre will come with a gift; / The rich among the people will entreat your favor.

13.text: The king's daughter is all glorious within the royal abode; / Her garment is a woven work inwrought with gold.

14.text: She will be led to the King in embroidered clothing; / The virgins behind her, her companions, / Will be brought to You.

15.text: They will be led with rejoicing and exultation; / They will enter the King's palace.

16.text: In the place of Your fathers will be Your sons; / You will make them princes in all the earth.

17.text: I will cause Your name to be remembered in all generations; / Therefore the peoples will praise You forever and ever.

1.text: God is our refuge and strength; / A help in distress, He is most readily found.

2.text: Therefore we will not fear, / Though the earth change, / And the mountains slip into the heart of the seas;

3.text: Though the waters of the sea roar and foam; / Though the mountains shake at its swelling. Selah

4.text: There is a river whose streams gladden the city of God, / The holy place of the tabernacles of the Most High.

5.text: God is in the midst of her; she will not be moved; / God helps her at the dawn of the morning.

6.text: The nations rage; the kingdoms are moved. / He utters His voice; the earth melts.

7.text: Jehovah of hosts is with us; / The God of Jacob is our high retreat. Selah

8.text: Come, see the works of Jehovah, / How He has made desolations on earth.

9.text: He makes wars cease unto the end of the earth; / He breaks the bow and cuts the spear to pieces; / He burns the war wagons with fire.

10.text: Be still and know that I am God. / I will be exalted among the nations; I will be exalted on earth.

11.text: Jehovah of hosts is with us; / The God of Jacob is our high retreat. Selah

1.text: Clap your hands, all you peoples; / Shout to God with the voice of a triumphant sound.

2.text: For Jehovah Most High is awesome: / A great King over all the earth.

3.text: He subdues peoples under us, / And nations under our feet.

4.text: He chose our inheritance for us, / The excellency of Jacob, whom He loved. Selah

5.text: God ascends amidst shouting; / Jehovah, at the sound of a trumpet.

6.text: Sing psalms to God, sing psalms; / Sing psalms to our King, sing psalms.

7.text: For God is the King of all the earth; / Sing psalms with understanding.

8.text: God reigns over the nations; / God sits upon His holy throne.

9.text: The princes of the peoples have been gathered / As the people of the God of Abraham; / For the shields of the earth belong to God; / He is greatly exalted.

1.text: Great is Jehovah, / And much to be praised / In the city of our God, / In His holy mountain.

2.text: Beautiful in elevation, / The joy of the whole earth, / Is Mount Zion, the sides of the north, / The city of the great King.

3.text: God has made Himself known / In her palaces as a high retreat.

4.text: For, behold, the kings have assembled themselves; / They passed by together.

5.text: They saw; therefore they were astounded. / They were dismayed; they hurried off in alarm.

6.text: Trembling seized them there; / Writhing, like that of a woman in labor;

7.text: With an east wind You shattered / The ships of Tarshish.

8.text: As we have heard, / So we have seen / In the city of Jehovah of hosts, / In the city of our God. / God will establish her forever. Selah

9.text: We consider, O God, Your lovingkindness / In the midst of Your temple.

10.text: As Your name is, O God, / So is Your praise / Unto the ends of the earth; / Your right hand is full of righteousness.

11.text: Let Mount Zion rejoice; / Let the daughters of Judah exult / Because of Your judgments.

12.text: Walk about Zion, and go around her; / Count her towers.

13.text: Consider carefully her bulwarks; / Pass between her palaces; / That you may recount it to the generation following.

14.text: For this God is our God forever and ever. / He will guide us even unto death.

1.text: Hear this, all you peoples; / Give ear, all you inhabitants of the world,

2.text: Both low and high, / Rich and poor together;

3.text: My mouth will speak wisdom, / And the meditation of my heart will be that of understanding.

4.text: I will incline my ear to a parable; / I will disclose my riddle upon the harp.

5.text: Why should I fear in the days of evil, / When the iniquity of those who supplant me surrounds me,

6.text: Those who trust in their wealth / And boast in the multitude of their riches?

7.text: None can by any means redeem his brother / Or give to God a ransom for him

8.text: (For the redemption of their soul is costly / And must be given up forever),

9.text: That he would yet live always / And not see corruption.

10.text: For he will see that wise men die; / The foolish one and the senseless one perish alike / And leave their wealth to others.

11.text: Their inward thought is that their houses will remain forever, / That their habitations will remain from generation to generation; / They call lands after their own names.

12.text: But man in honor does not remain; / He is like the beasts that perish.

13.text: Such is the way of those who are self-confident, / And of those after them who approve of their sayings. Selah

14.text: Like a flock, they are appointed for Sheol; / Death will shepherd them. / And straight to the grave they will descend, / And their form will be for Sheol to consume / That there be no abode for them.

15.text: But God will redeem my soul / From the power of Sheol, / For He will receive me. Selah

16.text: Do not fear when a man becomes rich, / When the glory of his house increases.

17.text: For when he dies, he will take nothing; / His glory will not descend after him.

18.text: Though he blessed his soul while he lived -- / And men praise you when you do good for yourself --

19.text: It will go to the generation of his fathers; / They will never see light.

20.text: A man in honor but without understanding / Is like the beasts that perish.

1.text: The Mighty One, God Jehovah, / Speaks and summons the earth / From the rising of the sun to its setting.

2.text: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, / God shines forth.

3.text: Our God has come and will not be silent; / Fire devours before Him, / And around Him it is exceedingly tempestuous.

4.text: He calls to the heavens above, / And to the earth that He may judge His people:

5.text: Gather My saints to Me, / Those who have made a covenant with Me by sacrifice.

6.text: Then the heavens declare His righteousness, / For God Himself is Judge. Selah

7.text: Hear, O My people, and I will speak; / O Israel, and I will testify against you: / I am God, your God.

8.text: I will not reprove you because of your sacrifices, / And your burnt offerings are before Me continually.

9.text: I will not take a bull from your house / Nor goats from your folds,

10.text: For every animal of the forest is Mine, / The cattle upon a thousand hills.

11.text: I know every bird of the mountains, / And I am aware of everything that moves in the field.

12.text: If I were hungry, I would not tell you; / For the world is Mine and the fullness thereof.
