13.text: Shall I eat the flesh of bulls / Or drink the blood of goats?

14.text: Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving, / And repay your vows to the Most High;

15.text: And call upon Me in the day of trouble: / I will deliver you, and you will glorify Me.

16.text: But to the wicked God says, / What right do you have to declare My statutes / And take up My covenant in your mouth,

17.text: Seeing that you hate correction / And cast My words behind you?

18.text: When you see a thief, you take pleasure in him; / And your portion is with adulterers.

19.text: You let your mouth loose for evil, / And your tongue frames deceit.

20.text: You sit and speak against your brother; / You defame the son of your mother.

21.text: These things you do, and I keep silent; / You think that I am altogether like you. / I will rebuke you and set forth the matter in order before your eyes.

22.text: Consider this then, you who forget God, / Lest I tear you apart and there be none to deliver you.

23.text: Whoever offers a sacrifice of thanksgiving glorifies Me; / And to him who sets his way right I will show the salvation of God.

1.text: Be gracious to me, O God, according to Your lovingkindness; / According to the greatness of Your compassions blot out my transgressions.

2.text: Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity, / And from my sin cleanse me.

3.text: For I do know my transgressions, / And my sin is before me continually.

4.text: Against You and You alone have I sinned, / And I have done what is evil in Your sight. / Therefore You are righteous when You speak; / You are clear when You judge.

5.text: Behold, I was brought forth in iniquity, / And in sin did my mother conceive me.

6.text: Behold, You delight in truth in the inward parts; / And in the hidden part You would make known wisdom to me.

7.text: Purge my sin with hyssop, and I will be clean; / Wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.

8.text: Let me hear gladness and joy, / That the bones which You have broken may exult.

9.text: Hide Your face from my sins, / And blot out all my iniquities.

10.text: Create in me a clean heart, O God, / And renew a steadfast spirit within me.

11.text: Do not cast me from Your presence, / And do not take the Spirit of Your holiness away from me.

12.text: Restore to me the gladness of Your salvation, / And sustain me with a willing spirit.

13.text: I will teach transgressors Your ways, / And sinners will turn back to You.

14.text: Deliver me from the guilt of bloodshed, O God, O God of my salvation; / And my tongue will ring forth Your righteousness.

15.text: O Lord, open my lips, / And my mouth will declare Your praise.

16.text: For You do not delight in sacrifice; / Otherwise I would offer it; / You take no pleasure in burnt offerings.

17.text: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit; / A broken and a contrite heart, O God, You will not despise.

18.text: Do good in Your good pleasure unto Zion; / Build the walls of Jerusalem.

19.text: Then You will delight in the sacrifices of righteousness, / In burnt offerings and whole burnt offerings; / Then they will offer bulls upon Your altar.

1.text: Why do you boast in evil, O mighty one? / God's lovingkindness endures continually.

2.text: Your tongue devises destruction; / It is like a sharpened razor, O worker of deceit.

3.text: You have loved evil rather than good, / Falsehood rather than speaking righteousness. Selah

4.text: You have loved all the devouring words, / O deceitful tongue.

5.text: God will likewise break you down forever; / He will take you and pluck you up from your tent, / And uproot you from the land of the living. Selah

6.text: And the righteous will see it and fear, / And they will laugh at him, saying,

7.text: Behold, this is that mighty man / Who did not make God his strength, / But trusted in the multitude of his riches / And strengthened himself in his desire.

8.text: But I, like a flourishing olive tree / In the house of God, / Trust in God's lovingkindness / Forever and ever.

9.text: I will give You thanks forever, / For You have acted; / And I will hope in Your name in the presence of Your faithful ones, / For it is good.

1.text: The fool has said in his heart, / There is no God. / They are corrupt and commit abominable deeds; / There is none who does good.

2.text: God looked down from heaven / Upon the sons of men / To see if there was anyone who had insight, / Who seeks after God.

3.text: All of them have turned back; / They are together perverse. / There is none who does good; / There is not even one.

4.text: Have they no knowledge, the workers of iniquity, / Who eat up my people as they would eat up bread / And do not call upon God?

5.text: There they were in great fear, / Where there was no fear. / For God scattered the bones / Of him who encamped against you. / You put them to shame / Because God has rejected them.

6.text: Oh that the salvation of Israel might come forth from Zion! / When God turns the captivity of His people, / Jacob will exult, Israel will rejoice.

1.text: O God, save me by Your name, / And execute judgment for me by Your might.

2.text: O God, hear my prayer; / Give ear to the words of my mouth.

3.text: For strangers have risen up against me, / And those who terrorize seek my life; / They do not set God before them. Selah

4.text: Behold, God is my Helper; / The Lord is among those who sustain my soul.

5.text: He will return the evil to those who lie in wait for me. / Annihilate them in Your faithfulness.

6.text: I will offer a freewill offering to You; / I will praise Your name, O Jehovah, for it is good.

7.text: For He has delivered me from all distress, / And my eye looks triumphantly upon my enemies.

1.text: Give ear, O God, to my prayer; / And do not hide Yourself from my supplication.

2.text: Give heed to me, and answer me. / I grow restless in my complaint and moan,

3.text: Because of the voice of the enemy, / Because of the oppression of the wicked man; / For they drop iniquity upon me, / And in anger they make me their enemy.

4.text: My heart writhes within me, / And the terrors of death have fallen upon me.

5.text: Fear and trembling have come upon me, / And shuddering overwhelms me.

6.text: And I say, Oh that I had wings like a dove! / Then I would fly away and be at rest.

7.text: Indeed I would wander far away; / I would lodge in the wilderness. Selah

8.text: I would hasten my escape / From the storm wind and the tempest.

9.text: Confuse, O Lord, divide their tongue; / For I have seen violence and contention in the city.

10.text: Day and night they go around it, / Upon its walls; / And iniquity and trouble are in the midst of it.

11.text: Utter ruin is in the midst of it, / And oppression and deceit / Do not depart from its streets.

12.text: For it is not an enemy who reproaches me; / Otherwise I could bear it. / It is not he who hates me who magnifies himself against me; / Otherwise I could hide myself from him.

13.text: But it is you, my equal, / My close friend and my acquaintance.

14.text: We were in sweet counsel together; / We walked with the throng in the house of God.

15.text: Let death surprise them; / May they go down into Sheol alive. / For evil is in their dwelling, in the midst of them.

16.text: As for me, I call out to God, / And Jehovah will save me.

17.text: Evening and morning and at noontime / I complain and moan, / And He hears my voice.

18.text: He has redeemed my soul in peace / From the battle against me, / For many are they who strive with me.

19.text: God hears and answers them -- / Even He who sits enthroned from of old -- Selah / Because with them there is no change, / And they do not fear God.

20.text: He put forth his hands against those who were at peace with him; / He profaned his covenant.

21.text: Smooth were the buttery words of his mouth, / But his heart was war; / More soothing than oil were his words, / But they were in fact drawn swords.

22.text: Cast your burden upon Jehovah, / And He will sustain you; / He will never allow the righteous to be moved.

23.text: But You, O God, will bring them down / Into the pit of decay. / Men of bloodshed and deceit / Will not live out half their days; / But I will trust in You.

1.text: Be gracious to me, O God; for man tramples me; / All day long he, fighting, oppresses me.

2.text: Those who lie in wait for me trample me all day long, / For many are those who arrogantly fight against me.

3.text: When I am afraid, / I trust in You.

4.text: In God, whose word I praise, / In God do I trust, and I will not be afraid. / What can flesh do to me?

5.text: All day long they wrest my words; / All their thoughts are against me for evil.

6.text: They gather themselves; they lurk; / They watch my steps, / As they have waited to take my life.

7.text: Will there be deliverance for them in spite of their iniquity? / In anger cast down the peoples, O God.

8.text: You have counted my wanderings. / Put my tears into Your bottle. / Are they not in Your book?

9.text: Then my enemies will turn back / When I call; / This I know, / That God is for me.

10.text: In God, whose word I praise, / In Jehovah, whose word I praise,

11.text: In God do I trust; I will not be afraid. / What can man do to me?

12.text: Your vows, O God, are on me; / I will render thank offerings to You.

13.text: For You have delivered my soul from death, / Indeed, my feet from stumbling, / That I may walk before God / In the light of the living.

1.text: Be gracious to me, O God, be gracious to me; / For my soul takes refuge in You; / Indeed in the shadow of Your wings I will take refuge, / Until the destruction passes by.

2.text: I call out to God the Most High, / To the God who accomplishes all things for me.

3.text: He sends forth from heaven and saves me; / He reproaches him who would trample me; Selah / God sends forth / His lovingkindness and His faithfulness.

4.text: My soul is among lions; / I lie down among those who blaze forth, the sons of men, / Whose teeth are spears and arrows, / And whose tongue is a sharp sword.

5.text: Be exalted above the heavens, O God; / Let Your glory be above all the earth.

6.text: They have prepared a net for my steps; / My soul is bowed down. / They have dug a pit before me; / They have fallen into it themselves. Selah

7.text: My heart is steadfast, O God; / My heart is steadfast. / I will sing, indeed I will sing psalms.

8.text: Awake, my glory; / Awake, O harp and lyre! / I will awaken the dawn.

9.text: I will give thanks to You among the peoples, O Lord; / I will sing psalms to You among the nations.

10.text: For Your lovingkindness is as great as the heavens; / And Your faithfulness reaches unto the skies.

11.text: Be exalted above the heavens, O God; / Let Your glory be above all the earth.

1.text: Do you indeed, O judges, speak righteousness? / Do you judge in uprightness, O sons of men?

2.text: No, in heart you perform injustice; / You weigh out the violence of your hands on earth.

3.text: The wicked are estranged from the womb; / They err from their birth, speaking lies.

4.text: Their venom is like the venom of a serpent; / They are like the deaf cobra that has shut its ear,

5.text: Which does not hear the sound of the charmers / Or the wise spellbinder.

6.text: O God, break their teeth in their mouth; / Break off the fangs of the young lions, O Jehovah.

7.text: Let them melt like water that runs off. / When he shoots his arrows, / Let them be as though they were cut off.

8.text: Let them be like a snail that melts and goes away, / Like a woman's miscarriage, which by no means sees the sun.

9.text: Before your pots can feel the fire of the thorns, / Whether green or burning, He will sweep them away.

10.text: The righteous man will rejoice when he sees vengeance; / He will wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.

11.text: And men will say, Indeed there is fruit for the righteous man; / Indeed there is a God who judges on earth.

1.text: Deliver me from my enemies, O my God; / Set me on high, secure from those who rise up against me.

2.text: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, / And save me from men of bloodshed.

3.text: For behold, they lie in wait for my soul; / The strong gather themselves against me. / Not because of any transgression of mine nor because of any sin of mine, O Jehovah,

4.text: Not for any fault of mine, they run and ready themselves; / Awake to meet me, and see.

5.text: Indeed You, O Jehovah, God of hosts, God of Israel, / Arise to punish all the nations; / Have no mercy upon any who treacherously commit iniquity. Selah

6.text: They return in the evening; / They growl like a dog / And go around the city.

7.text: Behold, they belch forth with their mouth; / Swords are in their lips; / For, Who, they say, hears?

8.text: But You, O Jehovah, laugh at them; / You have all the nations in derision.

9.text: O my strength, I will watch for You; / For God is my high retreat.

10.text: My God in His lovingkindness will meet me; / God will let me look triumphantly upon those who lie in wait for me.

11.text: Do not slay them, lest my people forget; / Scatter them by Your power, and bring them down, / O Lord our shield.

12.text: For the sin of their mouth, / For the word of their lips, / Let them even be taken in their arrogance, / And because of the cursing and the lying that they speak.

13.text: Consume them in wrath; consume them so that they are no more; / And men will know that God rules in Jacob / Unto the ends of the earth. Selah

14.text: They return in the evening; / They growl like a dog / And go around the city.

15.text: They wander about for food; / And if they are not filled, they linger.

16.text: But I will sing of Your strength; / And I will joyfully sing of Your lovingkindness in the morning. / For You have been my high retreat / And a refuge in the day of my distress.

17.text: O my strength, unto You I will sing psalms, / For God is my high retreat, / My God of lovingkindness.

1.text: O God, You have rejected us; You have broken out upon us; / You have been angry. Restore us.

2.text: You have caused the earth to quake; You have split it open. / Heal the breaks in it, for it totters.

3.text: You have shown Your people hard things; / You have made us drink wine to stagger us.

4.text: You have given a banner to those who fear You, / To be displayed because of the truth. Selah

5.text: That Your beloved ones may be delivered, / Save with Your right hand, and answer us.

6.text: God has spoken in His holiness: I will exult; / I will divide Shechem / And measure out the Valley of Succoth.

7.text: Gilead is Mine, and Manasseh is Mine, / And Ephraim is the helmet for My head; / Judah is My scepter.

8.text: Moab is My washbowl; / Upon Edom I will cast My sandal; / Philistia, shout aloud because of Me.

9.text: Who will bring me into the besieged city? / Who will lead me to Edom?

10.text: Will not You, O God, who rejected us / And who did not go forth, O God, with our armies?

11.text: Give us help from the adversary, / For a salvation by man is vain.

12.text: In God we will do valiantly, / And it is He who will tread down our adversaries.

1.text: Hear, O God, my cry; / Give heed to my prayer.

2.text: From the end of the earth / I will call out unto You / When my heart faints; / Lead me to the rock that is higher than I.

3.text: For You are a refuge to me, / A strong tower before the enemy.

4.text: Let me sojourn in Your tent forever; / Let me take refuge in the covering of Your wings. Selah

5.text: For You, O God, have heard my vows; / You have given me the inheritance of those who fear Your name.

6.text: You will add days to the days of the king; / May his years be like generation after generation.

7.text: May he dwell forever before God; / Appoint lovingkindness and faithfulness, that they may preserve him.

8.text: So I will sing psalms to Your name forever, / As I repay my vows day by day.

1.text: My soul waits in silence for God alone; / My salvation is from Him.

2.text: He alone is my rock and my salvation, / My high retreat; I will not be greatly shaken.

3.text: How long will you assail a man / So that you may slay him, all of you, / Like a leaning wall or a tottering fence?

4.text: They only make plans to thrust him down from his dignity; / They take delight in lies; / With their mouth they bless, / But inwardly they curse. Selah

5.text: My soul, wait in silence for God alone, / For my expectation is from Him.

6.text: He alone is my rock and my salvation, / My high retreat; I will not be shaken.

7.text: On God my salvation and my glory depend; / The rock of my strength, my refuge, is in God.

8.text: Trust in Him at all times, O people; / Pour out your heart before Him; / God is a refuge to us. Selah

9.text: Men of low degree are but a vapor; / Men of high degree, a lie. / In the balances they go up; / Together they are less than a vapor.

10.text: Do not trust in oppression, / And do not vainly hope in robbery; / If wealth increases, / Do not set your heart on it.

11.text: Once has God spoken; / Twice have I heard this, / That strength belongs to God.

12.text: To You also, O Lord, belongs lovingkindness; / For You repay every man according to his work.

1.text: O God, You are my God; I seek You diligently. / My soul thirsts for You, / My flesh faints in longing for You, / In a dry and weary land without water.

2.text: So I have looked upon You in the sanctuary, / Seeing Your power and Your glory.

3.text: Because Your lovingkindness is better than life, / My lips praise You.

4.text: Thus I bless You while I live; / I lift up my hands in Your name.

5.text: My soul is satisfied as with the rich fatness, / And my mouth praises You with lips of joyous shouting,

6.text: When I remember You while on my bed, / When I consider You in the night watches.

7.text: For You have been my help, / And in the shadow of Your wings I will shout for joy.

8.text: My soul pursues after You; / Your right hand upholds me.

9.text: But those who seek my life to destroy it / Will go into the lower parts of the earth;

10.text: They will be given over to the power of the sword; / They will be the portion of foxes.

11.text: But the king will rejoice in God; / Everyone who swears by Him will boast; / For the mouth of those who speak falsehood will be stopped.

1.text: Hear, O God, my voice in my complaint; / Preserve my life from the enemy's dread.

2.text: Hide me from the secret counsel of evildoers, / From the throng of the workers of iniquity,

3.text: Who have sharpened their tongue like a sword, / Who have aimed their arrow, their bitter word,

4.text: To shoot in secret places at the perfect man. / They shoot suddenly at him and do not fear.

5.text: They firm up for themselves an evil matter; / They talk of laying snares secretly; / They say, Who will see them?

6.text: They seek out injustices, saying: / We have completed a carefully sought-out plan. / Indeed each man's inward thought / And heart are deep.

7.text: But God will shoot an arrow at them; / Suddenly they are wounded.

8.text: They are made to stumble over each other by their own tongue; / All who see them shake their heads.

9.text: And all men will fear / And declare what has been done by God, / And they will ponder His work.

10.text: The righteous man will rejoice in Jehovah and take refuge in Him, / And all the upright in heart will boast.

1.text: Praise befits You, O God, in Zion; / And to You is the vow paid.

2.text: O You who hear prayer, / To You all flesh comes.

3.text: Iniquities prevail against me; / As for our transgressions, You make propitiation for them.

4.text: Blessed is he whom You have chosen and bring near / To dwell in Your courts. / We will be satisfied with the goodness of Your house, / Of Your holy temple.

5.text: By awesome deeds You answer us in righteousness, / O God of our salvation, / You who are the trust of all the ends of the earth / And of the remotest sea;

6.text: Who established the mountains in His strength, / Girded with might;

7.text: Who stilled the roaring of the seas, / The roaring of their billows, / And the tumult of the peoples.

8.text: And they who dwell in the uttermost parts / Are afraid of Your signs; / You make the exitways of the morning and the evening / Shout for joy.

9.text: You visit the earth and water it; / You enrich it greatly: / The river of God is full of water. / You provide men grain, for so You have prepared the earth.

10.text: Saturating its furrows, settling its ridges, / You soften it with showers; / You bless its sprouting forth.

11.text: You place a crown on a year with Your goodness, / And Your wagon tracks drop fatness;

12.text: The wilderness pastures overflow, / And the hills gird themselves with exultation.

13.text: The meadows are clothed with the flock, / And the valleys cover themselves in grain; / They shout for joy; indeed they sing.

1.text: Shout joyfully to God, all the earth;

2.text: Sing forth the glory of His name; / Make glorious His praise.

3.text: Say to God, How awesome are Your deeds! / Because of the greatness of Your strength, Your enemies come cringing to You.

4.text: All the earth will worship You / And sing psalms to You; / They will sing psalms to Your name. Selah

5.text: Come and see the works of God; / He is awesome in His deeds toward the sons of men.

6.text: He turned the sea into dry land; / Through the river they crossed on foot. / There we rejoiced in Him.

7.text: He rules by His might forever; / His eyes observe the nations: / Let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah

8.text: Bless our God, O peoples; / And make the voice of His praise heard,

9.text: Who has kept our soul in life / And does not allow our feet to slip.

10.text: For You have tried us, O God; / You have refined us as silver is refined.

11.text: You have brought us into the net; / You have put a heavy burden on our loins.

12.text: You have made men ride over our heads; / We have gone through fire and water; / But You have brought us forth into abundance.

13.text: I will come into Your house with burnt offerings; / I will pay my vows to You,

14.text: Which my lips uttered / And my mouth spoke when I was in distress.

15.text: I will offer to You burnt offerings of fatlings / With the smoke of rams; / I will offer cattle with goats. Selah

16.text: Come, hear, all you who fear God, / And I will recount what He has done for my soul.

17.text: To Him I called out with my mouth, / And He was extolled with my tongue.

18.text: If I regarded iniquity in my heart, / The Lord did not hear.

19.text: But indeed God has heard; / He has given heed to the voice of my prayer.

20.text: Blessed be God, / Who has not turned my prayer away / Nor His lovingkindness from me.

1.text: God be gracious to us and bless us; / May He make His face shine upon us; Selah

2.text: That Your way may be known on earth, / And Your salvation among all the nations.

3.text: Let the peoples praise You, O God; / Let the peoples praise You, all of them.

4.text: Let the nations rejoice and shout for joy, / For You will judge the peoples equitably / And will guide the nations on the earth. Selah

5.text: Let the peoples praise You, O God; / Let the peoples praise You, all of them.

6.text: The earth has yielded its increase; / God, our God, blesses us.

7.text: God blesses us; / And all the ends of the earth will fear Him.

1.text: Let God arise; let His enemies be scattered; / And let those who hate Him flee before Him.

2.text: As smoke is driven away, You will drive them away; / As wax melts before fire, / The wicked will perish before God.

3.text: But the righteous will rejoice; they will exult before God / And be glad with rejoicing.

4.text: Sing to God; sing psalms to His name; / Triumph in Him who rides through the deserts -- / For Jah is His name -- and exult before Him.

5.text: A Father to the orphans and a Judge for the widows / Is God in His holy habitation.

6.text: God causes the solitary to dwell in a household; / He brings the prisoners forth into prosperity; / But the rebellious dwell in a parched land.

7.text: O God, when You went forth before Your people, / When You marched through the desert, Selah

8.text: The earth trembled, the heavens also dripped, / At the presence of God; / Sinai there quaked / At the presence of God, the God of Israel.

9.text: You shed forth bountiful rain, O God; / You confirmed Your inheritance when it languished.

10.text: Your living flock dwelt in the land; / In Your goodness You provided for the poor, O God.

11.text: The Lord gives the command; / The women who bear the glad tidings are a great host.

12.text: The kings of the armies flee. / They flee! / And she who abides at home / Divides the spoil.

13.text: Though you lie among the sheepfolds, / There are dove wings covered with silver, / And its pinions, with greenish-yellow gold.

14.text: When the Almighty scattered / The kings in the land, / It snowed on Zalmon.

15.text: O mighty mountain, O mountain of Bashan, / O many-peaked mountain, O mountain of Bashan:

16.text: Why do you look with envy, O many-peaked mountains, / At the mountain on which God desires to dwell? / Indeed Jehovah will dwell there forever.

17.text: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, / Thousands upon thousands; / The Lord is among them, / As at Sinai, in the sanctuary.

18.text: You have ascended on high; You have led captive those taken captive; / You have received gifts among men, / Even the rebellious ones also, / That Jehovah God may dwell among them.

19.text: Blessed be the Lord, who day by day loads us with good; / God is our salvation. Selah

20.text: God is to us / A God of deliverance, / And with Jehovah the Lord / Are the goings forth even from death.

21.text: Indeed God will smash / The head of His enemies, / The hairy crown / Of him who goes about in his guiltiness.

22.text: The Lord said, I will bring them again from Bashan; / I will bring them again from the depths of the sea,

23.text: That you may bathe your foot in blood, / That the tongue of your dogs may have their portion from the enemies.

24.text: They have seen Your goings, O God, / The goings of my God, my King, in the sanctuary:

25.text: Singers go before; players after; / In the midst of virgins sounding the tambourines.

26.text: Bless God in the congregations, / Even Jehovah, O you who are of the fountain of Israel.

27.text: There are little Benjamin, who rules them, / And the princes of Judah in their company, / The princes of Zebulun, the princes of Naphtali.

28.text: Your God has commanded your strength; / Strengthen, O God, that which You have done for us.

29.text: Because of Your temple at Jerusalem, / Kings will bring a gift to You.

30.text: Rebuke the animals of the reeds, / The herd of the bulls among the calves of the peoples, / Trampling on those who lust after silver; / Scatter the peoples who take delight in war.

31.text: Nobles will come out of Egypt; / Cush will quickly stretch out its hands to God.

32.text: O kingdoms of the earth, / Sing to God, / Sing psalms to the Lord, Selah

33.text: To Him who rides upon the ancient heaven of heavens. / Behold, He utters His voice, a mighty voice.

34.text: Ascribe strength to God; / His excellence is over Israel, / And His strength is in the skies.

35.text: You are awesome, O God, from Your sanctuaries. / The God of Israel, He gives strength and power to the people. / Blessed be God!

1.text: Save me, O God; for the waters / Threaten my life.

2.text: I sink in deep mire, / And there is no place to stand; / I have come to the depths of water, / And the flood flows over me.

3.text: I am weary of my crying; / My throat is parched; / My eyes fail / While I wait for my God.

4.text: More numerous than the hairs of my head / Are those who hate me without cause; / Mighty are those who would destroy me, / Those who are wrongly my enemies. / What I did not steal, / I must then restore.

5.text: O God, You know my foolishness, / And my sins of guilt are not hidden from You.

6.text: Do not let those who wait on You be put to shame because of me, / O Lord Jehovah of hosts; / Do not let those who seek You be humiliated because of me, / O God of Israel.

7.text: Because for Your sake I have borne reproach; / Humiliation has covered my face.

8.text: I have become a stranger to my brothers, / And a foreigner to my mother's children.

9.text: For the zeal of Your house has devoured me, / And the reproaches of those who reproach You have fallen on me.

10.text: When I wept, when my soul was in fasting, / That became a reproach to me.

11.text: When I made sackcloth my clothing, / I became a proverb to them.

12.text: Those who sit in the gate talk about me, / And I am the mocking song of those who drink liquor.

13.text: But as for me, my prayer is to You, / O Jehovah, in an acceptable time; / O God, in the abundance of Your lovingkindness answer me, / In the faithfulness of Your salvation.

14.text: Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink; / May I be delivered from those who hate me, / And out of the depths of water.

15.text: Do not let the flood of water flow over me, / Nor let the deep swallow me, / Nor let the pit close its mouth over me.

16.text: Answer me, O Jehovah; for Your lovingkindness is good; / According to the abundance of Your compassions turn to me.

17.text: And do not hide Your face from Your servant, / For I am in distress; hurry and answer me.

18.text: Draw near to my soul; redeem it; / Ransom me because of my enemies.

19.text: You know my reproach / And my shame and my humiliation; / All my adversaries are before You.

20.text: Reproach has broken my heart, / And I am sick; / I looked for pity, but there was none; / And for comforters, but I found none.

21.text: But they gave me gall for my food, / And for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

22.text: May their table become a snare before them / And a trap when they are at peace.

23.text: May their eyes be darkened so that they cannot see; / And make their loins shake continually.

24.text: Pour out Your indignation upon them; / And may the burning fierceness of Your anger overtake them.

25.text: May their camp be desolate; / May there be no one to dwell in their tents.

26.text: For they persecute him whom You have stricken, / And they recount the pain of those whom You have wounded.

27.text: Add iniquity to their iniquity, / And do not let them come into Your righteousness.

28.text: May they be blotted out of the book of life, / And may they not be written with the righteous.

29.text: But I am poor and pained; / May Your salvation, O God, set me on high.

30.text: I will praise the name of God with a song / And will magnify Him with thanksgiving;

31.text: And it will be better to Jehovah than an ox / Or a bull with horns and hooves.

32.text: The meek have seen it; they rejoice. / You who seek God, let your heart revive.

33.text: For Jehovah listens to the needy, / And He does not despise His prisoners.

34.text: Let the heavens and the earth praise Him, / The seas and everything that moves in them.

35.text: For God will save Zion / And build the cities of Judah; / And they will abide there and possess it.

36.text: And the seed of His servants will inherit it, / And those who love His name will dwell in it.

1.text: O God, hasten to deliver me; / O Jehovah, hasten to help me.

2.text: May those who seek my life / Be put to shame and confounded; / May those who take delight in my misfortune / Be turned back and humiliated;

3.text: May those who say, Aha! Aha! / Turn away because of their shame;

4.text: May all those who seek You / Be glad and rejoice in You; / And may those who love Your salvation / Say continually, / May God be magnified!

5.text: But I am poor and needy; / O God, hasten to me. / You are my help and my Deliverer; / O Jehovah, do not delay.

1.text: In You, O Jehovah, do I take refuge; / Never let me be put to shame.

2.text: In Your righteousness deliver me and rescue me; / Incline Your ear to me and save me.

3.text: Be to me a rock of habitation for me to come to continually. / You have given command to save me, / For You are my rock and my fortress.

4.text: My God, rescue me from the hand of the wicked, / From the hand of the unjust and cruel;

5.text: For You are my hope, O Lord Jehovah, / My trust from my youth.

6.text: On You I have been sustained since birth; / It was You who took me from my mother's womb; / My praise is continually of You.

7.text: I am like a wonder to many, / But You are my strong refuge.

8.text: My mouth is filled with Your praise, / With Your glory, all day long.

9.text: Do not cast me off in the time of old age; / When my strength fails, do not forsake me.

10.text: For my enemies speak concerning me, / And those who watch for my soul take counsel together,

11.text: Saying, God has forsaken him; / Pursue and lay hold of him, for there is no one to deliver him.

12.text: O God, do not be far away from me; / My God, hasten to help me.

13.text: May those who are the adversaries to my soul / Be put to shame and consumed; / May those who seek my misfortune / Wrap themselves in reproach and humiliation.

14.text: But I will hope continually / And will add yet more to all Your praise.

15.text: My mouth will recount Your righteousness, / Your salvation, all day long; / For I do not know its full numbers.

16.text: I will come with the proof of the mighty acts of the Lord Jehovah; / I will remind men of Your righteousness, Yours alone.

17.text: O God, You have taught me from my youth; / And until now I have declared Your wondrous deeds.

18.text: So even into my old age and grayheadedness, / O God, do not forsake me, / Until I have declared Your strength / Unto the next generation, / Your might unto everyone who is to come.

19.text: And Your righteousness, O God, is so high, / You who have done great things. / O God, who is like You?

20.text: You who have shown me / Many great troubles / Will revive me again / And bring me up again / From the depths of the earth.

21.text: You will increase my greatness / And will turn and comfort me.

22.text: I will also praise You with the harp, / I will praise Your faithfulness, my God; / I will sing psalms to You with the lyre, / O Holy One of Israel.

23.text: My lips will give a ringing shout / When I sing psalms to You, / And my soul, which You have redeemed.

24.text: My tongue also will declare / Your righteousness all day long; / For they are put to shame, for they are confounded, / They who seek my misfortune.

1.text: O God, give Your judgments to the king, / And Your righteousness to the son of the king.

2.text: He will judge Your people in righteousness, / And Your poor with justice.

3.text: The mountains will bear peace to the people, / And the hills, in righteousness.

4.text: He will judge the poor of the people; / He will save the children of the needy / And crush the oppressor.

5.text: They will fear You as long as the sun endures / And as long as the moon endures / Throughout the generations.

6.text: He will drop like rain upon mown grass, / Like abundant showers dripping on the earth.

7.text: In His days the righteous will flourish, / And there will be an abundance of peace / Until the moon is no more.

8.text: And He will have dominion from sea to sea / And from the River unto the ends of the earth.

9.text: The desert dwellers will bow down before Him, / And His enemies will lick the dust.

10.text: The kings of Tarshish and of the coastlands / Will pay tribute; / The kings of Sheba and Seba / Will present gifts.

11.text: And all the kings will bow down before Him; / All the nations will serve Him.

12.text: For He will deliver the needy man when he cries, / And the poor man who has no one to help him.

13.text: He will have pity on the weak and needy, / And the souls of the needy He will save.

14.text: From oppression and violence / He will redeem their soul, / And their blood will be precious in His sight.

15.text: So He shall live and to Him shall be given / The gold of Sheba; / And prayer shall be made continually for Him; / He shall be blessed all the day long.

16.text: There will be an abundance of grain on the earth, / Even at the tops of the mountains. / Its fruit will wave like the forests of Lebanon, / And those of the city will blossom like the foliage of the earth.

17.text: His name will be forever; / As long as the sun endures, His name will spread; / And men will be blessed in Him; / All the nations will call Him blessed.

18.text: Blessed be Jehovah God, the God of Israel, / Who alone does wondrous deeds;

19.text: And blessed be His glorious name forever; / And may His glory fill the whole earth. / Amen and Amen.

20.text: The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.

1.text: Surely God is good to Israel, / To those who are pure in heart.

2.text: But as for me, my feet were nearly turned aside; / My steps had almost slipped.

3.text: For I was envious of the arrogant, / When I saw the prosperity of the wicked.

4.text: For they have no pangs in their death, / And their body is well nourished.

5.text: They do not find themselves in the hardship of men, / Nor are they plagued like other men.

6.text: Therefore pride is a necklace for them; / Violence covers them like a garment.

7.text: Their eyes bulge out from fatness; / The imaginations of their heart overflow.

8.text: They mock and wickedly speak of oppression; / They speak loftily.

9.text: They set their mouth against the heavens, / And their tongue walks about on the earth.

10.text: Therefore His people return here, / And waters of abundance are drained by them;

11.text: And they say, How does God know? / And is there knowledge with the Most High?

12.text: Behold, these are the wicked; / And always at ease, they heap up riches.

13.text: Surely I have purified my heart in vain, / And I have washed my hands in innocence.

14.text: For I have been plagued all day long / And chastened every morning.

15.text: If I had said, I will speak thus; / Behold, I would have betrayed the generation of Your children.

16.text: When I considered this in order to understand it, / It was a troublesome task in my sight,

17.text: Until I went into the sanctuary of God; / Then I perceived their end.

18.text: Surely You set them in slippery places; / You cast them down into ruins.

19.text: How they are made desolate in a moment! / They are utterly consumed by terrors.

20.text: Like a dream, when one awakes, You, O Lord, / Upon arising, will despise their image.

21.text: When my heart was embittered, / And inwardly I was pricked;

22.text: I was brutish and knew nothing; / I was like a beast before You.

23.text: Nevertheless I am continually with You; / You have taken hold of my right hand.

24.text: You will guide me with Your counsel, / And afterward You will receive me in glory.

25.text: Whom do I have in heaven but You? / And besides You there is nothing I desire on earth.

26.text: My flesh and my heart fail, / But God is the rock of my heart and my portion forever.

27.text: For behold, those who are far from You will perish; / You destroy all who go about as harlots away from You.

28.text: But as for me, drawing near to God is good for me; / I have made the Lord Jehovah my refuge, / That I may declare all Your works.

1.text: Why, O God, have You cast us off forever? / Why does Your anger smoke against the sheep of Your pasture?

2.text: Remember Your assembly, which You have purchased of old, / Which You have redeemed as the tribe of Your inheritance, / And Mount Zion, where You dwell.

3.text: Lift up Your steps unto the perpetual ruins; / The enemy has damaged everything in the sanctuary.

4.text: Your adversaries have roared in the midst of Your assembly place; / They have set up their symbols as signs.

5.text: It looked like when men bring up axes / On the thicket of the trees.

6.text: And now they have struck down with hatchet and hammer / Its carved work altogether.

7.text: They have set fire to Your sanctuary; / They have defiled the dwelling place of Your name to the ground.

8.text: They said in their heart, Let us oppress them completely. / They have burned down all God's assembly places in the land.

9.text: We do not see our signs; there is no longer a prophet, / Nor is there anyone among us who knows how long.

10.text: How long, O God, will the adversary reproach? / Will the enemy despise Your name forever?

11.text: Why do You withdraw Your hand, even Your right hand? / Bring it forth from the midst of Your bosom; destroy them.

12.text: But God is my King of old, / Accomplishing salvation in the midst of the earth.

13.text: You divided the sea by Your strength; / You broke the heads of the sea serpents on the waters.

14.text: You crushed the heads of the leviathan; / You gave him as food to the creatures of the desert.

15.text: You broke open the fountain and the torrent; / You dried up the ever-flowing streams.

16.text: The day is Yours; the night also is Yours; / You prepared the moon and the sun.

17.text: You established all the borders of the earth: / You formed the summer and the winter.

18.text: Remember this: The enemy has reproached Jehovah, / And a foolish people has despised Your name.

19.text: Do not give the soul of Your turtledove to the wild beast; / Do not forget the life of Your poor forever.

20.text: Regard the covenant, / For the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of violence.

21.text: Do not let him who is oppressed return ashamed. / May the poor and needy praise Your name.

22.text: Arise, O God; contend for Your own cause; / Remember how the foolish man reproaches You all day long.

23.text: Do not forget the voice of Your adversaries; / The roar of those who rise up against You goes up continually.

1.text: We give thanks to You, O God; we give thanks, / For Your name is near; men tell of Your wondrous deeds.

2.text: When I choose the appointed time, / It is I who judge with equity.

3.text: The earth and all who dwell in it melt; / I have established its pillars. Selah

4.text: I said to the boastful, Do not boast; / And to the wicked, Do not lift up the horn.

5.text: Do not lift your horn on high; / Do not speak arrogantly with a haughty neck.

6.text: For neither from the east nor from the west, / And neither from the south, does exaltation come;

7.text: For God is the Judge: / He puts this one down and exalts that one.

8.text: For there is a cup in the hand of Jehovah, / And the wine foams; it is full of mixture, / And He pours from it; indeed its dregs will all the wicked of the earth / Drain off and drink up.

9.text: But as for me, I will declare forever, / I will sing psalms to the God of Jacob.

10.text: And all the horns of the wicked will I cut off, / But the horns of the righteous man will be exalted.

1.text: God is known in Judah; / His name is great in Israel.

2.text: And in Salem is His tabernacle, / And His dwelling place, in Zion.

3.text: There He broke the flashing arrows of the bow, / The shield and the sword and the battle. Selah

4.text: More glorious are You, / More excellent than the mountains of prey.

5.text: The stouthearted are despoiled; / They slept their sleep, / And none of the men of strength / Have found their hands.

6.text: At Your rebuke, O God of Jacob, / Both chariot and horse fall into deep sleep.

7.text: You, indeed You, are to be feared; / And who may stand before You once You are angry?

8.text: You caused judgment to be heard from the heavens; / The earth feared and was still,

9.text: When God rose for judgment, / To save all the meek of the earth. Selah

10.text: For the wrath of man will praise You; / You will gird Yourself with the remainder of wrath.

11.text: Make vows and pay them to Jehovah your God; / Let all who are around Him bring gifts to Him who is to be feared.

12.text: He will cut off the spirit of the princes; / He is terrible to the kings of the earth.

1.text: My voice calls out to God, and I will cry out; / My voice calls out to God, and He will give ear to me.

2.text: In the day of my distress I sought the Lord; / My hand was stretched out in the night, and it did not drop. / My soul refused to be comforted.

3.text: I remember God, and I moan; / I complain, and my spirit faints. Selah

4.text: You hold open my eyelids; / I am disturbed and cannot speak.

5.text: I consider the days of old, / The years of ancient times;

6.text: I remember my song in the night; / I muse with my own heart, and my spirit carefully searches.

7.text: Will the Lord cast us off forever, / And will He never be favorable to us again?

8.text: Has His lovingkindness ceased forever? / Has the promise come to an end for all generations?

9.text: Has God forgotten to be gracious? / Or has He in anger shut up His compassions? Selah

10.text: Then I said, This is my infirmity; / But I recall the years of the right hand of the Most High.

11.text: I will bring to remembrance the deeds of Jehovah, / For I will remember Your wonders from of old.

12.text: And I will meditate on all that You have done / And muse on Your doings.

13.text: O God, Your way is in the sanctuary; / Who is so great a god as God?

14.text: You are the God who does wonders; / You have made known Your strength among the peoples.

15.text: You redeemed Your people with Your arm, / The sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah

16.text: The waters saw You, O God; / The waters saw You; they were afraid; / Indeed the depths trembled.

17.text: The clouds poured forth water; / The skies sent forth a sound; / Indeed Your arrows went here and there.

18.text: The sound of Your thunder was in the whirlwind; / Lightning illuminated the world; / The earth trembled and quaked.

19.text: Your way was in the sea, / And Your paths in the great waters; / And Your footsteps were not known.

20.text: You led Your people like a flock / By the hand of Moses and Aaron.

1.text: Give ear, O my people, to my instruction; / Incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

2.text: I will open my mouth in a parable; / I will utter riddles from of old,

3.text: Which we have heard and known, / And our fathers have related to us.

4.text: We will not hide them from their children, / But will relate to the generation to come / The praises of Jehovah and His strength / And His wondrous deeds that He has done.

5.text: Indeed He has established a testimony in Jacob / And appointed a law in Israel, / Which He commanded our fathers / That they should make them known to their children;

6.text: That the generation to come, / The children to be born, may know them, / Who should arise and relate them to their children;

7.text: That they might set their hope in God, / And not forget the deeds of God, / But observe His commandments;

8.text: That they might not be like their fathers, / A stubborn and rebellious generation, / A generation that did not set their heart right, / And whose spirit was not faithful to God.

9.text: The children of Ephraim, armed archers with bows, / Turned back in the day of battle.

10.text: They did not keep the covenant of God, / And they refused to walk in His law.

11.text: And they forgot His doings / And His wondrous deeds that He had shown them.

12.text: He did something wonderful in the sight of their fathers / In the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.

13.text: He divided the sea and caused them to pass through, / And He made the water stand as a heap.

14.text: And He led them with the cloud by day / And all the night with a light of fire.

15.text: He split rocks in the wilderness / And gave them abundant drink, as from the depths.

16.text: He also brought forth streams from the rock / And made water run down like rivers.

17.text: Yet they still continued to sin against Him, / To rebel against the Most High in the desert.

18.text: And they put God to the test in their heart, / By asking for food according to their desire.

19.text: They also spoke against God; / They said, Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?

20.text: Behold, He struck the rock, / And water gushed out, / And streams overflowed; / Can He also give us bread, / Or provide meat for His people?

21.text: Therefore Jehovah heard and was angry. / And a fire was kindled against Jacob, / And also anger went up against Israel;

22.text: Because they did not believe in God, / And they did not trust in His salvation.

23.text: Yet He commanded the skies above / And opened the doors of heaven;

24.text: And He rained down upon them manna to eat / And gave them the food of heaven.

25.text: Man ate the bread of the mighty; / He sent them full provision.

26.text: He made the east wind blow in the heavens / And guided the south wind by His strength.

27.text: And He rained upon them meat like dust, / And winged birds like the sand of the seas.

28.text: And He made it fall in the midst of their camp, / Around their habitations.

29.text: So they ate and were well filled; / Indeed what they desired He brought to them.

30.text: They were not estranged from what they desired; / Their food was still in their mouths

31.text: When the anger of God went up against them / And slew some of their fattest ones / And struck down the choice men of Israel.

32.text: In spite of all this they still sinned / And did not believe in His wondrous deeds.

33.text: Therefore He consumed their days with vanity, / And their years with terror.

34.text: When He slew them, they inquired after Him, / And they returned and diligently sought God.

35.text: And they remembered that God was their rock, / And the Most High God, their Redeemer.

36.text: But they flattered Him with their mouth / And lied to Him with their tongue.

37.text: For their heart was not steadfast toward Him, / Nor were they faithful to His covenant.

38.text: But He, being merciful, forgave their iniquity / And did not destroy them; / Indeed He turned back His anger many times / And did not stir up all His wrath.

39.text: And He remembered that they were flesh, / A wind that goes away and does not return.

40.text: How often they rebelled against Him in the wilderness / And grieved Him in the desert!

41.text: And they repeatedly put God to the test / And provoked the Holy One of Israel.

42.text: They did not remember His hand, / The day when He ransomed them from the adversary;

43.text: When He set His signs in Egypt / And His wonders in the field of Zoan;

44.text: And He turned their rivers into blood, / As well as their streams, so that they could not drink.

45.text: He sent among them a swarm of flies, which devoured them; / And frogs, which destroyed them.

46.text: And He gave their increase to the consuming locust, / And their labor to the swarming locust.

47.text: He killed their vines with hail, / And their sycamores with ice stones.

48.text: He gave over their cattle also to the hail / And their herds to the lightning bolts.

49.text: He sent among them the burning fierceness of His anger, / Overflowing wrath and indignation and trouble, / A mission of angels of evils.

50.text: He leveled a path for His anger; / He did not spare their soul from death, / But gave their life over to the pestilence.

51.text: And He struck all the firstborn in Egypt, / The firstfruits of their vigor in the tents of Ham.

52.text: But He set forth His people like sheep / And led them like a flock in the wilderness.

53.text: And He led them to safety, so that they did not fear; / But the sea covered their enemies.

54.text: And He brought them forth to His holy border, / The mountain, which His right hand had acquired.

55.text: And He drove out the nations before them / And allotted them as an inheritance by line, / And He made the tribes of Israel dwell there in their tents.

56.text: Yet they put Him to the test and rebelled against God the Most High, / And did not keep His testimonies.

57.text: And they turned back and dealt treacherously, as their fathers had done; / They turned aside like a deceitful bow.

58.text: Indeed they provoked Him to anger with their high places / And made Him jealous with their graven images.

59.text: God heard, and He was angered; / And He greatly abhorred Israel.

60.text: Thus He forsook the tabernacle in Shiloh, / The tent in which He dwelt among men;

61.text: And He gave over His Ark into captivity, / And His glory into the hand of the adversary.

62.text: He also delivered His people to the sword / And was angry with His inheritance.

63.text: Fire devoured their young men, / And their virgins had no marriage song.

64.text: Their priests fell by the sword, / And their widows did not lament.

65.text: Then the Lord awoke as if from sleep, / Like a mighty man who shouts because of wine.

66.text: And He struck His adversaries and sent them back; / He put an everlasting reproach upon them.

67.text: And He rejected the tent of Joseph, / And the tribe of Ephraim He did not choose.

68.text: Rather He chose the tribe of Judah, / Mount Zion, which He loved.

69.text: And He built His sanctuary like the heights, / Like the earth that He has founded forever.

70.text: Moreover He chose David His servant / And took him from the sheepfolds;

71.text: From following after the ewes He brought him / To shepherd Jacob His people / And Israel His inheritance.

72.text: And he shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart, / And guided them by the skillfulness of his hands.

1.text: O God, the nations have come into Your inheritance; / They have defiled Your holy temple; / They have turned Jerusalem into heaps.

2.text: They have given the dead bodies of Your servants / As food for the birds of heaven, / The flesh of Your saints to the animals of the earth.

3.text: They have poured out their blood like water around Jerusalem, / And there was no one to bury them.

4.text: We have become a reproach to our neighbors, / A mocking and a derision to those around us.

5.text: How long, O Jehovah? Will You be angry forever? / Will Your jealousy burn like fire?

6.text: Pour out Your wrath upon the nations / Who do not know You, / And upon the kingdoms / Who do not call upon Your name.

7.text: For they have devoured Jacob / And have desolated his habitation.

8.text: Do not remember against us the iniquities of our forefathers; / May Your compassions quickly meet us, / For we have been brought very low.

9.text: Help us, O God of our salvation, / For the glory of Your name; / And deliver us and expiate our sins, / For Your name's sake.

10.text: Why should the nations say, / Where is their God? / May the avenging of the blood of Your servants, which has been poured out, / Be known among the nations in our sight.

11.text: May the sighing of the prisoner come before You. / According to the greatness of Your power preserve those appointed to die,

12.text: And render to our neighbors sevenfold into their bosom / Their reproach, with which they have reproached You, O Lord.

13.text: And we, Your people and the sheep of Your pasture, / Will give You thanks forever; / From generation to generation we will tell out Your praise.

1.text: O Shepherd of Israel, give ear, / You who lead Joseph like a flock; / You who are enthroned between the cherubim, shine forth.

2.text: Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh / Stir up Your might, / And come to save us.

3.text: O God, restore us; / And cause Your face to shine, and we will be saved.

4.text: O Jehovah God of hosts, / How long will You fume / Against the prayer of Your people?

5.text: You have fed them with the bread of tears / And have made them drink tears in large measure.

6.text: You have made us a cause of strife to our neighbors, / And our enemies deride us among themselves.

7.text: O God of hosts, restore us; / And cause Your face to shine, and we will be saved.

8.text: You brought a vine out of Egypt; / You drove out nations and planted it;

9.text: You cleared the ground before it, / And it took deep root and filled the land.

10.text: The mountains were covered with its shadow, / And its boughs were like the cedars of God.

11.text: It put forth its branches unto the sea, / And its shoots unto the River.

12.text: Why have You broken down its hedges, / So that all who pass by on the way pluck it?

13.text: The boar from the forest ravages it, / And that which moves through the field feeds on it.

14.text: O God of hosts, turn, we beseech You; / Look down from heaven and see, / And visit this vine,

15.text: Even the stock which Your right hand has planted / And the son whom You have strengthened for Yourself.

16.text: It is burned with fire; it is cut down; / They perish at the rebuke of Your countenance.

17.text: Let Your hand be upon the man of Your right hand, / Upon the son of man whom You have strengthened for Yourself;

18.text: Then we will not turn back from You. / Revive us, and we will call upon Your name.

19.text: O Jehovah God of hosts, restore us; / Cause Your face to shine, and we will be saved.

1.text: Sing for joy to God our strength; / Make a joyful noise to the God of Jacob.

2.text: Lift up a song and sound the tambourine, / The pleasant lyre with the harp.

3.text: Blow the trumpet at the new moon, / At the full moon, on our feast day.

4.text: For that is a statute of Israel, / An ordinance of the God of Jacob.

5.text: He appointed it as a testimony in Joseph / When He went out over the land of Egypt. / I heard a language that I did not know:

6.text: I turned your shoulder from the burden; / Your hands were freed from the basket.

7.text: You called in trouble, and I delivered you; / I answered you from the secret place of thunder; / I proved you at the waters of Meribah. Selah

8.text: Hear, O My people, and I will testify against you: / O Israel, if you would listen to Me!

9.text: There shall be no strange god among you, / Neither shall you worship any foreign god.

10.text: I am Jehovah your God, / Who brought you up out of the land of Egypt; / Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it.

11.text: But My people did not listen to My voice, / And Israel would not consent to Me.

12.text: So I gave them over to the stubbornness of their heart: / They walked after their own counsels.

13.text: Oh that My people had listened to Me, / That Israel had walked in My ways!

14.text: I would have soon subdued their enemies / And turned My hand against their adversaries.

15.text: Those who hate Jehovah would have come cringing to Him, / And their time would be forever.

16.text: And He would have fed them with the finest of wheat; / Indeed with honey from the rock I would have satisfied you.

1.text: God stands in the congregation of God; / He judges in the midst of the gods.

2.text: How long will you judge unjustly / And respect the persons of the wicked? Selah

3.text: Judge the poor and the orphan; / Execute justice for the afflicted and the destitute;

4.text: Rescue the poor and the needy; / Deliver them from the hand of the wicked.

5.text: You do not know, nor do you understand; / You go about in darkness; / All the foundations of the earth are shaken.

6.text: I said, You are gods, / And all of you are sons of the Most High.

7.text: Nevertheless you will die like men / And fall like one of the princes.

8.text: Arise, O God; judge the earth; / For You will inherit all the nations.

1.text: O God, do not keep silent; / Do not be quiet, and do not be still, O God.

2.text: For, behold, Your enemies are in tumult, / And those who hate You lift up their heads.

3.text: They devise crafty counsel against Your people, / And conspire against Your hidden ones.

4.text: They have said, Come and let us destroy them from being a nation, / That the name of Israel may no longer be remembered.

5.text: For they have conspired together with one heart; / It is against You that they have made an alliance:

6.text: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, / Moab and the Hagarites,

7.text: Gebal and Ammon and Amalek, / Philistia along with the inhabitants of Tyre;

8.text: Assyria is also joined with them; / They have been a help to the children of Lot. Selah

9.text: Do with them as with Midian, / As with Sisera and Jabin, at the brook Kishon:

10.text: They were destroyed at Endor; / They became dung for the earth.

11.text: Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, / And all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,

12.text: Who said, Let us possess for ourselves / The habitations of God.

13.text: O my God, make them like a tumbleweed, / Like stubble before the wind.

14.text: Like fire that burns a forest / And like a flame that sets mountains on fire,

15.text: So pursue them with Your tempest, / And terrify them with Your storm.

16.text: Fill their faces with shame, / That they may seek Your name, O Jehovah.

17.text: May they be ashamed and dismayed forever, / And may they be confounded and perish;

18.text: That they may know that You alone, whose name is Jehovah, / Are the Most High over all the earth.

1.text: How lovely are Your tabernacles, / O Jehovah of hosts!

2.text: My soul longs, indeed even faints, / For the courts of Jehovah; / My heart and my flesh cry out / To the living God.

3.text: At Your two altars even the sparrow has found a home; / And the swallow, a nest for herself, / Where she may lay her young, / O Jehovah of hosts, my King and my God.

4.text: Blessed are those who dwell in Your house; / They will yet be praising You. Selah

5.text: Blessed is the man whose strength is in You, / In whose heart are the highways to Zion.

6.text: Passing through the valley of Baca, / They make it a spring; / Indeed the early rain covers it with blessings.

7.text: They go from strength to strength; / Each appears before God in Zion.

8.text: O Jehovah God of hosts, hear my prayer; / Give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah

9.text: Behold our shield, O God; / And look upon the face of Your anointed.

10.text: For a day in Your courts is better than a thousand; / I would rather stand at the threshold of the house of my God / Than dwell in the tents of the wicked.

11.text: For Jehovah God is a sun and a shield; / Jehovah gives grace and glory; / He does not withhold anything good / From those who walk uprightly.

12.text: O Jehovah of hosts, blessed is the man / Who trusts in You.

1.text: You have been pleased, O Jehovah, with Your land; / You have turned the captivity of Jacob.

2.text: You have forgiven the iniquity of Your people; / You have covered all their sin. Selah

3.text: You have taken away all Your wrath; / You have turned from the fierceness of Your anger.

4.text: Restore us, O God of our salvation, / And cause Your indignation toward us to cease.

5.text: Will You be angry with us forever? / Will You extend Your anger from generation to generation?

6.text: Will You not again revive us, / That Your people may rejoice in You?

7.text: Show us, O Jehovah, Your lovingkindness, / And grant us Your salvation.

8.text: I will hear what God Jehovah will speak, / For He will speak peace / To His people and to His faithful ones; / But let them not turn again unto folly.

9.text: Surely His salvation is near to those who fear Him, / That glory may dwell in our land.

10.text: Lovingkindness and truth have met together; / Righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

11.text: Truth has sprung forth from the earth, / And righteousness has looked down from heaven.

12.text: Indeed Jehovah will give what is good, / And our land will give its increase.

13.text: Righteousness will go before Him / And make His footsteps a way to walk in.

1.text: Incline Your ear, O Jehovah; answer me; / For I am poor and needy.

2.text: Keep my soul; for I am faithful; / Save Your servant who trusts in You, O You who are my God.

3.text: Be gracious to me, O Lord; / For to You do I call out all day long.

4.text: Cause the soul of Your servant to rejoice, / For unto You, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.

5.text: For You, O Lord, are good and ready to forgive / And abundant in lovingkindness to all who call upon You.

6.text: Give ear, O Jehovah, to my prayer, / And give heed to the voice of my supplications.

7.text: In the day of my distress I call upon You, / For You answer me.

8.text: There is none like You among the gods, O Lord; / Nor are there any works like Yours.

9.text: All the nations which You have made will come / And worship before You, O Lord; / And they will glorify Your name.

10.text: For You are great, and You do wondrous deeds; / You alone are God.

11.text: Teach me, O Jehovah, Your way; / I will walk in Your truth. / Make my heart single in fearing Your name.

12.text: I will praise You, O Lord my God, with all my heart; / And I will glorify Your name forever.

13.text: For Your lovingkindness is great toward me, / And You have delivered my soul from the lowest Sheol.

14.text: O God, the proud have risen up against me, / And a company of violent men seek my life; / And they do not set You before them.

15.text: But You, O Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God, / Long-suffering and abundant in lovingkindness and truth.

16.text: Turn to me and be gracious to me; / Give Your strength to Your servant, / And save the son of Your female servant.

17.text: Show me a token of goodness, / That those who hate me may see it and be ashamed; / For You, O Jehovah, have helped me and comforted me.

1.text: His foundation is in the holy mountains.

2.text: Jehovah loves the gates of Zion / More than all the dwellings of Jacob.

3.text: Glorious things are spoken of you, / O city of God. Selah

4.text: I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon as those who know Me; / Behold, Philistia and Tyre along with Cush: / This one was born there, they say.

5.text: But of Zion it will be said, / This one and that one were born in her, / And the Most High Himself will establish her.

6.text: Jehovah will count / When He records the peoples: / This One was born there. Selah

7.text: Then singing as well as dancing, they will say, / All my springs are in you.

1.text: O Jehovah, the God of my salvation, / I have cried out by day and in the night before You.

2.text: May my prayer come before You; / Incline Your ear to my cry.

3.text: For my soul is full of troubles, / And my life draws near to Sheol.

4.text: I am accounted among those who go down into the pit; / I am like a man without any help,

5.text: Abandoned among the dead, / Like the slain that lie in the grave, / Whom You remember no more, / And they are cut off from Your hand.

6.text: You have put me in the lowest pit, / In the dark places, in the depths.

7.text: Your wrath lies heavily upon me, / And You have afflicted me with all Your waves. Selah

8.text: You have put my acquaintances far from me; / You have made me an abomination to them. / I am shut in and cannot go out.

9.text: My eye wastes away at the affliction; / I have called out to You, O Jehovah, every day; / I have spread out my hands to You.

10.text: Will You perform wonders for the dead? / Will the deceased rise up and praise You? Selah

11.text: Will Your lovingkindness be declared in the grave, / Or Your faithfulness in Abaddon?

12.text: Will Your wonders be made known in the darkness, / Or Your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?

13.text: But I, O Jehovah, have cried out to You; / And in the morning my prayer comes before You.

14.text: Why, O Jehovah, have You rejected my soul? / Why do You hide Your face from me?

15.text: I have been afflicted and about to die since my youth; / I bear Your terrors; I am overwhelmed.

16.text: Your fierce wrath has gone over me; / Your terrors have cut me off.

17.text: They surrounded me like water all day long; / They altogether encompassed me.

18.text: You have put far from me / Lover and friend; / My acquaintances are in darkness.

1.text: I will sing of the lovingkindness of Jehovah forever; / From generation to generation I will make known Your faithfulness with my mouth.

2.text: For I have said, Lovingkindness will be built up forever; / In the heavens themselves You will establish Your faithfulness.

3.text: I have made a covenant with My chosen one; / I have sworn to David My servant:

4.text: I will establish your seed forever, / And I will build up your throne from generation to generation. Selah

5.text: And the heavens will praise Your wonders, O Jehovah, / Indeed Your faithfulness in the congregation of the holy ones.

6.text: For who in the skies can be compared to Jehovah? / Who among the sons of the mighty is like Jehovah,

7.text: Like God, greatly feared in the council of the holy ones / And awesome beyond all around Him?

8.text: O Jehovah God of hosts, who is like You, the mighty Jah? / Your faithfulness also surrounds You.

9.text: You rule the swelling of the sea: / When its waves rise up, You still them.

10.text: You crushed Rahab like one slain; / You scattered Your enemies with the arm of Your strength.

11.text: The heavens are Yours; the earth also is Yours; / The world and its fullness You have founded.

12.text: You created the north and the south; / Tabor and Hermon shout for joy at Your name.

13.text: You have an arm with might; / Your hand is strong; Your right hand is high.

14.text: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Your throne; / Lovingkindness and truth go before Your face.

15.text: Blessed are the people who know the joyful shout; / They walk, O Jehovah, in the light of Your countenance.

16.text: In Your name they exult all day long, / And in Your righteousness they are exalted.

17.text: For You are the glory of their strength, / And in Your favor our horn is exalted.

18.text: For our shield belongs to Jehovah, / And our king, to the Holy One of Israel.

19.text: Then You spoke in vision / Of Your Holy One, and You said, / I have given help to One who is mighty; / I have exalted One chosen from My people.

20.text: I have found David My Servant; / With My holy oil I have anointed Him,

21.text: With whom My hand will be established; / My arm will also strengthen Him.

22.text: The enemy will not exact anything from Him, / Nor will the son of wickedness afflict Him.

23.text: And I will crush His adversaries before Him, / And I will strike those who hate Him.

24.text: And My faithfulness and My lovingkindness will be with Him, / And in My name His horn will be exalted.

25.text: And I will set His hand on the sea / And His right hand on the rivers.

26.text: He will call upon Me, saying, You are My Father, / My God and the rock of My salvation.

27.text: I will also make Him the Firstborn, / The highest of the kings of the earth.

28.text: I will keep My lovingkindness for Him forever, / And My covenant will stand firm with Him.

29.text: And I will establish His seed forever, / And His throne as the days of heaven.

30.text: If His children forsake My law / And do not walk in My ordinances,

31.text: If they profane My statutes / And do not keep My commandments,

32.text: I will punish their transgression with a rod / And their iniquity with stripes.

33.text: But My lovingkindness I will not utterly take away from Him, / Nor will I be false to My own faithfulness.

34.text: I will not profane My covenant, / Nor will I change what has gone forth from My lips.

35.text: Once I have sworn by My holiness; / I will not lie to David.

36.text: His seed shall endure forever, / And His throne, like the sun before Me;

37.text: It shall be established forever like the moon; / And the witness in the skies is firm. Selah

38.text: But You have cast off and rejected; / You have been angry with Your anointed.

39.text: You have abhorred the covenant of Your servant; / You have profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.

40.text: You have broken down all his walls; / You have brought his strongholds to ruin.

41.text: All who pass by on the way plunder him; / He has become a reproach to his neighbors.

42.text: You have exalted the right hand of his adversaries; / You have caused all his enemies to rejoice.

43.text: Indeed You have turned back the edge of his sword / And have not made him stand in the battle.

44.text: You have made his brightness cease / And have cast down his throne to the ground.

45.text: You have shortened the days of his youth; / You have covered him with shame. Selah

46.text: How long, O Jehovah? Will You hide Yourself forever? / How long will Your wrath burn like fire?

47.text: Remember how short my time is -- / For what vanity You have created all the sons of men!

48.text: What man will live and not see death? / Will he deliver his soul from the power of Sheol? Selah

49.text: Where are Your former acts of lovingkindness, O Lord, / Which You swore to David in Your faithfulness?

50.text: Remember, O Lord, the reproach of Your servants, / How I bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty peoples,

51.text: With which Your enemies have reproached, O Jehovah, / With which they have reproached the footsteps of Your anointed.

52.text: Blessed be Jehovah forever. / Amen and Amen.

1.text: O Lord, You have been our dwelling place / In all generations.

2.text: Before the mountains were brought forth, / And before You gave birth to the earth and the world, / Indeed from eternity to eternity, You are God.

3.text: You return man to dust / And say, Return, you sons of men.

4.text: For a thousand years in Your sight / Are like yesterday when it passes by / And like a watch in the night.

5.text: You sweep them away as with a rain flood; they are as in a sleep: / In the morning they are like grass that comes up anew.

6.text: In the morning it flourishes and comes up anew; / In the evening it is cut down, and it dries up.

7.text: For we have been consumed by Your anger, / And by Your wrath we have been troubled.

8.text: You have set our iniquities before You, / Our secret sins in the light of Your countenance.

9.text: For all our days have passed away in Your overflowing wrath; / We bring our years to an end like a sigh.

10.text: The days of our years are seventy years, / Or, if because of strength, eighty years; / But their pride is labor and sorrow, / For it is soon gone, and we fly away.

11.text: Who knows the power of Your anger, / And Your overflowing wrath according to the fear that is due You?

12.text: Teach us then to number our days / That we may gain a heart of wisdom.

13.text: Return, O Jehovah! How long? / And repent concerning Your servants.

14.text: Satisfy us in the morning with Your lovingkindness / That we may give a ringing shout and rejoice all our days.

15.text: Cause us to rejoice according to the days that You have afflicted us, / According to the years that we have seen evil.

16.text: Let Your work appear to Your servants, / And Your splendor, to their children.

17.text: And let the favor of the Lord our God be upon us, / And establish the work of our hands upon us; / Indeed the work of our hands, establish it.

1.text: He who dwells in the secret place of the Most High / Will abide in the shadow of the Almighty.

2.text: I say of Jehovah, / My refuge and My fortress, / My God in whom I trust!

3.text: For He will deliver You / From the snare of the fowler, / From the deadly pestilence.

4.text: With His pinions He will cover You, / And under His wings You will take refuge; / His truth is a shield and a buckler.

5.text: You will not be afraid of the terror by night, / Or of the arrow that flies by day,

6.text: Or of the pestilence that walks in darkness, / Or of the destruction that lays waste at noon.

7.text: A thousand will fall at Your side, / And ten thousand at Your right hand; / But it will not come near to You.

8.text: You will only look on with Your eyes / And see the recompense of the wicked.

9.text: For You have made Jehovah, who is my refuge, / Even the Most High, Your habitation;

10.text: No evil will befall You, / Nor will any plague come near Your tent.

11.text: For He will give His angels charge concerning You / To keep You in all Your ways.

12.text: They will bear You up in their hands, / Lest You dash Your foot against a stone.

13.text: You will tread upon the lion and the cobra; / You will trample the young lion and the serpent.

14.text: Because He has set His love upon Me, I will rescue Him; / I will set Him on high, because He has known My name.

15.text: He will call upon Me, and I will answer Him. / I will be with Him in distress; / I will deliver Him and honor Him.

16.text: With an extension of His days I will satisfy Him, / And I will show Him My salvation.

1.text: It is good to give thanks to Jehovah / And to sing psalms to Your name, O Most High;

2.text: To declare Your lovingkindness in the morning / And Your faithfulness in the nights,

3.text: Upon an instrument of ten strings and upon a harp, / Upon the higgaion of the lyre.

4.text: For You have made me rejoice, O Jehovah, because of what You have done; / Because of the works of Your hands I will shout for joy.

5.text: How great are Your works, O Jehovah! / So very deep are Your thoughts!

6.text: A senseless man does not know them, / Nor does a fool understand them.

7.text: When the wicked sprout like grass, / And all the workers of iniquity blossom, / It is so that they may be destroyed forever.

8.text: But You are on high forever, O Jehovah.

9.text: For behold, Your enemies, O Jehovah; / For behold, Your enemies will perish; / All the workers of iniquity will be scattered.

10.text: But You have exalted my horn like that of a wild ox; / I am anointed with fresh oil.

11.text: And my eye has seen its desire for my enemies; / My ears have heard their desire for the evildoers who rise up against me.

12.text: The righteous man will flourish like the palm tree; / He will grow like a cedar in Lebanon.

13.text: Planted in the house of Jehovah, / They will flourish in the courts of our God.

14.text: They will still bring forth fruit in old age; / They will be full of sap and green;

15.text: To declare that Jehovah is upright; / He is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in Him.

1.text: Jehovah reigns; He is clothed with majesty. / Jehovah is clothed, He has girded Himself, with strength. / Indeed the world has been established; it will not be moved.

2.text: Your throne is established from of old; / You are from eternity.

3.text: The floods have lifted up, O Jehovah; / The floods have lifted up their voice; / The floods lift up their roaring.

4.text: More than the voices of many waters, / Than the mighty breakers of the sea, / Jehovah on high is mighty!

5.text: Your testimonies are very sure; / Holiness befits Your house, / O Jehovah, forevermore.

1.text: O God of vengeance, O Jehovah, / O God of vengeance, shine forth!

2.text: Lift Yourself up, O Judge of the earth; / Render the reward upon the proud.

3.text: How long, O Jehovah, will the wicked, / How long will the wicked exult?

4.text: They burst out; they speak arrogantly; / All the workers of iniquity boast.

5.text: They crush Your people, O Jehovah, / And afflict Your inheritance.

6.text: They slay the widow and the stranger, / And they murder orphans.

7.text: And they say, Jehovah does not see, / And the God of Jacob does not consider.

8.text: Consider, you senseless ones among the people; / And you foolish ones, when will you become wise?

9.text: He who planted the ear, does He not hear? / And He who formed the eye, does He not see?

10.text: He who disciplines the nations, / He who teaches man knowledge, does He not reprove?

11.text: Jehovah knows the thoughts of man, / That they are vanity.

12.text: Blessed is the man / Whom You discipline, O Jehovah, / And teach out of Your law;

13.text: That You may give him rest from the days of evil / Until the pit is dug for the wicked.
