14.text: For Jehovah will not abandon His people, / Nor will He forsake His inheritance.

15.text: For judgment will return unto righteousness, / And all the upright in heart will follow it.

16.text: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? / Who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?

17.text: Unless Jehovah had been my help, / My soul would have soon dwelt in silence.

18.text: When I said, My foot has slipped, / Your lovingkindness, O Jehovah, upheld me.

19.text: When my disquieting thoughts within me are many, / Your comfortings delight my soul.

20.text: Shall the seat of destruction be united with You, / Which devises trouble through its statutes?

21.text: They band together against the soul of the righteous man / And condemn innocent blood.

22.text: But Jehovah has been my high tower, / And my God the rock of my refuge;

23.text: And He will return their iniquity upon them / And destroy them in their own evil; / Jehovah our God will destroy them.

1.text: Come, let us sing for joy to Jehovah; / Let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation.

2.text: Let us come before His presence with thanksgiving; / Let us make a joyful noise to Him with psalms.

3.text: For Jehovah is a great God / And a great King above all gods.

4.text: In His hand are the depths of the earth; / The heights of the mountains are His also.

5.text: The sea is His, and He made it; / And His hands formed the dry land.

6.text: Come, let us worship and bow down; / Let us kneel before Jehovah our Maker.

7.text: For He is our God, / And we are the people of His pasture / And the flock of His hand. / Today, if you hear His voice,

8.text: Do not harden your heart as at Meribah, / As in the day of Massah in the wilderness,

9.text: When your fathers tested Me; / They tried Me, even though they had seen My work.

10.text: For forty years I loathed that generation, / And I said, They are a people who go astray in heart; / And they do not know My ways;

11.text: Therefore I swore in My anger: / They shall by no means enter into My rest!

1.text: Sing to Jehovah a new song; / Sing to Jehovah, all the earth.

2.text: Sing to Jehovah, bless His name; / Proclaim His salvation from day to day.

3.text: Declare His glory among the nations, / His wondrous deeds among all the peoples.

4.text: For Jehovah is great and much to be praised; / He is to be feared above all gods.

5.text: For all the gods of the peoples are idols, / But Jehovah made the heavens.

6.text: Majesty and splendor are before Him; / Strength and beauty are in His sanctuary.

7.text: Ascribe to Jehovah, O families of the peoples, / Ascribe to Jehovah glory and strength;

8.text: Ascribe to Jehovah the glory of His name; / Bring an offering, and come into His courts.

9.text: Worship Jehovah in holy splendor; / Tremble before Him, all the earth.

10.text: Say among the nations, Jehovah reigns; / Indeed the world has been established; it will not be moved; / He will judge the peoples with equity.

11.text: Let the heavens rejoice and the earth be glad; / Let the sea and its fullness roar.

12.text: Let the field and all that is in it exult; / Then all the trees of the forest will sing for joy

13.text: Before Jehovah, for He is coming; / For He is coming to judge the earth; / He will judge the world with righteousness, / And the peoples with His truth.

1.text: Jehovah reigns! Let the earth be glad; / Let the many islands rejoice.

2.text: Clouds and deep darkness surround Him; / Righteousness and justice are the foundation of His throne.

3.text: A fire goes before Him / And burns up His adversaries all around.

4.text: His lightning illumines the world; / The earth sees and trembles.

5.text: The mountains melt like wax at the presence of Jehovah, / At the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.

6.text: The heavens declare His righteousness, / And all the peoples see His glory.

7.text: Let all who serve a graven image be ashamed, / Who make their boast in idols; / Worship Him, all you gods.

8.text: Zion hears and rejoices, / And the daughters of Judah are glad, / Because of Your judgments, O Jehovah.

9.text: For You, O Jehovah, are most high over all the earth; / You are exalted far above all gods.

10.text: O you who love Jehovah, hate evil! / He preserves the souls of His faithful ones; / He delivers them from the hand of the wicked.

11.text: Light is sown for the righteous man, / And rejoicing for the upright in heart.

12.text: Rejoice in Jehovah, O righteous ones; / And praise His holy memorial.

1.text: Sing to Jehovah a new song, / For He has done wonderful things. / His right hand and His holy arm / Have accomplished salvation for Him.

2.text: Jehovah has made His salvation known; / In the sight of the nations / He has revealed His righteousness.

3.text: He remembered His lovingkindness and His faithfulness / Toward the house of Israel; / All the ends of the earth have seen / The salvation of our God.

4.text: Make a joyful noise to Jehovah, all the earth; / Break forth, and sing for joy, and sing psalms.

5.text: Sing psalms to Jehovah with the lyre, / With the lyre and the sound of melody.

6.text: With trumpets and the sound of the horn / Make a joyful noise before the King, Jehovah.

7.text: Let the sea and its fullness roar, / The world and those who inhabit it.

8.text: Let the rivers clap their hands; / Let the mountains sing for joy together

9.text: Before Jehovah, for He is coming / To judge the earth. / He will judge the world with righteousness / And the peoples with equity.

1.text: Jehovah reigns; let the peoples tremble. / He is enthroned between the cherubim; let the earth shake.

2.text: Jehovah is great in Zion, / And He is exalted over all the peoples.

3.text: Let them praise Your great and awesome name -- / It is holy --

4.text: And the strength of the King, who loves justice. / You have established equity; / You have executed / Justice and righteousness in Jacob.

5.text: Exalt Jehovah our God, / And worship at His footstool; / Holy is He.

6.text: Moses and Aaron among His priests, / And Samuel among those who called on His name -- / They called out to Jehovah, / And He answered them.

7.text: In the pillar of cloud He spoke to them; / They kept His testimonies and the statute that He gave them.

8.text: O Jehovah our God, You answered them; / You were a forgiving God to them, / Yet One avenging their deeds.

9.text: Exalt Jehovah our God, / And worship on His holy mountain; / For holy is Jehovah our God.

1.text: Make a joyful noise to Jehovah, all the earth.

2.text: Serve Jehovah with rejoicing; / Come before His presence with joyful singing.

3.text: Know that it is Jehovah who is God; / It is He who has made us and not we ourselves. / We are His people and the sheep of His pasture.

4.text: Enter His gates with thanksgiving, / His courts with praise; / Give thanks to Him; bless His name.

5.text: For Jehovah is good; His lovingkindness is forever, / And His faithfulness is to all generations.

1.text: I will sing of lovingkindness and justice; / To You, O Jehovah, I will sing psalms.

2.text: I will give careful heed to the perfect way. / When will You come to me? / I will walk in the perfectness of my heart / Within my house.

3.text: I will not set anything base / Before my eyes; / I hate what those who turn aside do; / It will not cling to me.

4.text: A perverse heart will depart from me; / No evil will I know.

5.text: He who secretly slanders his neighbor, / Him I will destroy; / He who is of a haughty look and a proud heart, / Him I will not tolerate.

6.text: My eyes are on the faithful of the land, / That they may abide with me; / He who walks in the perfect way, / He will minister to me.

7.text: He who practices deceit / Will not dwell within my house; / He who speaks lies will not be maintained / In my sight.

8.text: Morning by morning I will destroy / All the wicked of the land, / In order to cut off from the city of Jehovah / All the workers of iniquity.

1.text: O Jehovah, hear my prayer; / And let my cry come unto You.

2.text: Do not hide Your face from me / On the day of my distress; / Incline Your ear to me; / On the day when I call out, answer me quickly.

3.text: For my days are consumed in smoke, / And my bones burn like a hearth.

4.text: My heart is stricken like grass and dried up; / Indeed I have even forgotten to eat my bread.

5.text: Because of the voice of my groaning / My bones cling to my flesh.

6.text: I am like a pelican of the wilderness; / I have become like an owl of the desolate places.

7.text: I watch, and I am like / A lone sparrow on a housetop.

8.text: All day long my enemies reproach me; / Those who deride me use me as a curse.

9.text: For I have eaten ashes like bread, / And have mixed my drink with weeping,

10.text: Because of Your indignation and Your wrath; / For You have taken me up and cast me away.

11.text: My days are like a shadow that declines, / And I am dried up like grass.

12.text: But You, O Jehovah, abide forever; / And Your memorial is from generation to generation.

13.text: You will arise and have compassion on Zion, / For it is time to be gracious to her; the appointed time has come.

14.text: For Your servants take pleasure in her stones, / And show favor to her dust.

15.text: And the nations will fear the name of Jehovah, / And all the kings of the earth, Your glory;

16.text: For Jehovah has built up Zion; / He has appeared in His glory.

17.text: He has regarded the prayer of the destitute, / And has not despised their prayer.

18.text: This will be written for a generation to come, / And a people to be created will praise Jehovah.

19.text: For He has looked down from the height of His sanctuary; / From heaven Jehovah beheld the earth,

20.text: To hear the groaning of the prisoner, / To release those appointed to die;

21.text: That the name of Jehovah may be declared in Zion, / And His praise, in Jerusalem,

22.text: When the peoples are gathered together, / And the kingdoms, to serve Jehovah.

23.text: He has weakened my strength in the way; / He has shortened my days.

24.text: I said, My God, / Do not take me away in the middle of my days; / Your years are throughout all generations.

25.text: Of old You laid the foundation of the earth, / And the heavens are the work of Your hands.

26.text: They will perish, but You endure; / Indeed all of them will wear out like a garment; / Like clothing You will change them, / And they will be changed.

27.text: But You are the same, / And Your years are without end.

28.text: The children of Your servants will continue, / And their seed will be established before You.

1.text: Bless Jehovah, O my soul; / And all that is within me, bless His holy name.

2.text: Bless Jehovah, O my soul; / And do not forget all His benefits:

3.text: He pardons all your iniquities; / He heals all your diseases;

4.text: He redeems your life from the pit; / He crowns you with lovingkindness and compassions;

5.text: He satisfies the prime of your life with good, / So that your youth is renewed like the eagle.

6.text: Jehovah executes righteous acts, / And judgments for all who are oppressed.

7.text: He made His ways known to Moses; / His acts, to the children of Israel.

8.text: Jehovah is compassionate and gracious, / Long-suffering and abundant in lovingkindness.

9.text: He will not always contend with us, / Nor will He keep His anger forever.

10.text: He has not dealt with us according to our sins, / Nor has He recompensed us according to our iniquities.

11.text: For as high as the heavens are above the earth, / So great is His lovingkindness upon those who fear Him.

12.text: As far as the east is from the west, / So far has He removed our transgressions from us.

13.text: As compassionate as a father is toward his children, / So compassionate is Jehovah toward those who fear Him.

14.text: For He knows our frame; / He remembers that we are dust.

15.text: Man -- his days are like grass; / He flourishes like a field flower:

16.text: For the wind passes over it, and it is no more; / And its own place knows of it no longer.

17.text: But Jehovah's lovingkindness is from eternity / Unto eternity upon those who fear Him, / And His righteousness is to the children's children;

18.text: To those who keep His covenant / And remember His precepts so as to do them.

19.text: Jehovah has established His throne in the heavens, / And His kingdom rules over all.

20.text: Bless Jehovah, you His angels, / Who are mighty in strength to perform His word, / By obeying the voice of His word.

21.text: Bless Jehovah, all you His hosts, / You His ministers who execute His will.

22.text: Bless Jehovah, all you His works, / In all places of His dominion. / Bless Jehovah, O my soul.

1.text: Bless Jehovah, O my soul. / O Jehovah my God, You are very great. / You are clothed with majesty and splendor,

2.text: Wrapped with light as with a garment; / You stretch out the heavens like a tent curtain.

3.text: He lays the beams of His upper chambers in the waters; / He makes the clouds His chariot; / He walks upon the wings of the wind.

4.text: He makes winds His messengers, / Flames of fire His ministers.

5.text: He established the earth upon its foundations, / So that it cannot be moved forever and ever.

6.text: You covered it with the deep as with a garment; / The waters stood above the mountains.

7.text: At Your rebuke they fled; / At the voice of Your thunder they rushed away --

8.text: The mountains rose, the valleys sank -- / To the place that You established for them.

9.text: You set a border that they may not pass over, / That they may not turn back to cover the earth.

10.text: He makes the springs gush forth in the valleys; / They run among the mountains;

11.text: They give drink to every beast of the field; / The wild asses quench their thirst.

12.text: The birds of heaven dwell alongside them; / They utter their voice among the branches.

13.text: He waters the mountains from His upper chambers. / The earth is satisfied with the fruit of Your works.

14.text: He causes the grass to grow for the cattle, / And herbage for man's use, / That he may bring forth food from the earth:

15.text: Even wine that cheers man's heart, / Oil that makes his face shine, / And bread that sustains man's heart.

16.text: The trees of Jehovah are full of sap, / The cedars of Lebanon, which He planted,

17.text: Where the birds build their nests; / As for the stork, the cypresses are her house.

18.text: The high mountains are for the wild goats; / The cliffs are a refuge to the rock badgers.

19.text: He made the moon to mark seasons; / The sun knows the time of its going down.

20.text: You make darkness, and it is night, / In which all the beasts of the forest creep about.

21.text: The young lions roar after their prey, / Even to seek their food from God.

22.text: The sun rises: they retreat / And lie down in their dens.

23.text: Man goes forth to his work / And to his labor until evening.

24.text: How many are Your works, O Jehovah! / In wisdom You have made all of them; / The earth is full of Your creatures.

25.text: Yonder is the sea, great and extensively wide; / There the creeping things are, even without number, / The small animals with the great.

26.text: There the ships go; / Leviathan is there, whom You have formed / To play in it.

27.text: They all wait for You, / That You may give them food at the proper time.

28.text: You give to them; they gather. / You open Your hand; they are satisfied with good.

29.text: You hide Your face; they are troubled. / You take away their breath; they perish, / And return to their dust.

30.text: You send forth Your Spirit; they are created, / And You renew the surface of the ground.

31.text: May the glory of Jehovah endure forever! / May Jehovah rejoice in His works,

32.text: He who looks on the earth, and it trembles; / He who touches the mountains, and they smoke!

33.text: I will sing to Jehovah while I live; / I will sing psalms to my God while I yet have being.

34.text: May my musing be sweet to Him; / I will rejoice in Jehovah.

35.text: May the sinners be consumed from off the earth, / And may the wicked be no more. / Bless Jehovah, O my soul. / Hallelujah.

1.text: Give thanks to Jehovah; call upon His name; / Make known His deeds among the peoples.

2.text: Sing to Him; sing psalms to Him; / Muse upon all His wondrous deeds.

3.text: Glory in His holy name; / Let the heart of those who seek Jehovah rejoice.

4.text: Seek Jehovah and His strength; / Seek His face continually.

5.text: Remember His wondrous deeds, which He has done, / His signs and the judgments of His mouth,

6.text: O seed of Abraham His servant, / O children of Jacob, His chosen ones.

7.text: He is Jehovah our God; / His judgments are in all the earth.

8.text: He has remembered His covenant forever, / The word that He commanded to a thousand generations,

9.text: The covenant that He made with Abraham, / And His oath unto Isaac.

10.text: And He confirmed it unto Jacob as a statute, / Unto Israel as an eternal covenant,

11.text: Saying, To you I will give the land of Canaan, / The portion of your inheritance;

12.text: When they were men few in number, / Indeed very few and strangers in the land.

13.text: And they went about from nation to nation, / From one kingdom to another people.

14.text: He allowed no man to oppress them; / Indeed He rebuked kings for their sake.

15.text: Saying, Do not touch My anointed ones, / And do My prophets no harm.

16.text: And He called a famine upon the land; / He broke the whole staff of bread.

17.text: He sent a man before them; / Joseph was sold as a servant.

18.text: They afflicted his feet with fetters; / He himself was placed in irons.

19.text: Until the time when his word came to pass, / The word of Jehovah tried him.

20.text: The king sent men and freed him, / Even the ruler of the peoples, and let him go.

21.text: He made him lord of his house / And ruler over all his possessions,

22.text: To imprison his princes at will, / And to teach his elders wisdom.

23.text: Then Israel came into Egypt, / And Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

24.text: And He made His people very fruitful, / And caused them to be mightier than their adversaries.

25.text: He turned their heart to hate His people, / To deal craftily with His servants.

26.text: He sent Moses His servant, / And Aaron, whom He had chosen.

27.text: They set His signs among them, / And wonders in the land of Ham.

28.text: He sent darkness and made it dark; / And they did not rebel against His words.

29.text: He turned their waters into blood, / And killed their fish.

30.text: Their land teemed with frogs, / Even in the chambers of their kings.

31.text: He spoke, and a swarm of flies came; / There were lice within all their borders.

32.text: He gave them hail for rain, / And flaming fire in their land.

33.text: He struck their vines and their fig trees, / And He broke the trees of their borders.

34.text: He spoke, and the swarming locusts came, / And the licking locusts, even without number.

35.text: And they ate every herb in their land, / And they ate the fruit of their ground.

36.text: He struck all the firstborn in their land, / The firstfruits of all their vigor.

37.text: And He brought them out with silver and gold, / And there was none among His tribes who stumbled.

38.text: Egypt rejoiced at their going forth, / For a dread of them had fallen upon them.

39.text: He spread a cloud for a covering, / And a fire to give light by night.

40.text: They asked, and He brought quails; / And He satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

41.text: He opened the rock, and water gushed forth; / It ran in the dry places like a river.

42.text: For He remembered His holy word / And Abraham His servant.

43.text: And He brought forth His people with gladness, / His chosen ones with a ringing shout.

44.text: And He gave them the lands of the nations, / And they took possession of the labor of the peoples,

45.text: So that they might keep His statutes / And observe His laws. / Hallelujah.

1.text: Hallelujah. / Give thanks to Jehovah, for He is good, / For His lovingkindness is forever.

2.text: Who can utter the mighty acts of Jehovah, / Or declare all His praise?

3.text: Blessed are those who maintain justice, / Who execute righteousness at all times.

4.text: Remember me, O Jehovah, with Your favor toward Your people; / Visit me with Your salvation,

5.text: That I may see the prosperity of Your chosen ones, / That I may rejoice in the joy of Your nation, / That I may glory with Your inheritance.

6.text: We have sinned with our fathers; / We committed iniquity; we have acted wickedly.

7.text: Our fathers in Egypt / Did not understand Your wonders; / They did not remember the multitude of Your acts of lovingkindness, / But rebelled by the sea, at the Red Sea.

8.text: But He saved them for His name's sake, / That He might make His power known.

9.text: Thus He rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up; / And He led them through the depths as through the wilderness.

10.text: And He saved them from the hand of him who hated them, / And redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

11.text: The water then covered their adversaries; / Not one of them was left.

12.text: Then they believed His words; / They sang His praise.

13.text: Soon they forgot His works; / They did not wait for His counsel,

14.text: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, / And tempted God in the desert.

15.text: And He gave them their request, / But He sent leanness into their soul.

16.text: And they were jealous of Moses in the camp / And of Aaron, the holy one of Jehovah.

17.text: The earth opened, and it swallowed up Dathan / And covered the company of Abiram.

18.text: And a fire burned among their company; / A flame engulfed the wicked.

19.text: They made a calf in Horeb, / And worshipped a molten image.

20.text: Thus they exchanged their glory / For the image of an ox that eats grass.

21.text: They forgot God their Savior, / Who had done great things in Egypt,

22.text: Wondrous deeds in the land of Ham, / Awesome things by the Red Sea.

23.text: Therefore He said that He would destroy them, / And would have, had not Moses His chosen one / Stood in the breach before Him / To turn away His wrath from destroying them.

24.text: Then they despised the pleasant land; / They did not believe in His word;

25.text: Rather they murmured in their tents; / They did not listen to the voice of Jehovah.

26.text: Therefore He lifted up His hand and swore to them / That He would make them fall in the wilderness,

27.text: And that He would make their seed fall among the nations, / And that He would disperse them among the lands.

28.text: Then they joined themselves to Baal-peor, / And ate sacrifices offered to the dead.

29.text: Thus they provoked Him to anger by their actions, / And the plague broke out among them.

30.text: Then Phinehas stood up and intervened, / And the plague was stayed;

31.text: And it has been accounted to him as righteousness / From generation to generation unto eternity.

32.text: Then they angered Him at the waters of Meribah, / So that it went ill with Moses on account of them;

33.text: For they rebelled against His Spirit, / And he spoke rashly with his lips.

34.text: They did not destroy the peoples, / As Jehovah had commanded them;

35.text: But they mingled themselves with the nations / And learned their practices.

36.text: And they served their idols, / Which became a snare to them.

37.text: They also sacrificed their sons / And their daughters to demons,

38.text: And poured out innocent blood, / The blood of their sons and daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan; / And the land was polluted with bloodshed.

39.text: Thus they were defiled by their practices, / And went about as harlots by their actions.

40.text: And the anger of Jehovah was kindled against His people, / And He abhorred His inheritance.

41.text: And He gave them over into the hand of the nations: / And those who hated them ruled over them,

42.text: And their enemies oppressed them, / And they were subdued under their hand.

43.text: Many times He delivered them, / But they were rebellious in their counsel, / And they were brought low in their iniquity.

44.text: Yet He regarded their distress / When He heard their cry,

45.text: And for their sake He remembered His covenant, / And repented according to the multitude of His acts of lovingkindness;

46.text: And He caused them to find compassion / With all their captors.

47.text: Save us, O Jehovah our God; / And gather us out of the nations, / That we may give thanks to Your holy name, / That we may glory in Your praise.

48.text: Blessed be Jehovah the God of Israel, / From eternity to eternity. / And let all the people say, Amen. / Hallelujah.

1.text: Give thanks to Jehovah, for He is good, / For His lovingkindness is forever.

2.text: Let the redeemed of Jehovah say so, / Whom He redeemed from the hand of the adversary,

3.text: And gathered out of the lands, / From the east and from the west, / From the north and from the south.

4.text: They wandered in the wilderness, on the desert way; / They found no city of habitation.

5.text: Hungry and thirsty, / Their soul fainted within them.

6.text: Then they cried out to Jehovah in their trouble, / And He delivered them from their distresses.

7.text: And He led them on a straight way / That they might come to a city of habitation.

8.text: Let them give thanks to Jehovah for His lovingkindness / And for His wondrous deeds to the children of men.

9.text: For He satisfies the thirsty soul, / And the famished soul He fills with good.

10.text: Some inhabited darkness and the shadow of death, / And were bound in affliction and irons,

11.text: Because they rebelled against the words of God / And spurned the counsel of the Most High;

12.text: Therefore He brought down their heart with labor; / They stumbled, and there was no one to help them.

13.text: Then they cried out to Jehovah in their trouble, / And He saved them from their distresses.

14.text: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, / And He broke apart their bonds.

15.text: Let them give thanks to Jehovah for His lovingkindness / And for His wondrous deeds to the children of men.

16.text: For He breaks down the doors of bronze / And cuts down the bars of iron.

17.text: Some were fools, because of their way of transgression; / And because of their iniquities, they were afflicted.

18.text: Their soul loathed all food, / And they drew near to the gates of death.

19.text: Then they cried out to Jehovah in their trouble, / And He saved them out of their distresses.

20.text: He sent forth His word and healed them, / And He delivered them from the pits of destruction.

21.text: Let them give thanks to Jehovah for His lovingkindness / And for His wondrous deeds to the children of men.

22.text: And let them offer sacrifices of thanksgiving / And declare His doings in joyful song.

23.text: Those who go down to the sea in ships, / Conducting business on the mighty waters,

24.text: These see Jehovah's doings / And His wondrous deeds in the deep.

25.text: For He commanded and raised up a storm wind, / And it lifted up the waves of the sea.

26.text: They mounted up to the heavens; they went down to the depths; / Their soul melted in the calamity.

27.text: They reeled and staggered like a drunken man, / And all their skill was swallowed up.

28.text: Then they cried out to Jehovah in their trouble, / And He brought them out of their distresses.

29.text: He made the storm be still, / And the waves of the sea were calm;

30.text: And they rejoiced that they were quiet, / And He brought them to the haven they desired.

31.text: Let them give thanks to Jehovah for His lovingkindness / And for His wondrous deeds to the children of men.

32.text: And let them exalt Him in the congregation of the people / And praise Him in the assembly of the elders.

33.text: He turns rivers into a wilderness, / And springs of water into thirsty ground;

34.text: Fruitful land into a salt flat, / Because of the wickedness of those who dwell in it.

35.text: He turns a wilderness into a pool of water, / And a dry land into springs of water.

36.text: And He makes the hungry dwell there, / That they may prepare a city of habitation

37.text: And sow fields and plant vineyards / And get a fruitful yield.

38.text: He also blesses them, and they are multiplied greatly; / And He does not let their cattle decrease.

39.text: When they are diminished and bowed down / Through oppression, trouble, and sorrow,

40.text: He pours contempt on princes, / And makes them wander in a pathless waste.

41.text: But He raises the needy man high above affliction / And makes his families like flocks.

42.text: The upright see it and rejoice; / And all iniquity stops its mouth.

43.text: Who is wise? Then let him observe these things / And consider the lovingkindness of Jehovah.

1.text: My heart is fixed, O God; / I will sing, indeed I will sing psalms, / Even with my glory.

2.text: Awake, O harp and lyre! / I will awaken the dawn.

3.text: I will give thanks to You among the peoples, O Jehovah; / And I will sing psalms to You among the nations.

4.text: For Your lovingkindness is higher than the heavens, / And Your faithfulness reaches to the sky.

5.text: Be exalted above the heavens, O God; / And let Your glory be above all the earth.

6.text: That Your beloved ones may be delivered, / Save with Your right hand, and answer us.

7.text: God has spoken in His holiness: I will exult; / I will divide Shechem / And measure out the Valley of Succoth.

8.text: Gilead is Mine; Manasseh is Mine; / And Ephraim is the helmet for My head; / Judah is My scepter.

9.text: Moab is My washbowl; / Upon Edom I will cast My sandal; / Over Philistia I will shout.

10.text: Who will bring me into the fortified city? / Who will lead me to Edom?

11.text: Will not You, O God, who rejected us / And who did not go forth, O God, with our armies?

12.text: Give us help from the adversary, / For a salvation by man is vain.

13.text: In God we will do valiantly, / And it is He who will tread down our adversaries.

1.text: O God of my praise, do not be silent;

2.text: For the mouth of the wicked man and the mouth of deceit are opened against me; / They speak to me with a lying tongue.

3.text: And with words of hatred they have surrounded me / And have fought against me without cause.

4.text: In return for my love they have become my adversaries, / But I am all prayer.

5.text: And they have set against me evil in return for good / And hatred in return for my love.

6.text: Appoint a wicked man over him, / And let an adversary stand at his right hand.

7.text: When he is judged, let him come forth wicked; / And let his prayer be counted as sin.

8.text: May his days be few; / May another take his office.

9.text: May his children be orphans, / And his wife a widow.

10.text: And may his children wander all about and beg, / And may they seek food far from their desolated ruins.

11.text: May the creditor seize all that he has, / And may strangers plunder the fruit of his labor.

12.text: May there be no one to extend him mercy, / Nor anyone to be kind to his orphans.

13.text: May his posterity be cut off; / In the generation following may his name be blotted out.

14.text: May his fathers' iniquity be remembered before Jehovah, / And may his mother's sin not be blotted out.

15.text: May they be before Jehovah continually, / So that He may cut off the memory of them from the earth;

16.text: Because he did not remember to show lovingkindness, / But persecuted the poor and needy and brokenhearted, / To put them to death.

17.text: Indeed he loved cursing, so it came on him; / And he took no delight in blessing, so it was far from him.

18.text: And he clothed himself with cursing like his garment, / So it came into his inward parts like water / And into his bones like oil.

19.text: Let it be to him like the cloak that he wraps around himself, / And as a belt with which he constantly girds himself.

20.text: This is the reward from Jehovah for my adversaries / And for those who speak evil against my soul.

21.text: But You, O Jehovah Lord, deal with me, / For Your name's sake; / Because Your lovingkindness is good, deliver me.

22.text: For I am poor and needy, / And my heart is wounded within me.

23.text: I am gone like a shadow that declines; / I am shaken off like the locust.

24.text: My knees wobble through fasting, / And my flesh has become lean, without fatness.

25.text: I have also become a reproach to them: / When they see me, they shake their heads.

26.text: Help me, O Jehovah my God; / Save me according to Your lovingkindness;

27.text: And they will know that this is Your hand, / That it is You, O Jehovah, who have done it.

28.text: Let them curse, but You bless; / When they arise, they will be put to shame, / And Your servant will rejoice.

29.text: May my adversaries be clothed with humiliation, / And may they wrap themselves with their own shame as with a mantle.

30.text: I will give much thanks to Jehovah with my mouth, / And in the midst of the multitude I will praise Him;

31.text: For He stands at the right hand of the needy / To save him from those who judge his soul.

1.text: Jehovah declares to my Lord, / Sit at My right hand / Until I make Your enemies / Your footstool.

2.text: Jehovah will send forth / The scepter of Your strength from Zion: / Rule in the midst of Your enemies.

3.text: Your people will offer themselves willingly / In the day of Your warfare, / In the splendor of their consecration. / Your young men will be to You / Like the dew from the womb of the dawn.

4.text: Jehovah has sworn, / And He will not change: / You are a Priest forever / According to the order of Melchizedek.

5.text: The Lord is at Your right hand; / He will shatter kings in the day of His anger.

6.text: He will execute judgment among the nations; / He will fill the place with corpses; / He will shatter the head / Over a great land.

7.text: He will drink from the brook by the way; / Therefore He will lift up His head.

1.text: Hallelujah! / I will give thanks to Jehovah with all my heart / In the council of the upright and in the assembly.

2.text: Great are the works of Jehovah, / And sought out by all who delight in them.

3.text: His work is majesty and splendor, / And His righteousness endures forever.

4.text: He has caused His wondrous deeds to be remembered; / Jehovah is gracious and compassionate.

5.text: He gives food to those who fear Him; / He remembers His covenant forever.

6.text: He has shown His people the power of His works / By giving them the heritage of the nations.

7.text: The works of His hands are truth and justice; / All His precepts are sure:

8.text: They are maintained forever and ever, / They are executed in truth and uprightness.

9.text: He has sent redemption to His people; / He has commanded His covenant forever; / Holy and awesome is His name.

10.text: The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of wisdom; / All who practice His precepts have a good understanding. / His praise endures forever.

1.text: Hallelujah! / Blessed is the man who fears Jehovah, / Who delights greatly in His commandments.

2.text: His seed will be mighty on the earth; / The generation of the upright will be blessed.

3.text: Wealth and riches are in his house, / And his righteousness endures forever.

4.text: Light in the darkness arises to the upright; / They are gracious and compassionate and righteous.

5.text: It is well with the man who is gracious and lends; / He will maintain his cause in judgment.

6.text: For he will never be moved; / The righteous man will be remembered forever.

7.text: He will not be afraid of evil tidings; / His heart is steadfast, trusting in Jehovah.

8.text: His heart is sustained, he is not afraid, / Until he sees what should happen to his adversaries.

9.text: He has scattered abroad; he has given to the needy; / His righteousness endures forever; / His horn will be exalted with honor.

10.text: The wicked man will see it and be angry; / He will gnash his teeth and melt away; / The desire of the wicked will perish.

1.text: Hallelujah! / Praise, you servants of Jehovah, / Praise the name of Jehovah.

2.text: Let the name of Jehovah be blessed, / From now and to eternity.

3.text: From the rising of the sun to its setting / The name of Jehovah is to be praised.

4.text: Jehovah is high above all the nations, / And His glory is above the heavens.

5.text: Who is like Jehovah our God, / Who has set His throne on high,

6.text: Who humbles Himself to behold / The heavens and the earth?

7.text: He raises the poor from the dust; / From the ash heap He lifts the needy;

8.text: That He may seat them with princes, / With the princes of His people.

9.text: He causes the barren woman to keep house / As a joyful mother of children. / Hallelujah.

1.text: When Israel went forth from Egypt, / The house of Jacob from among a people of unintelligible speech,

2.text: Judah became His sanctuary, / Israel, His dominion.

3.text: The sea saw and fled; / The Jordan turned back.

4.text: The mountains skipped like rams, / The hills, like lambs.

5.text: What troubles you, O sea, that you flee? / O Jordan, that you turn back?

6.text: O mountains, that you skip like rams? / O hills, like lambs?

7.text: Tremble at the presence of the Lord, O earth, / At the presence of the God of Jacob,

8.text: Who turns the rock into a pool of water, / The flint into a fountain of water.

1.text: Not to us, O Jehovah, not to us, / But to Your name give glory, / For the sake of Your lovingkindness and Your truth.

2.text: Why should the nations say, / Where then is their God?

3.text: But our God is in the heavens; / He does whatever He pleases.

4.text: Their idols are mere silver and gold, / The work of human hands.

5.text: They have mouths, but they do not speak; / They have eyes, but they do not see.

6.text: They have ears, but they do not hear; / They have noses, but they do not smell.

7.text: They have hands, but they do not feel; / They have feet, but they do not walk; / They make no sound in their throat.

8.text: Those who make them, / All who trust in them, / Are like them.

9.text: O Israel, trust in Jehovah. / He is their help and their shield.

10.text: O house of Aaron, trust in Jehovah. / He is their help and their shield.

11.text: O you who fear Jehovah, trust in Jehovah. / He is their help and their shield.

12.text: Jehovah has been mindful of us; He will bless us; / He will bless the house of Israel; / He will bless the house of Aaron;

13.text: He will bless those who fear Jehovah, / Both small and great.

14.text: May Jehovah give you increase, / Both you and your children.

15.text: May you be blessed of Jehovah, / Maker of heaven and earth.

16.text: The heavens are the heavens of Jehovah, / But He has given the earth to the children of men.

17.text: The dead do not praise Jehovah, / Nor do any that go down into silence.

18.text: But we will bless Jehovah / From now and to eternity. / Hallelujah.

1.text: I love Jehovah because He hears / My voice, my supplications,

2.text: Because He inclines His ear to me; / Therefore I will call upon Him all my days.

3.text: The bonds of death encompassed me, / And the distresses of Sheol fell upon me; / I fell upon trouble and sorrow.

4.text: But I called upon the name of Jehovah. / O Jehovah, I pray, deliver my soul.

5.text: Jehovah is gracious and righteous, / Indeed our God is compassionate.

6.text: Jehovah preserves the simple: / I was brought low, and He saved me.

7.text: Return to your rest, O my soul; / For Jehovah has dealt bountifully with you.

8.text: For You have delivered my soul from death, / My eyes from tears, / My feet from stumbling.

9.text: I will walk before Jehovah / In the land of the living.

10.text: I believed, therefore I spoke; / I was afflicted greatly.

11.text: I said in my haste, / All men are liars.

12.text: What shall I return to Jehovah / For all His benefits toward me?

13.text: I will take up the cup of salvation / And call upon the name of Jehovah.

14.text: I will pay my vows to Jehovah, / Oh, in the presence of all His people.

15.text: Precious in the sight of Jehovah / Is the death of His faithful ones.

16.text: O Jehovah! / Surely I am Your servant; / I am Your servant, the son of Your female servant; / You have loosed my bonds.

17.text: To You I will offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving, / And I will call upon the name of Jehovah.

18.text: I will pay my vows to Jehovah, / Oh, in the presence of all His people,

19.text: In the courts of the house of Jehovah, / In the midst of you, O Jerusalem. / Hallelujah.

1.text: Praise Jehovah, all you nations; / Laud Him, all you peoples.

2.text: For His lovingkindness is great toward us, / And the faithfulness of Jehovah is forever. / Hallelujah.

1.text: Give thanks to Jehovah, for He is good, / For His lovingkindness is forever.

2.text: Let Israel say, / His lovingkindness is forever.

3.text: Let the house of Aaron say, / His lovingkindness is forever.

4.text: Let those who fear Jehovah say, / His lovingkindness is forever.

5.text: Out of my distress I called upon Jehovah; / Jehovah answered me and set me in a place broad and free.

6.text: Jehovah is for me; I will not be afraid. / What can man do to me?

7.text: Jehovah is for me as my Helper, / And I will see what should happen to those who hate me.

8.text: It is better to take refuge in Jehovah / Than to trust in man.

9.text: It is better to take refuge in Jehovah / Than to trust in princes.

10.text: All nations surrounded me; / In the name of Jehovah I indeed cut them down!

11.text: They surrounded me; yes, they surrounded me; / In the name of Jehovah I indeed cut them down!

12.text: They surrounded me like bees; / They were extinguished like a fire of thorns; / In the name of Jehovah I indeed cut them down!

13.text: I was pushed hard that I might fall; / But Jehovah helped me.

14.text: Jehovah is my strength and my song, / And He has become my salvation.

15.text: The voice of rejoicing and salvation / Is in the tents of the righteous. / The right hand of Jehovah does valiantly;

16.text: The right hand of Jehovah is exalted; / The right hand of Jehovah does valiantly.

17.text: I will not die, but live, / And declare the works of Jehovah.

18.text: Jehovah has severely chastened me, / But He has not given me over to death.

19.text: Open to me the gates of righteousness: / I will enter in through them; I will give thanks to Jehovah.

20.text: This is the gate of Jehovah; / The righteous shall enter in through it.

21.text: I will give thanks to You, for You have answered me / And have become my salvation.

22.text: The stone which the builders rejected / Has become the head of the corner.

23.text: This is from Jehovah; / It is wonderful in our sight.

24.text: This is the day that Jehovah has made; / Let us exult and rejoice in it.

25.text: O Jehovah, do save, we pray! / O Jehovah, do send prosperity, we pray!

26.text: Blessed is He who comes in the name of Jehovah; / We bless you from the house of Jehovah.

27.text: Jehovah is God, / And He has given us light; / Bind the sacrifice of the feast with cords / To the horns of the altar.

28.text: You are my God, and I give thanks to You. / You are my God; I will exalt You.

29.text: Give thanks to Jehovah, for He is good, / For His lovingkindness is forever.

1.text: Blessed are those whose way is perfect, / Who walk in the law of Jehovah.

2.text: Blessed are those who keep His testimonies, / Who seek Him with all their heart.

3.text: Surely they do no wrong; / They walk in His ways.

4.text: You have commanded that Your precepts / Be diligently kept.

5.text: Oh that my ways may be established / So as to keep Your statutes!

6.text: Then I will not be put to shame, / When I regard all Your commandments.

7.text: I will give thanks to You with uprightness of heart / When I learn Your righteous ordinances.

8.text: I will keep Your statutes; / Do not utterly forsake me.

9.text: With what should a young man keep his way pure? / By guarding it according to Your word.

10.text: With all my heart I have sought You; / Do not let me wander from Your commandments.

11.text: In my heart I have treasured up Your word / That I might not sin against You.

12.text: Blessed are You, O Jehovah; / Teach me Your statutes.

13.text: With my lips I have declared / All the ordinances of Your mouth.

14.text: I have rejoiced in the way of Your testimonies / As much as in all riches.

15.text: I will muse upon Your precepts / And regard Your ways.

16.text: I will take delight in Your statutes; / I will not forget Your word.

17.text: Deal bountifully with Your servant that I may live / And keep Your word.

18.text: Open my eyes that I may behold / Wondrous things out of Your law.

19.text: I am a sojourner in the earth; / Do not hide Your commandments from me.

20.text: My soul is crushed with longing / For Your ordinances at all times.

21.text: You have rebuked the proud, the cursed, / Who wander from Your commandments.

22.text: Roll away from me reproach and contempt, / For I have kept Your testimonies.

23.text: Princes as well have sat and spoken against me, / But Your servant mused upon Your statutes.

24.text: Also Your testimonies are my delight; / They are my counselors.

25.text: My soul clings to the dust; / Enliven me according to Your word.

26.text: I have recounted my ways, and You have answered me; / Teach me Your statutes.

27.text: Cause me to understand the way of Your precepts, / And I will muse upon Your wondrous deeds.

28.text: My soul melts because of grief; / Strengthen me according to Your word.

29.text: Remove from me the way of falsehood, / And graciously grant me Your law.

30.text: I have chosen the way of faithfulness; / Your ordinances I have set before me.

31.text: I cling to Your testimonies; / O Jehovah, do not put me to shame.

32.text: I run the way of Your commandments, / For You enlarge my heart.

33.text: Teach me, O Jehovah, the way of Your statutes; / And I will keep it to the end.

34.text: Give me understanding, and I will observe Your law; / Indeed I will keep it with all my heart.

35.text: Cause me to go on the path of Your commandments, / For in it I delight.

36.text: Incline my heart to Your testimonies / And not to unjust gain.

37.text: Turn my eyes from beholding vanity, / And enliven me in Your ways.

38.text: Confirm to Your servant Your word, / Which is for fearing You.

39.text: Turn away my reproach, which I fear; / For Your ordinances are good.

40.text: Behold, I have longed after Your precepts; / Enliven me in Your righteousness.

41.text: May Your lovingkindness also come to me, O Jehovah, / Your salvation according to Your word.

42.text: Thus I will have an answer for him who reproaches me, / For I trust in Your word.

43.text: And do not take the word of truth utterly from my mouth, / For I have hoped in Your ordinances.

44.text: Thus I will keep Your law continually, / Forever and ever.

45.text: And I will walk at liberty, / For I have sought Your precepts.

46.text: I will also speak of Your testimonies before kings / And not be ashamed.

47.text: And I will take delight in Your commandments, / Which I love.

48.text: And I will lift up my hand to Your commandments, which I love; / And I will muse upon Your statutes.

49.text: Remember the word to Your servant / In which You have made me hope.

50.text: This is my comfort in my affliction, / For Your word has enlivened me.

51.text: The proud have derided me greatly; / I have not swerved from Your law.

52.text: I have remembered Your ordinances from long ago, / O Jehovah, and have comforted myself.

53.text: Raging indignation seizes me because of the wicked, / Who forsake Your law.

54.text: Your statutes have become my songs of praise / In the house of my pilgrimage.

55.text: I have remembered Your name / In the night, O Jehovah, / And have kept Your law.

56.text: This has been mine, / That I have kept Your precepts.

57.text: Jehovah is my portion; / I have promised to keep Your words.

58.text: I entreated Your favor with my whole heart; / Be gracious to me according to Your word.

59.text: I considered my ways / And turned my feet toward Your testimonies.

60.text: I hurried and did not delay / To keep Your commandments.

61.text: The cords of the wicked surround me, / But I have not forgotten Your law.

62.text: At midnight I rise up to give thanks to You / Because of Your righteous ordinances.

63.text: I am a companion to all who fear You / And to those who keep Your precepts.

64.text: Your lovingkindness, O Jehovah, fills the earth; / Teach me Your statutes.

65.text: You have dealt well with Your servant, / O Jehovah, according to Your word.

66.text: Teach me proper discernment and knowledge, / For I believe in Your commandments.

67.text: Before I was afflicted, I went astray; / But now I keep Your word.

68.text: You are good and One who does good; / Teach me Your statutes.

69.text: The proud have plastered lies against me; / With my whole heart I will keep Your precepts.

70.text: Their heart is heavy as with fat; / But I delight in Your law.

71.text: It is good for me that I have been afflicted, / That I might learn Your statutes.

72.text: The law of Your mouth is better to me / Than thousands of pieces of gold and silver.

73.text: Your hands have made me and fashioned me; / Give me understanding that I may learn Your commandments.

74.text: Those who fear You will see me and rejoice, / For I have hoped in Your word.

75.text: I know, O Jehovah, that Your judgments are righteous / And that in faithfulness You afflicted me.

76.text: Let Your lovingkindness, I beseech You, be my comfort, / According to Your word to Your servant.

77.text: Let Your compassions come to me, and I will live; / For Your law is my delight.

78.text: Let the proud be put to shame, for they have subverted my cause with a lie; / But I will muse upon Your precepts.

79.text: Let those who fear You turn to me, / And they will know Your testimonies.

80.text: May my heart be perfect in Your statutes, / That I may not be put to shame.

81.text: My soul faints while longing for Your salvation; / I hope in Your word.

82.text: My eyes faint while longing for Your word, / As I say, When will You comfort me?

83.text: For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke; / But I do not forget Your statutes.

84.text: How many are the days of Your servant? / When will You execute judgment upon my persecutors?

85.text: The proud have dug pits for me, / Those who are not according to Your law.

86.text: All Your commandments are faithful; / They persecute me falsely; help me.

87.text: They have almost consumed me upon the earth; / But I have not forsaken Your precepts.

88.text: Enliven me according to Your lovingkindness, / And I will keep the testimony of Your mouth.

89.text: Forever, O Jehovah, / Does Your word stand firm in heaven.

90.text: Your faithfulness is from generation to generation; / You established the earth, and it abides.

91.text: They abide to this day according to Your ordinances, / For all things are Your servants.

92.text: Unless Your law had been my delight, / I would have perished in my affliction.

93.text: I will never forget Your precepts, / For by them You have enlivened me.

94.text: I am Yours; save me, / For I have sought Your precepts.

95.text: The wicked have waited for me in order to destroy me, / But I consider Your testimonies.

96.text: I have seen an end to all perfection, / But Your commandment is all-expansive.

97.text: Oh, how I love Your law! / All day long it is my musing.

98.text: Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies, / For they are always with me.

99.text: I have more insight than all my teachers, / For Your testimonies are my musing.

100.text: I understand more than the aged, / For I have kept Your precepts.

101.text: I have withheld my feet from every evil way, / That I might keep Your word.

102.text: I have not turned aside from Your ordinances, / For You have taught me.

103.text: How sweet are Your words to my taste! / Sweeter than honey to my mouth!

104.text: Through Your precepts I gain understanding; / Therefore I hate every false way.

105.text: Your word is a lamp to my feet / And a light to my path.

106.text: I have sworn and will confirm it, / That I will keep Your righteous ordinances.

107.text: I have been greatly afflicted; / O Jehovah, enliven me according to Your word.

108.text: Accept, I pray, the freewill offerings of my mouth, O Jehovah; / And teach me Your ordinances.

109.text: My soul is continually in my hand, / But I do not forget Your law.

110.text: The wicked have laid a trap for me, / But I do not stray from Your precepts.

111.text: Your testimonies are my heritage forever, / For they are the gladness of my heart.

112.text: I have inclined my heart to perform Your statutes / Forever, to the end.

113.text: I hate those who are double-minded, / But I love Your law.

114.text: You are my hiding place and my shield; / In Your word do I hope.

115.text: Depart from me, you evildoers, / That I may keep the commandments of my God.

116.text: Uphold me according to Your word that I may live, / And do not let me be ashamed of my hope.

117.text: Hold me up that I may be safe, / And I will regard Your statutes continually.

118.text: You spurn all those who stray from Your statutes, / For their deceitfulness is vain.

119.text: You do away with all the wicked ones of the earth like dross; / Therefore I love Your testimonies.

120.text: My flesh trembles for fear of You, / And I am afraid of Your judgments.

121.text: I have performed judgment and righteousness; / Do not leave me to my oppressors.

122.text: Guarantee Your servant's well-being; / Do not let the proud oppress me.

123.text: My eyes faint while longing for Your salvation / And for Your righteous word.

124.text: Deal with Your servant according to Your lovingkindness, / And teach me Your statutes.

125.text: I am Your servant; give me understanding, / That I may know Your testimonies.

126.text: It is time for Jehovah to act, / For they have broken Your law.

127.text: Therefore I love Your commandments / More than gold, indeed, more than fine gold;

128.text: Therefore I esteem all Your precepts concerning all things to be right, / And I hate every false way.

129.text: Your testimonies are wonderful; / Therefore my soul keeps them.

130.text: The opening of Your words gives light, / Imparting understanding to the simple.

131.text: I opened my mouth wide and panted, / For I longed for Your commandments.

132.text: Turn to me, and be gracious to me, / As is Your custom with those who love Your name.

133.text: Establish my footsteps in Your word, / And do not let any iniquity have dominion over me.

134.text: Redeem me from man's oppression, / That I may keep Your precepts.

135.text: Cause Your face to shine on Your servant, / And teach me Your statutes.

136.text: My eyes shed streams of water, / Because men do not keep Your law.

137.text: You are righteous, O Jehovah; / And Your judgments are upright.

138.text: You have commanded Your testimonies in righteousness / And great faithfulness.

139.text: My zeal has consumed me, / For my adversaries have forgotten Your words.

140.text: Your word is very pure, / And Your servant loves it.

141.text: I am small and despised, / But I do not forget Your precepts.

142.text: Your righteousness is an eternal righteousness, / And Your law is truth.

143.text: Distress and anguish have come upon me, / But Your commandments are my delight.

144.text: Your testimonies are righteous forever; / Give me understanding, and I will live.

145.text: I called with my whole heart; answer me, O Jehovah. / I will keep Your statutes.

146.text: I called upon You; save me, / And I will observe Your testimonies.

147.text: I anticipated the dawn and cried out; / I hoped in Your words.

148.text: My eyes anticipated the night watches, / That I might muse upon Your word.

149.text: Hear my voice according to Your lovingkindness; / O Jehovah, according to Your ordinances enliven me.

150.text: Those who persecute me with evil intent draw near; / They are far from Your law.

151.text: You are near, O Jehovah; / And all Your commandments are truth.

152.text: Of old I have known from Your testimonies / That You have founded them forever.

153.text: Look at my affliction, and deliver me; / For I have not forgotten Your law.

154.text: Plead my case, and redeem me; / Enliven me according to Your word.

155.text: Salvation is far from the wicked, / For they do not seek Your statutes.

156.text: Great are Your compassions, O Jehovah; / Enliven me according to Your ordinances.

157.text: Many are my persecutors and my adversaries, / But I have not swerved from Your testimonies.

158.text: I saw the treacherous and loathed them, / Because they did not keep Your word.

159.text: See how I have loved Your precepts; / O Jehovah, enliven me according to Your lovingkindness.

160.text: The sum of Your word is truth, / And all Your righteous ordinances are forever.

161.text: Princes have persecuted me without cause, / But my heart stands in awe of Your words.

162.text: I rejoice at Your word, / Like one who finds great spoil.

163.text: I hate and abhor falsehood, / But I love Your law.

164.text: Seven times a day I praise You / For Your righteous ordinances.

165.text: There is great peace for those who love Your law, / And there is no occasion of stumbling for them.

166.text: I have hoped for Your salvation, O Jehovah; / And I have done Your commandments.

167.text: My soul has kept Your testimonies, / And I love them very much.

168.text: I have kept Your precepts and Your testimonies, / For all my ways are before You.

169.text: Let my cry come before You, O Jehovah; / Give me understanding according to Your word.

170.text: Let my supplication come before You; / Deliver me according to Your word.

171.text: Let my lips pour forth praise, / For You teach me Your statutes.

172.text: Let my tongue sing of Your word, / For all Your commandments are righteousness.

173.text: Let Your hand be ready to help me, / For I have chosen Your precepts.

174.text: I have longed for Your salvation, O Jehovah, / And Your law is my delight.

175.text: Let my soul live, and it will praise You; / And let Your ordinances help me.

176.text: I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek Your servant, / For I have not forgotten Your commandments.

1.text: In my distress I called out to Jehovah, / And He answered me.

2.text: O Jehovah, deliver my soul from lying lips, / From a tongue of deceit.

3.text: What should be given to you, / And what further shall be done to you, / O tongue of deceit?

4.text: The sharp arrows of a mighty man, / With the burning coals of the broom tree!

5.text: Woe is me, for I sojourn in Meshech, / I dwell among the tents of Kedar.

6.text: Long has my soul had its dwelling / With him who hates peace.

7.text: I am for peace; but when I speak, / They are for war.

1.text: I will lift up my eyes to the hills. / From where will my help come?

2.text: My help comes from Jehovah, / Who made heaven and earth.

3.text: He will not let your foot slip; / He who keeps you will not slumber.

4.text: Behold, Israel's Keeper / Will neither slumber nor sleep.

5.text: Jehovah is your Keeper; / Jehovah is your shade at your right hand.

6.text: The sun will not strike you by day, / Nor the moon by night.

7.text: Jehovah will keep you from all evil; / He will keep your soul.

8.text: Jehovah will keep your going out and your coming in / From now and to eternity.

1.text: I rejoiced when they said to me, / Let us go to the house of Jehovah.

2.text: Our feet are standing / Within your gates, O Jerusalem.

3.text: Jerusalem has been built as a city / That has been compacted together;

4.text: To which the tribes go up, / The tribes of Jehovah -- / A testimony for Israel -- / To give thanks to the name of Jehovah.

5.text: For there thrones are set for judgment, / Thrones of the house of David.

6.text: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem. / Those who love you will prosper.

7.text: Peace be within your bulwarks, / And prosperity within your citadels.

8.text: For my brothers' and companions' sake I will now say, / Peace be within you.

9.text: For the sake of the house of Jehovah our God / I will seek your good.

1.text: To You do I lift up my eyes, / You who sit enthroned in heaven.

2.text: Behold, as the eyes of the servants / Look to the hand of their masters, / As the eyes of a servant girl / Look to the hand of her mistress, / So our eyes look to Jehovah our God, / Until He is gracious to us.

3.text: Be gracious to us, O Jehovah, be gracious to us; / For we are greatly filled with contempt.

4.text: Our soul is greatly filled / With the scorn of those who are at ease, / With the contempt of the proud.

1.text: If it had not been Jehovah who was on our side, / Let Israel say,

2.text: If it had not been Jehovah who was on our side / When men rose up against us;

3.text: Then they would have swallowed us up alive / When their anger burned against us;

4.text: Then the waters would have washed us away; / The stream would have passed over our soul;

5.text: Then the proud waters / Would have passed over our soul.

6.text: Blessed be Jehovah, who has not given us / As prey to their teeth.

7.text: Our soul has escaped like a bird, / Out of the snare of the fowlers; / The snare is broken, / And we have escaped.

8.text: Our help is in the name of Jehovah, / Who made heaven and earth.

1.text: Those who trust in Jehovah are like Mount Zion, / Which cannot be moved but abides forever.

2.text: Jerusalem -- mountains surround her; / And Jehovah surrounds His people / From now and to eternity.

3.text: For the scepter of wickedness will not rest / Upon the allotment of the righteous, / That the righteous would not put forth / Their hands to iniquity.

4.text: Do good, O Jehovah, to the good / And to those upright in their hearts.

5.text: But as for those who turn aside to their crooked ways, / Jehovah will lead them off with the workers of iniquity. / Peace be upon Israel.

1.text: When Jehovah turned again the captivity of Zion, / We were like those who dream.

2.text: At that time our mouth was filled with laughter / And our tongue with a ringing shout. / At that time they said among the nations, / Jehovah has done great things for them.

3.text: Jehovah has done great things for us; / We are joyful.

4.text: Turn again, O Jehovah, our captivity / Like the streams in the south.

5.text: Those who sow in tears / Will reap with a ringing shout.

6.text: He who goes forth and weeps, / Bearing seed for scattering, / Will no doubt come in with a ringing shout, / Bearing his sheaves with him.

1.text: Unless Jehovah builds the house, / Those who build it labor in vain. / Unless Jehovah keeps the city, / The guard watches in vain.

2.text: It is vain for you to rise up early, / To stay up late, / To eat the bread of toil; / All the same, He gives to His beloved while they sleep.

3.text: Behold, children are the heritage of Jehovah, / The fruit of the womb a reward.

4.text: Like arrows in the hand of a mighty man, / So are the children of one's youth.

5.text: Blessed is the man / Who fills his quiver with them. / He will not be put to shame / When he speaks with enemies in the gate.

1.text: Blessed is everyone who fears Jehovah, / Who walks in His ways.

2.text: You will indeed eat the labor of your hands; / You will be blessed, and it will go well with you.

3.text: Your wife will be like a fruitful vine / In the innermost parts of your house. / Your children will be like olive shoots / Round about your table.

4.text: Thus will the man be blessed / Who fears Jehovah.

5.text: Jehovah bless you from Zion; / And may you see the prosperity of Jerusalem / All the days of your life.

6.text: May you also see the children of your children. / Peace be upon Israel.

1.text: Many times have they afflicted me since my youth, / Let Israel say,

2.text: Many times have they afflicted me since my youth, / Yet they did not prevail against me.

3.text: The plowers plowed on my back; / They made their furrows long.

4.text: Jehovah is righteous; / He has cut the cords of the wicked.

5.text: May all who hate Zion / Be put to shame and turned back.

6.text: May they be like grass on the housetops, / Which withers before it grows up,

7.text: With which the reaper does not fill his hand, / Or he who binds sheaves, his bosom.

8.text: Nor may those who pass by say, / The blessing of Jehovah be upon you! / We bless you in the name of Jehovah.

1.text: Out of the depths I have called upon You, O Jehovah.

2.text: O Lord, hear my voice; / Let Your ears be attentive / To the voice of my supplications.

3.text: If You, O Jehovah, marked iniquities, / Who, O Lord, would stand?

4.text: But with You there is forgiveness, / That You would be feared.

5.text: I wait for Jehovah; my soul waits, / And in His word I hope.

6.text: My soul waits for the Lord / More than watchmen for the morning, / Yes, watchmen for the morning.

7.text: Hope in Jehovah, O Israel; / For with Jehovah there is lovingkindness, / And with Him abundantly there is redemption;

8.text: And it is He who will redeem Israel / From all its iniquities.

1.text: O Jehovah, my heart is not proud, / Nor are my eyes haughty; / Nor do I go about in things too great / Or too wondrous for me.

2.text: Surely I have calmed / And quieted my soul, / Like a weaned child with its mother; / Like a weaned child is my soul within me.

3.text: Hope in Jehovah, O Israel, / From now and to eternity.

1.text: Remember, O Jehovah, for David's sake / All his afflictions;

2.text: How he swore to Jehovah / And vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:

3.text: I shall not go into the tent of my house; / I shall not go up onto the couch of my bed;

4.text: I shall not give sleep to my eyes, / Slumber to my eyelids;

5.text: Until I find a place for Jehovah, / A tabernacle for the Mighty One of Jacob.

6.text: Behold, we heard of it in Ephrathah; / We found it in the fields of Jaar.

7.text: We will go into His tabernacle; / We will worship at His footstool.

8.text: Arise, O Jehovah, unto Your resting place, / You and the Ark of Your strength.

9.text: Let Your priests be clothed with righteousness, / And let Your faithful ones give a ringing shout.

10.text: For the sake of David Your servant, / Do not turn away the face of Your Anointed One.

11.text: Jehovah has sworn unto David in truth; / He will not turn from it: / Of the fruit of your body I will set One upon your throne.

12.text: If your children keep My covenant / And My testimonies that I will teach them, / Their children also will sit / Upon your throne forever.

13.text: For Jehovah has chosen Zion; / He has desired it for His habitation.

14.text: This is My resting place forever; / Here will I dwell, for I have desired it.

15.text: I will abundantly bless its provision; / I will satisfy its poor with bread.

16.text: And its priests I will clothe with salvation, / And its faithful ones will shout with a ringing shout.

17.text: There I will cause a horn of David to shoot forth; / I have prepared a lamp for My anointed one.

18.text: I will clothe his enemies with shame, / But on him his crown will shine.

1.text: Behold, how good and how pleasant it is / For brothers to dwell in unity!

2.text: It is like the fine oil upon the head / That ran down upon the beard, / Upon Aaron's beard, / That ran down upon the hem of his garments;

3.text: Like the dew of Hermon / That came down upon the mountains of Zion. / For there Jehovah commanded the blessing: / Life forever.

1.text: Bless Jehovah now, / All you servants of Jehovah / Who stand by night in the house of Jehovah.

2.text: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, / And bless Jehovah.

3.text: May Jehovah, who made heaven and earth, / Bless you from Zion.

1.text: Hallelujah! Praise the name of Jehovah; / Praise Him, you servants of Jehovah,

2.text: Who stand in the house of Jehovah, / In the courts of the house of our God.

3.text: Praise Jehovah, for Jehovah is good; / Sing psalms to His name, for it is pleasant.

4.text: For Jehovah has chosen Jacob for Himself, / Israel for His personal treasure.

5.text: For I know that Jehovah is great / And that our Lord is above all gods.

6.text: Whatever Jehovah pleases He does / In heaven and on earth, / In the seas and all the depths.

7.text: He causes the vapors to ascend from the ends of the earth; / He makes lightning for the rain; / He brings forth wind from His treasuries.

8.text: He struck the firstborn of Egypt, / Both of man and of beast.

9.text: He sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt, / Upon Pharaoh and all his servants.

10.text: He struck many nations / And slew mighty kings:

11.text: Sihon the king of the Amorites / And Og the king of Bashan / And all the kingdoms of Canaan.

12.text: And He gave their land as an inheritance, / An inheritance to Israel His people.

13.text: O Jehovah, Your name is forever; / O Jehovah, Your memorial is from generation to generation.

14.text: For Jehovah will execute judgment for His people, / And He will have compassion concerning His servants.

15.text: The idols of the nations are mere silver and gold, / The work of human hands.

16.text: They have mouths, but they do not speak; / They have eyes, but they do not see.

17.text: They have ears, but they do not give ear; / And there is no breath in their mouths.

18.text: Those who make them, / All who trust in them, / Will be like them.

19.text: O house of Israel, bless Jehovah. / O house of Aaron, bless Jehovah.

20.text: O house of Levi, bless Jehovah. / O you who fear Jehovah, bless Jehovah.

21.text: Blessed be Jehovah from Zion, / Who dwells in Jerusalem. / Hallelujah.

1.text: Give thanks to Jehovah, for He is good; / For His lovingkindness is forever.

2.text: Give thanks to the God of gods, / For His lovingkindness is forever.

3.text: Give thanks to the Lord of lords, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

4.text: To Him who alone does great wonders, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

5.text: To Him who by understanding made the heavens, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

6.text: To Him who spread forth the earth over the waters, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

7.text: To Him who made the great lights, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

8.text: The sun for ruling the day, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

9.text: The moon and the stars for ruling the night, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

10.text: To Him who struck Egypt in their firstborn, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

11.text: And brought forth Israel from their midst, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

12.text: With a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

13.text: To Him who divided the Red Sea apart, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

14.text: And brought Israel over through the midst of it, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

15.text: And shook off Pharaoh and his force into the Red Sea, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

16.text: To Him who marched His people through the wilderness, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

17.text: To Him who struck great kings, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

18.text: And slew majestic kings, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

19.text: Sihon the king of the Amorites, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

20.text: And Og the king of Bashan, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

21.text: And gave their land as an inheritance, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

22.text: An inheritance to Israel His servant, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

23.text: Who remembered us in our low estate, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

24.text: And rescued us from our adversaries, / For His lovingkindness is forever;

25.text: Who gives food to all flesh, / For His lovingkindness is forever.

26.text: Give thanks to the God of heaven, / For His lovingkindness is forever.

1.text: By the rivers of Babylon, / There we sat down; indeed, we wept / When we remembered Zion.

2.text: On the willows in the midst of it / We hung up our lyres,

3.text: For there our captors required of us songs, / And those who tormented us required of us mirth, saying, / Sing for us / One of the songs of Zion.

4.text: How can we sing the song of Jehovah / In a foreign land?

5.text: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, / Let my right hand forget its skill.

6.text: Let my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth, / If I do not remember you, / If I do not prefer Jerusalem / Above my chief joy.

7.text: Remember, O Jehovah, / Against the children of Edom, / The day of Jerusalem, / Who said, Lay it bare! Lay it bare, / Down to its foundation!

8.text: O daughter of Babylon, who are to be devastated, / Happy will he be who repays you / The recompense of what you have rendered to us.

9.text: Happy will he be who seizes your little ones / And dashes them against the rock.

1.text: I will give You thanks with all my heart; / Before the gods I will sing psalms to You.

2.text: I will bow toward Your holy temple / And give thanks to Your name / For Your lovingkindness and Your truth, / For You have magnified Your word above all Your name.

3.text: On the day that I called out, You answered me; / You encouraged me with strength in my soul.

4.text: All the kings of the earth will give thanks to You, O Jehovah; / For they have heard the words of Your mouth.

5.text: And they will sing of the ways of Jehovah, / For great is the glory of Jehovah.

6.text: For though Jehovah is high, He regards the lowly; / And the haughty He knows from afar.

7.text: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, / You will preserve me; / Against the wrath of my enemies You will stretch out Your hand, / And Your right hand will save me.

8.text: Jehovah will complete that which concerns me. / O Jehovah, Your lovingkindness is forever; / Do not forsake the works of Your own hands.

1.text: O Jehovah, You have searched me and known me.

2.text: You know when I sit down and when I rise up; / You understand my thoughts from afar.

3.text: You thoroughly search my path and my lying down, / And You are acquainted with all my ways.

4.text: For a word is not yet on my tongue, / And already You, O Jehovah, know it completely.

5.text: You have closed in on me behind and before / And have laid Your hand on me.

6.text: Oh, knowledge too wonderful for me! / It is so high; I cannot attain to it.

7.text: Where shall I go, away from Your Spirit, / And where shall I flee from Your presence?

8.text: If I ascend into heaven, You are there; / If I make my bed in Sheol, there You are.

9.text: If I take the wings of the dawn / And settle at the limits of the sea,

10.text: There also Your hand will lead me, / And Your right hand will take hold of me.

11.text: And if I say, Surely darkness will cover me, / And the light around me will be night;

12.text: Even the darkness is not dark to You, / And night shines like day; / The darkness is like the light.

13.text: For it was You who formed my inward parts; / You wove me together in my mother's womb.

14.text: I will praise You, for I am awesomely and wonderfully made; / Your works are wonderful, / And my soul knows it well.

15.text: My frame was not hidden from You / When I was made in secret, / Skillfully fashioned in the depths of the earth.

16.text: Your eyes saw my unformed substance; / And in Your book all of them were written: / The days that were ordained for me, / When not one of them was yet.

17.text: And how precious are Your thoughts to me, O God! / How great is the sum of them!

18.text: If I should count them, they would be more than the sand. / When I awake, I am still with You.

19.text: Oh that You, O God, would slay the wicked -- / Depart from me therefore, you men of bloodshed --

20.text: Those who speak of You with evil intent, / Who as Your enemies take Your name in vain.

21.text: Do I not hate those who hate You, O Jehovah? / And do I not loathe those who rise up against You?

22.text: I hate them with a perfect hatred; / They have become my own enemies.

23.text: Search me, O God, and know my heart; / Try me, and know my anxious thoughts;

24.text: And see if there is some harmful way in me, / And lead me on the eternal way.

1.text: Deliver me, O Jehovah, from evil men; / From violent men preserve me;

2.text: Who devise evil schemes in their hearts / And continually stir up wars.

3.text: They have sharpened their tongues like that of a serpent; / The poison of adders is under their lips. Selah

4.text: Keep me, O Jehovah, from the hands of the wicked; / From violent men preserve me; / Who devise schemes to thrust me down.

5.text: The proud have hidden a trap for me and cords; / They have spread a net by the wayside; / They have set snares for me. Selah

6.text: I said to Jehovah, You are my God; / Give ear, O Jehovah, to the voice of my supplications.

7.text: O Jehovah Lord, strength of my salvation, / You have covered my head in the day of battle.

8.text: O Jehovah, do not grant the desires of the wicked man; / Do not let his evil scheme advance, / Lest he be exalted. Selah

9.text: As for the head of those who surround me, / May the mischief of their own lips cover them.

10.text: May burning coals drop down upon them; / May they be thrown down into the fire, / Into deep pits, never to rise again.

11.text: Let no slanderer be established in the land; / Let evil hunt down the violent man speedily.

12.text: I know that Jehovah will maintain the cause of the afflicted / And justice for the needy.

13.text: Surely the righteous will give thanks to Your name; / The upright will dwell in Your presence.

1.text: O Jehovah, I have called upon You; hasten to me. / Give ear to my voice when I call out to You.

2.text: Let my prayer be set before You as incense, / The lifting up of my hands as the evening offering.

3.text: Set a watch, O Jehovah, before my mouth; / Keep the door of my lips.

4.text: Do not let my heart turn to anything evil, / To practice deeds of wickedness / With men who commit iniquity; / And let me not eat of their delicacies.

5.text: Let the righteous strike me in kindness and reprove me; / Let not my head refuse oil upon the head, / For still my prayer is against their evil deeds.

6.text: Their judges are thrown down by the sides of the rock, / And they hear my words, that they are pleasant.

7.text: As when one plows and breaks up the earth, / Our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.

8.text: For my eyes are upon You, O Jehovah Lord; / In You I take refuge; do not pour out my soul.

9.text: Keep me from the trap they have set for me / And from the snares of the workers of iniquity.

10.text: May the wicked fall into their own nets / While I alone pass by.

1.text: With my voice I cry to Jehovah; / With my voice I make my supplication to Jehovah.

2.text: I pour out my complaint before Him; / I declare my trouble before Him.

3.text: When my spirit fainted within me, / You knew my path. / On the way on which I walked / They have hidden a trap for me.

4.text: Look on my right hand and see, / For there is no one who regards me; / Refuge has failed me; / No one cares for me.
