5.text: I cried to You, O Jehovah; / I said, You are my refuge, / My portion in the land of the living.

6.text: Give heed to my cry, / For I have been brought very low; / Deliver me from those who persecute me, / For they are stronger than I.

7.text: Bring my soul out of prison, / That I may give thanks to Your name. / The righteous will surround me, / For You will deal bountifully with me.

1.text: O Jehovah, hear my prayer; / Give ear to my supplications; / Answer me in Your faithfulness and in Your righteousness;

2.text: And do not enter into judgment with Your servant, / For no one alive is righteous in Your sight.

3.text: For the enemy has persecuted my soul; / He has crushed my life down to the ground; / He has caused me to dwell in dark places, like those who have been long dead.

4.text: Therefore my spirit faints within me; / My heart is appalled in the midst of me.

5.text: I remember the days of old; / I meditate upon all that You have done; / I muse upon the work of Your hands.

6.text: I spread out my hands to You; / My soul thirsts for You like a parched land. Selah

7.text: Hurry and answer me, O Jehovah; / My spirit fails. / Do not hide Your face from me, / Lest I become like those who go down into the pit.

8.text: Cause me to hear Your lovingkindness in the morning, / For in You I trust. / Make known to me the way on which I should walk, / For to You I lift up my soul.

9.text: Deliver me from my enemies, O Jehovah; / I have fled to You for a refuge.

10.text: Teach me to do Your will, / For You are my God; / Let Your good Spirit lead me / In a plain country.

11.text: For Your name's sake, O Jehovah, preserve me alive; / In Your righteousness bring my soul out of trouble.

12.text: And in Your lovingkindness cut off my enemies / And destroy all those who oppress my soul, / For I am Your servant.

1.text: Blessed be Jehovah my rock, / Who teaches my hands for war / And my fingers for battle:

2.text: My Lord of lovingkindness and my fortress, / My high retreat and my Deliverer, / My shield and He in whom I take refuge, / Who subdues my people under me.

3.text: O Jehovah, what is man, that You take knowledge of him, / And the son of mortal man, that You think of him?

4.text: Man is like a breath; / His days are like a passing shadow.

5.text: O Jehovah, bow Your heavens down and descend; / Touch the mountains, and they will smoke.

6.text: Flash forth lightning, and scatter them; / Send forth Your arrows, and discomfit them.

7.text: Stretch forth Your hand from on high; / Rescue me and deliver me / From the great waters, / From the hand of foreigners,

8.text: Whose mouth speaks deceit, / And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

9.text: O God, I will sing a new song to You; / Upon a harp of ten strings I will sing psalms to You,

10.text: Who gives salvation to kings, / Who rescues David His servant from the hurtful sword.

11.text: Rescue me and deliver me from the hand of foreigners, / Whose mouth speaks deceit, / And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

12.text: May our sons be like plants / Grown up in their youth; / May our daughters be like corner pillars / Hewn out in fashion for a palace;

13.text: May our barns be full, / Furnishing produce of all kinds; / May our sheep bring forth thousands / And ten thousands in our fields;

14.text: May our oxen be fully laden; / May there be no breaking in to rob or going forth to fight, / Or outcry in our streets.

15.text: Blessed are the people who are so; / Blessed are the people whose God is Jehovah.

1.text: I will extol You, O my God and King; / And I will bless Your name forever and ever.

2.text: Every day I will bless You, / And I will praise Your name forever and ever.

3.text: Great is Jehovah, and much to be praised; / And His greatness is unsearchable.

4.text: One generation will laud Your works to another, / And they will declare Your mighty acts.

5.text: Upon the glorious splendor of Your majesty / And upon Your wondrous works I will muse.

6.text: And men will speak of the might of Your awesome deeds, / And I will declare Your greatness.

7.text: They will utter the memory of Your great goodness / And will sing for joy of Your righteousness.

8.text: Jehovah is gracious and compassionate, / Long-suffering and great in lovingkindness.

9.text: Jehovah is good to all, / And His compassions are upon all His works.

10.text: All Your works will praise You, O Jehovah; / And Your faithful ones will bless You.

11.text: They will speak of the glory of Your kingdom / And tell of Your power,

12.text: To make known to the sons of men Your mighty acts / And the glorious splendor of Your kingdom.

13.text: Your kingdom is an eternal kingdom, / And Your dominion is throughout all generations.

14.text: Jehovah upholds all who are falling / And raises up all who are bowed down.

15.text: The eyes of everyone wait for You, / And You give them their food in due season.

16.text: You open up Your hand / And satisfy the desire of every living thing.

17.text: Jehovah is righteous in all His ways, / And faithfully kind in all His doings.

18.text: Jehovah is near to all who call upon Him, / To all who call upon Him in truth.

19.text: He will fulfill the desire of those who fear Him, / And He will hear their cry and save them.

20.text: Jehovah preserves all who love Him, / But He will destroy all the wicked.

21.text: My mouth will speak the praise of Jehovah, / And all flesh will bless His holy name forever and ever.

1.text: Hallelujah! / Praise Jehovah, O my soul!

2.text: I will praise Jehovah while I live; / I will sing psalms to my God while I yet have being.

3.text: Do not trust in princes, / In a son of man, with whom there is no salvation.

4.text: His breath goes forth; he returns to his earth; / On that day his plans perish.

5.text: Blessed is the man whose help is the God of Jacob, / Whose hope is in Jehovah his God,

6.text: Who made heaven and earth / And the sea, and all that is in them; / Who keeps faith forever;

7.text: Who executes judgment for the oppressed; / Who gives food to the famished. / Jehovah frees the prisoners;

8.text: Jehovah opens the eyes of the blind; / Jehovah raises up those who are bowed down; / Jehovah loves the righteous;

9.text: Jehovah preserves the sojourners; / He upholds the orphan and the widow; / But He subverts the way of the wicked.

10.text: Jehovah will reign forever, / Your God, O Zion, forever and ever. / Hallelujah!

1.text: Hallelujah! / For it is good to sing psalms to our God; / For it is pleasant; praise is fitting.

2.text: Jehovah builds up Jerusalem; / He gathers the outcasts of Israel.

3.text: He heals the brokenhearted / And binds up their wounds.

4.text: He counts the number of the stars; / He calls them all by their names.

5.text: Great is our Lord, and mighty in power; / His understanding is infinite.

6.text: Jehovah uplifts the lowly; / He brings the wicked down to the ground.

7.text: Sing unto Jehovah with thanksgiving; / Sing psalms to our God with the lyre;

8.text: Who covers the heavens with clouds, / Who prepares rain for the earth, / Who causes grass to grow on the mountains,

9.text: Who gives to the beast its food, / And to the young ravens who cry.

10.text: He takes no delight in the strength of horses; / Nor pleasure in the legs of man.

11.text: Jehovah takes pleasure in those who fear Him, / In those who hope in His lovingkindness.

12.text: Laud Jehovah, O Jerusalem; / Praise your God, O Zion;

13.text: For He has strengthened the bars of your gates; / He has blessed your children within you.

14.text: He makes peace in your borders; / He satisfies you with the finest wheat.

15.text: He sends forth His command to the earth; / His word runs very swiftly.

16.text: He gives snow like wool; / He scatters frost like ashes;

17.text: He casts His hail like crumbs -- / Who can stand before His cold?

18.text: He sends forth His word and melts them; / He causes His wind to blow; the waters flow.

19.text: He declares His word to Jacob, / His statutes and His ordinances to Israel.

20.text: He has not dealt so with any other nation; / And as for His ordinances, they have not known them. / Hallelujah!

1.text: Hallelujah! / Praise Jehovah from the heavens; / Praise Him in the heights.

2.text: Praise Him, all His angels; / Praise Him, all His hosts.

3.text: Praise Him, sun and moon; / Praise Him, all stars of light.

4.text: Praise Him, you heaven of heavens, / And you waters that are above the heavens.

5.text: Let them praise the name of Jehovah; / For He commanded, and they were created.

6.text: And He established them forever and ever; / He gave the decree which shall not pass away.

7.text: Praise Jehovah from the earth, / You sea monsters and all the depths;

8.text: Fire and hail, snow and smoke; / Stormy wind that executes His word;

9.text: Mountains and all hills; / Fruit trees and all cedars;

10.text: All animals wild and tame; / Creeping things and birds of flight;

11.text: Kings of the earth and all peoples; / Princes and all judges of the earth;

12.text: Choice young men as well as virgins; / Old men with young men.

13.text: Let them praise the name of Jehovah, / For His name alone is exalted; / His glory is above the earth and the heavens.

14.text: And He has raised up a horn for His people, / The praise of all His faithful ones, / The children of Israel, a people near to Him. / Hallelujah!

1.text: Hallelujah! / Sing a new song to Jehovah; / Sing His praise in the congregation of His faithful ones.

2.text: Let Israel rejoice in his Maker; / Let the children of Zion exult in their King.

3.text: Let them praise His name with dancing; / Let them sing psalms to Him with the tambourine and the lyre.

4.text: For Jehovah takes pleasure in His people; / He adorns the lowly with salvation.

5.text: Let the faithful ones exult in glory; / Let them give a ringing shout upon their beds.

6.text: Let the high praises of God be in their throats, / And a two-edged sword in their hand,

7.text: To execute vengeance on the nations / And punishment among the peoples;

8.text: To bind their kings with fetters / And their nobles with chains of iron;

9.text: To execute upon them the judgment written. / This honor is for all His faithful ones. / Hallelujah!

1.text: Hallelujah! / Praise God in His sanctuary; / Praise Him in the expanse that manifests His power.

2.text: Praise Him for His mighty acts; / Praise Him according to His vast greatness.

3.text: Praise Him with the blast of the trumpet; / Praise Him with the harp and lyre;

4.text: Praise Him with the tambourine and with dancing; / Praise Him with the stringed instrument and the pipe.

5.text: Praise Him with the loud cymbals; / Praise Him with the loud clanging cymbals.

6.text: Let everything that has breath praise Jehovah. / Hallelujah!
